original: @1b # // dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: @1b # // dbang bskur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u dgu pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the ninth chapter begins with the consecration, etc.

original: rmad du byung ba'i bya bas kyang zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i spyod pa'i bya bas so //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i bya bas kyang zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i spyod pa'i bya bas so //
translated: Even by the performance of the marvelous means by the performance of the conduct that is contrary to the world.

original: byang chub sgrub pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sgrub pa zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi phyag rgya chen po'i sku rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The attainment of enlightenment is the completion of the body of the great seal of Vajradhara.

original: dgos pa ni 'di yin te gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba thob nas de'i dus su rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgos pa ni 'di yin te gsang ba'i dbang bskur ba thob nas de'i dus su rdo rje 'chang chen po de nyid 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: The purpose is this: Having obtained the secret consecration, at that time, in order to accomplish that very Great Vajradhara,

original: stobs kyi sbyor bas byang chub bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: stobs kyi sbyor bas byang chub bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: enlightenment is to be attained by the application of power.

original: de'i phyir le'u brgyad pa'i yan lag tu gyur ba'i le'u dgu pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir le'u brgyad pa'i yan lag tu gyur ba'i le'u dgu pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ninth chapter is a branch of the eighth chapter.

original: nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyis na zhes pa ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po dang thams cad stong pa ste stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can gyis na zhes pa ni stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang stong pa chen po dang thams cad stong pa ste stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The four space-like natures are the four emptinesses: emptiness, great emptiness, ultimate emptiness, and emptiness of emptiness.

original: yang na rus sbal ma dang zla ba ma dang lha sbyin ma dang nor rgyal ma ste bha ga'i shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la gnas pa ste 'byung ba'i rtsa'o //
analyzed: yang na rus sbal ma dang zla ba ma dang lha sbyin ma dang nor rgyal ma ste bha ga'i shar phyogs la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams la gnas pa ste 'byung ba'i rtsa'o //
translated: Or, the channels of the elements are located in the east, etc., of the bhaga, namely, the channels of the tortoise, moon, god, and wealth.

original: dbus su 'dod pa'i gdugs te dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbus su 'dod pa'i gdugs te dpal rdo rje 'chang chen po'i rang bzhin no //
translated: In the center is the parasol of desire, the nature of glorious great Vajradhara.

original: de ltar nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de ltar nam mkha' bzhi'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Thus, it is the nature of the four spaces.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
analyzed: bha ga'i dbus su nam mkha' gang //
translated: Space is in the center of the bhaga.

original: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga yis brgyan pa ste //
translated: It is adorned by the five spaces.

original: lte ba dang ni ze'u 'brur ldan //üîΩ'dab @2a * //
analyzed: lte ba dang ni ze'u 'brur ldan // 'dab @2a * //
translated: It has a navel and a pericarp.

original: ma rnam pa brgyad kyis mdzes //
analyzed: ma rnam pa brgyad kyis mdzes //
translated: It is beautified by eight petals.

original: thig le'i gzugs can bdud rtsi ni //
analyzed: thig le'i gzugs can bdud rtsi ni //
translated: The nectar, which has the form of a drop,

original: der gnas rtag tu 'dzag par byed //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der gnas rtag tu 'dzag par byed // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: always drips there.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And:

original: nam mkha' nam mkha' dang sbyor ba //
analyzed: nam mkha' nam mkha' dang sbyor ba //
translated: Space is united with space.

original: thams cad nam mkha' nam mkha' che ;
analyzed: thams cad nam mkha' nam mkha' che ;
translated: Everything is space, space is great.

original: / zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: / zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus, it is said.

original: de nyid kyis na zhes pa la mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhes pa la mi 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, it is indestructible.

original: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs par rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bya ba'i rgyud la sogs par rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi zhes pa ni /
translated: Those who are engaged in Action Tantra and so forth means

original: dpal sgrol ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dpal sgrol ma 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rgyud rnams la rab tu zhugs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: those who are engaged in the Tantra of the Arising of Sri Tara and so forth.

original: dbang bskur ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyud de la 'jug pa rnams kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang bskur lnga dang spyod pa'i rgyud la 'jug pa rnams kyi de nyid brgyad dang / rnal 'byor rgyud la 'jug pa rnams kyi de nyid de 'on kyang sems ma rdo rje la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dbang bskur ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: dbang bskur ba'i spyod pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba'i rgyud de la 'jug pa rnams kyi bum pa la sogs pa'i dbang bskur lnga dang spyod pa'i rgyud la 'jug pa rnams kyi de nyid brgyad dang / rnal 'byor rgyud la 'jug pa rnams kyi de nyid de 'on kyang sems ma rdo rje la sogs pa'i dbang po'i dbang bskur ni bzhi'o //
translated: The conduct of initiation is the five initiations of the vase and so forth for those who are engaged in Action Tantra, the eight realities for those who are engaged in Performance Tantra, and the four initiations of the sense organs of Sattvavajra and so forth for those who are engaged in Yoga Tantra.

original: 'dir bzhi ni rab tu phye na bcu bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir bzhi ni rab tu phye na bcu bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the four are distinguished as fourteen.

original: de rnams kyi steng na gnas pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi spyod pa thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi steng na gnas pas zhes pa ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud kyi spyod pa thams cad kyi mchog yin pas so //
translated: Since they are located above those, they are the supreme of all the conducts of the Great Yoga Tantra.

original: dngos grub 'dod pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'dod pas so //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub 'dod pas so //
translated: Those who desire powers means those who desire mundane powers such as pacification and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa zhes pa ni thams cad bsu bar byed pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa drug pa zhes pa ni thams cad bsu bar byed pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The sixth tathƒÅgata means the Blessed One Vajradhara, who is the one who welcomes all.

original: sbyar ro zhes pa ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i tshig dag gi @2b 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sbyar ro zhes pa ni bya ba dang byed pa po'i tshig dag gi @2b 'brel pa'o //
translated: The word apply is the connection between the words action and agent.

original: bdag nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi longs spyod la zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi bde ba chen po myong ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi longs spyod la zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa'i sku gsung thugs kyi bde ba chen po myong ba'o //
translated: The line to the enjoyment of one's own body, speech, and mind means the experience of the great bliss of body, speech, and mind of the practitioner who is connected with yoga.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re'i sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa re re'i sku la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The line Vairocana and so forth means that each of the bodies of Vairocana and so forth are the nature of body and so forth.

original: shin tu rmad du byung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang gzhan gyi bud med la 'gro ba dang brdzun smra ba dang tshig rtsub mo'i sgo nas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rmad du byung ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang gzhan gyi bud med la 'gro ba dang brdzun smra ba dang tshig rtsub mo'i sgo nas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob par byed pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúextremely marvelous ma·πá·∏çala‚Äù is the attainment of the state of glorious Vajradhara through killing, stealing, going to another‚Äôs wife, lying, and harsh words.

original: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi spyod yul yin gyi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i gang zag dam pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin pas so //
analyzed: rin po che lta bu'i gang zag gi spyod yul yin gyi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i gang zag dam pa rnams kyi spyod yul yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe domain of the jewel-like person‚Äù is the domain of the sublime persons of sharp faculties.

original: gzhan sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs pa dag ces pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs pa dag ces pa ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: skrag par byed pas zhes bya ba ni bsdigs par byed pas so //
analyzed: skrag par byed pas zhes bya ba ni bsdigs par byed pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúTerrifying‚Äù means threatening.

analyzed: bsdigs pa de yang srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i tsha ba'i rnam par smin pa thob pas so //

original: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i bsngags pa rnams kyis 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba byed pas byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i bsngags pa rnams kyis 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba byed pas byang chub nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By means of the praises endowed with skill in means, one acts in a way that is not contradictory, and so one attains enlightenment itself.

original: dge ba'am ni mi dge ba //
analyzed: dge ba'am ni mi dge ba //
translated: Whether virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: byang chub sems dpa' brtags pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' brtags pa yis //

analyzed: thams cad dge ba nyid 'gyur te // gang phyir de rnams yid dbang po //

analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mi bstan pa ni zhes pa la /

analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //

original: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //
analyzed: nam mkha'i dbyings kyi dbus gnas pa //

analyzed: zhes pa nas brtsams te /

analyzed: gzhan du sdig pa'i yul yin no //

translated: Up to this point, through the concentration of Vajra Mind, the Buddha taught the means of birth in the buddhafield of Akshobhya through the means of wrathful action for those who harm the three jewels, commit the five heinous acts, and so on.

original: // de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: // de la rim pa ni 'di yin te /

original: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: re zhig dang po rnal 'byor pas //
translated: First, the yogi

original: @3a * // rang gi phyag la 'bar pa'i phreng bas khyab pa rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje rnam par bsams la /

translated: Having supplicated the tathagatas residing in space and having gained their attention, one should recall the ripening of karma, the suffering of Avici hell, and with the intention to rescue that being, one should visualize the blazing vajra at one's heart.

original: ba chos 'byung gi nang nas 'byung ba /üîΩde'i dbus na gnas pa'i gru gsum pa 'bar ba'i 'od kyis gdung bar bya ba padma'i nang du zhugs pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje 'bar bas phye mar brlag bar bya ba rang gi snying ga la gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje yang dag gi lam nas spros te
analyzed: ba chos 'byung gi nang nas 'byung ba / de'i dbus na gnas pa'i gru gsum pa 'bar ba'i 'od kyis gdung bar bya ba padma'i nang du zhugs pa'i gsang ba'i rdo rje 'bar bas phye mar brlag bar bya ba rang gi snying ga la gnas pa'i 'bar ba'i rdo rje yang dag gi lam nas spros te
translated: The wind mandala that moves from within the source of phenomenaüîΩblazes in the center of that, and one should be tormented by the blazing light.üîΩHaving entered the lotus in the center of that, the blazing secret vajra should be pulverized.üîΩHaving emanated the blazing vajra that resides in one's heart through the path of the avadhuti,

Imagine that emanations from that purify the realms of sentient beings who engage in hatred, and then return to the form of Ak·π£hobhya.

translated: Those refers to the disciples who are difficult to tame.

original: sku la sogs pa ni rdo rje gsum po des phye mar brlag par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa ni rdo rje gsum po des phye mar brlag par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that their bodies and so forth are reduced to dust by those three vajras.

original: thugs kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thugs kyi dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba ste zhes pa ni /
translated: One will attain the spiritual power of the mind.

original: bsgrub bya dpal rdo rje thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dpal rdo rje thugs kyi rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa'o //
translated: This means that the disciples attain the state of glorious Vajra Mind, Vajradhara.

original: rdo rje gsang ba 'di lta bus //
analyzed: rdo rje gsang ba 'di lta bus //
translated: With such a secret vajra,

original: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje dang snying ga'i rdo rje dang phyag mtshan gyi rdo rje gsum gyis mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i sems can thams cad brlag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gsang ba'i rdo rje dang snying ga'i rdo rje dang phyag mtshan gyi rdo rje gsum gyis mtshams med pa lnga byed pa'i sems can thams cad brlag par bya'o //
translated: This refers to the three vajras: the secret vajra, the vajra at the heart, and the hand implement vajra. With these, all sentient beings who commit the five acts of immediate retribution should be destroyed.

original: bsam gtan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi khyad par zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits are taught by the verse beginning with the special meditative concentration, and so forth.

original: mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du zhes pa ni mngon par dga' ba la'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du zhes pa ni mngon par dga' ba la'o //
translated: The phrase in the buddha-field of Akshobhya refers to Abhirati.

original: rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa ni rgyal ba dang / rgyal ba'i sras ni rgyal sras te /
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras zhes pa ni rgyal ba dang / rgyal ba'i sras ni rgyal sras te /
translated: The phrase sons of the victors refers to the victors and the sons of the victors.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They will be born as buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The phrase this is the rule and so on concludes.

original: 'dir gang zhig gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir gang zhig gcig pu zhes bya ba la sogs pas lung tshad ma nyid du bstan te /
translated: Here, the validity of the scriptural tradition is taught by the passage beginning with the words,

original: gal te gcig pu ni gdul bar dka' ba skye bo thams cad la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gcig pu ni gdul bar dka' ba skye bo thams cad la 'tshe bar byed pa'o //
translated: If a single person is difficult to subdue, he will harm all people.

original: bsad na ni de gdon ba'i phyir srog dang bral bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsad na ni de gdon ba'i phyir srog dang bral bar bya ba'o //
translated: If he is killed, he will be deprived of life in order to be freed.

original: mang po bde bar 'gyur ba ni bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de yin pas so //
analyzed: mang po bde bar 'gyur ba ni bde ba dang ldan par gyur pa gang yin pa de yin pas so //
translated: If many people are happy, they will be endowed with happiness.

original: bsod nams kyi phung po chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi phung po chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: A great mass of merit will result.

original: gzhan du ni gal te de ltar ma byas na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni gal te de ltar ma byas na /
translated: Otherwise, if it is not done in this way,

original: 'phran tshegs la dmigs pa tsam gyis pha rol gyi skyon mthong nas mngon spyod byed na de'i tshe sdig pa'i phul du 'gyur te snying rje dang phral bas so //
analyzed: 'phran tshegs la dmigs pa tsam gyis pha rol gyi skyon mthong nas mngon spyod byed na de'i tshe sdig pa'i phul du 'gyur te snying rje dang phral bas so //
translated: If one performs sorcery after seeing the faults of an enemy through merely observing minor faults, then that is the worst of sins, because one is separated from compassion.

original: srog gcod pas ni mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog gcod pas ni mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Through killing, one experiences the suffering of Avƒ´ci Hell.

original: srog gcod pa ni ma rungs pa //
analyzed: srog gcod pa ni ma rungs pa //
translated: Killing is a cruel,

original: drag po lag pa khrag gis byugs //
analyzed: drag po lag pa khrag gis byugs //
translated: violent act, with bloody hands.

original: sdig pa'i las ni kun du spyod //
analyzed: sdig pa'i las ni kun du spyod //
translated: One engages in sinful actions,

original: du 'bod la ni skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: du 'bod la ni skye bar 'gyur // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: and is born in the Sa·πÉjƒ´va hell.

original: 'o na ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis gsod pa de yang dmyal ba'i rgyur ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis gsod pa de yang dmyal ba'i rgyur ji ltar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that killing through the power of samƒÅdhi does not become a cause of hell?

original: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhe sdang las byung ba'i gsod pa mi byed cing 'on kyang snying rje chen po las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos zhe sdang las byung ba'i gsod pa mi byed cing 'on kyang snying rje chen po las 'byung ba'o //
translated: We say: Bodhisattvas do not kill through hatred, but rather through great compassion.

original: snying rje chen po yang tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid can bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu nyid du @4a * //
analyzed: snying rje chen po yang tshad med pa'i mtshan nyid can bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi rgyu nyid du @4a * //
translated: Great compassion also has the characteristic of being immeasurable, and is the cause of the accumulation of merit.

original: 'gyur ro // de bas na bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis mi dge ba yang dge bar 'gyur ba dang / dge ba yang mi dge bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // de bas na bsam pa'i khyad par gyi dbang gis mi dge ba yang dge bar 'gyur ba dang / dge ba yang mi dge bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, by the power of the difference in thought, even non-virtue becomes virtue, and virtue becomes non-virtue.

original: sbyin pa btang bas sbyin pa'i 'gyod pa skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa btang bas sbyin pa'i 'gyod pa skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the case of regret arising from giving a gift.

original: dge ba'am ni mi dge ba //
analyzed: dge ba'am ni mi dge ba //
translated: Whether virtuous or non-virtuous,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i rtog pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i rtog pa yis //
translated: by the thought of the Bodhisattva,

original: thams cad dge ba nyid gyur te //üîΩgang phyir de rnams yid dbang ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad dge ba nyid gyur te // gang phyir de rnams yid dbang ba'o //
translated: all become virtuous,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: because they are under the power of his mind.

original: gzhan yang nang na snying rjes khyab pa'i phyi rol du gzugs 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'gro ba 'dul bar byed pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan yang nang na snying rjes khyab pa'i phyi rol du gzugs 'gyur ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'gro ba 'dul bar byed pa ste //
translated: Moreover, externally, the Bodhisattvas who are pervaded within by compassion transform the forms of beings and tame them.

original: ji skad du /üîΩnyi ma'i 'od kyis gdungs pa'i mtsho chen po //
analyzed: ji skad du / nyi ma'i 'od kyis gdungs pa'i mtsho chen po //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe great lake heated by the sun's rays,

original: mtshungs pa'i sku ldan khros pa'i snying rje che //
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i sku ldan khros pa'i snying rje che //
translated: with a body like the rising sun, with great compassion,

original: nang na gangs ltar shin tu grang ba ste //
analyzed: nang na gangs ltar shin tu grang ba ste //
translated: In the interior, it is extremely cold, like snow.

original: 'gro ba 'dul phyir phyi rol du ni tsha //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'dul phyir phyi rol du ni tsha //
translated: In order to tame beings, it is hot in the exterior.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gzhan yang mngon spyod yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang mngon spyod yin mod kyi /
translated: Moreover, it is indeed wrathful action.

original: 'on kyang yan lag lnga po'i srog gcod pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang bas srog gcod pa ma yin no zhes lung las gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang yan lag lnga po'i srog gcod pa'i yan lag gcig ma tshang bas srog gcod pa ma yin no zhes lung las gsungs so //
translated: However, since one of the five branches, killing, is incomplete, it is not killing. Thus it is stated in the scriptures.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma ma lus pa rab tu bcom pa sems kyi rgyud thugs rje chen pos tshim pa /üîΩmnar med pa'i sdug bsngal las gdul bar dka' ba'i sems can rnams gdon par dka' ba 'ba' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' ma yin gyi ji srid mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la de rnams rab tu gnas par 'dod pa sngags dang phyag rgya dang
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dri ma ma lus pa rab tu bcom pa sems kyi rgyud thugs rje chen pos tshim pa / mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal las gdul bar dka' ba'i sems can rnams gdon par dka' ba 'ba' zhig tu byang chub sems dpa' ma yin gyi ji srid mngon par dga' ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la de rnams rab tu gnas par 'dod pa sngags dang phyag rgya dang
translated: The continuum of mind, which has completely destroyed all stains of conceptuality, is satisfied by great compassion.üîΩIt is not only the bodhisattvas who are difficult to liberate from the suffering of Avƒ´ci, the beings who are difficult to tame.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas de rnams kyi srog 'gugs par byed pa'i ji ltar sdig pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas de rnams kyi srog 'gugs par byed pa'i ji ltar sdig pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: As long as they desire to abide in the buddha realm of manifest joy, by the stages of mantra, mudra, and samadhi, they summon the life-force of those beings. How could they generate negativity?

original: 'on te sems can ma lus pa'i don bsgrub pas longs spyod dang thar ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes /
analyzed: 'on te sems can ma lus pa'i don bsgrub pas longs spyod dang thar ba'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhes /
translated: Or, by accomplishing the aims of all sentient beings without exception, one will attain the fruit of enjoyment and liberation.

original: bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the summary meaning.

original: yang na 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas mngon spyod byed na yang skyon med de /
analyzed: yang na 'khor gsum rnam par dag pas mngon spyod byed na yang skyon med de /
translated: Or else, if one performs the violent action with the purity of the three spheres, there is no fault.

original: drag po'i nyer 'gro rnam rig ni //
analyzed: drag po'i nyer 'gro rnam rig ni //
translated: The knowledge of the violent rite

original: skad cig yin pas mi 'thad de //
analyzed: skad cig yin pas mi 'thad de //
translated: is not tenable, being momentary.

original: 'on te tshul 'di nyid la ni //
analyzed: 'on te tshul 'di nyid la ni //
translated: But in this very method,

original: gang du bsad bya gsod byed min //
analyzed: gang du bsad bya gsod byed min //
translated: where there is no killer or one to be killed,

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: there is no fault.

original: gti mug gi dam tshig ces pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig go //
analyzed: gti mug gi dam tshig ces pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs kyi dam tshig go //
translated: The pledge of delusion is the pledge of the family of Vairochana.

original: rmongs shing ma rig pa zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rmongs shing ma rig pa zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa'i ye shes kyi rnam grangs so //
translated: Delusion and ignorance are synonyms for the pristine awareness of the attainment of illumination.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par mdzad pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' thob par mdzad pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The performance of the attainment of the limit of reality is the actualization of the reality of clear light.

original: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba'i go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: By the stages of the attainment of light, etc., one realizes the state of clear light.

original: rim pa gnyis pa @4b dang bzhi pa dag gis so //
analyzed: rim pa gnyis pa @4b dang bzhi pa dag gis so //
translated: By the second and fourth stages.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste de nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ste de nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is pure by nature, and for that very reason.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag gis ma gos pa ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dag gis ma gos pa ni zhes pa la /
translated: It is not soiled by merit and demerit.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bag chags dag gis ma reg pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i bag chags dag gis ma reg pa'o //
translated: It is not touched by the instincts of defilement and purification.

original: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das bstan to //
analyzed: des ni zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das bstan to //
translated: By this, he shows the Lord as the identity of the stage of union.

original: ser sna'i nyon mongs ba sel ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa ser sna las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ser sna'i nyon mongs ba sel ba'i bdag nyid kyis zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa ser sna las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The identity of the removal of the defilement of avarice is the characteristic of the turning away from the defilement of avarice.

original: phyin ci ma log pas zhes pa ni mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pas zhes pa ni mi slu ba'o //
translated: By the non-erroneous, he means the non-deceptive.

original: rdzas dgug pa ni ser sna dang bcas pa'i skye bo'i nor dgug pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas dgug pa ni ser sna dang bcas pa'i skye bo'i nor dgug pa'o //
translated: The summoning of the substance is the summoning of the wealth of the avaricious person.

original: bshad zin pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhin no //
analyzed: bshad zin pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhin no //
translated: The explanation is like the meditative stabilizations of Ak·π£hobhya and so forth.

original: 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rang gi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed la de yongs su gyur pa las ji ltar gsungs pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang ldanüîΩpa rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms la /
analyzed: 'khor lo'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas rang gi bdag nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed la de yongs su gyur pa las ji ltar gsungs pa'i dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms la /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthe ma·πá·∏çala of wheels‚Äù and so forth explains that, having generated the body of oneself as Great Vajradhara through the stages of the first-stage yoga, one meditates on Vairochana endowed with the shape, color, and so forth as taught, from the complete transformation of that.

original: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams spros la de rnams kyang ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i mdzod la sogs pa la zhugs nas rang gi ba spu'i bu gnas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis de rnams kyi rin po che
analyzed: dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis dkyil 'khor pa rnams spros la de rnams kyang ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i mdzod la sogs pa la zhugs nas rang gi ba spu'i bu gnas byung ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis de rnams kyi rin po che
translated: Having emanated the ma·πá·∏çala deities through the meditative stabilization of the supreme victor ma·πá·∏çala, those [deities] also enter into the treasure of the miserly person and so forth, and with a mass of light rays that emerge from one‚Äôs pores, they bind those with jewels

original: la sogs pas bcings te /
analyzed: la sogs pas bcings te /
translated: and so forth.

original: rang gi lce las byung ba'i yi ge hr'i: yongs su gyur pa'i lcags kyus bkug la rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskul zhing de bzhin gshegs pa khro bo'i gzugs 'dzin pas bsrung ba /
analyzed: rang gi lce las byung ba'i yi ge hr'i: yongs su gyur pa'i lcags kyus bkug la rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyis bskul zhing de bzhin gshegs pa khro bo'i gzugs 'dzin pas bsrung ba /
translated: The syllable hri·∏•, which arises from one's own tongue, completely transforms into a hook, which summons the mandala of wind, which is urged on by the wrathful form of the Tathagata, who is the protector.

original: rang gi mdzod la 'jug cing gnas par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi mdzod la 'jug cing gnas par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the entry into and abiding in one's own treasury.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku ste dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku ste dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin las bskyed pa'o //
translated: the body of the great seal of Great Vajradhara, which is the branch of the first yoga, is generated from meditative stabilization.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur bas so //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po yongs su gyur bas so //
translated: The transformation of that is the transformation of Great Vajradhara.

original: rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid bsgoms la zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rim pas rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad du bdag nyid bsgoms la zhes pa ni rjes su rnal 'byor dang shin tu rnal 'byor dang rnal 'byor chen po'i rim pas rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Having meditated on oneself as Vairochana, one is complete by the stages of subsequent yoga, very une yoga, and great yoga.

original: dkyil 'khor thams cad ces pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor thams cad ces pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All mandalas are Akshobhya and so forth.

original: dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya 'dus byas pa sngon du 'gro bar dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas spro bar bya'o //üîΩdkar po la sogs pa'i mdog dang ldan pa zhes pa ni dkar po la @5a * //
analyzed: dbyung bar bya'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya 'dus byas pa sngon du 'gro bar dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas spro bar bya'o // dkar po la sogs pa'i mdog dang ldan pa zhes pa ni dkar po la @5a * //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should emit‚Äù means that one should emit by the procedure of the samƒÅdhi of the supreme victor ma·πá·∏çala, preceded by the performance of the seal-impression.

original: sogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i 'od zer dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the color of white, etc.‚Äù means having the light rays of white, etc.

original: rin po che'i rigs zhes pa ni chu shel la sogs pa rin po che'i rigs so //üîΩde yi don du rab sbyor bas //
analyzed: rin po che'i rigs zhes pa ni chu shel la sogs pa rin po che'i rigs so // de yi don du rab sbyor bas //
translated: ‚ÄúThe family of jewels‚Äù means the family of jewels such as water crystal, etc.

original: zhes pa ni de rnams dgug pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de rnams dgug pa'i don du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFor that purpose, one should apply‚Äù means for the purpose of summoning them.

original: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su zhes pa ni rab tu brtag cing gtong ba ste /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams su zhes pa ni rab tu brtag cing gtong ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe tathƒÅgatas Ak·π£obhya, etc.‚Äù means one should imagine and emit them.

original: 'od ces pa ni 'od zer gyi sbyor bas spro bar bya'o //üîΩde nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'od ces pa ni 'od zer gyi sbyor bas spro bar bya'o // de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúLight‚Äù means one should emit by the procedure of light rays.

original: rin po che gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rin po che gang dang gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says, ‚ÄúWhatever jewel, etc.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ni ji ltar dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku la dmigs nas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa de bzhin du kha dog mthun pa la dmigs nas rin po che rnams kyang dgug par bya'o
analyzed: dgongs pa ni ji ltar dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku la dmigs nas zhi ba la sogs pa 'grub pa de bzhin du kha dog mthun pa la dmigs nas rin po che rnams kyang dgug par bya'o
translated: The intention is that just as one accomplishes pacification and so forth by observing the body of Vairochana and so forth endowed with the color white and so forth, in the same way one should summon the jewels by observing the concordant color.

original: // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bka'i 'khor lo bskul ba sngon du 'gro bar rnal 'byor pa'i phrin las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bka'i 'khor lo bskul ba sngon du 'gro bar rnal 'byor pa'i phrin las bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus and so forth explains the activity of the yogi/nƒ´ preceded by the urging of the wheel of command.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdzas dgug pa zhes pa ni ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i nor dgug bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rdzas dgug pa zhes pa ni ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i nor dgug bya'o //
translated: Summoning the substances of the TathƒÅgatas means summoning the wealth of a miserly person.

original: rdo rje gsum ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The three vajras are taught in brief.

original: sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //

analyzed: 'di lta ste ba spu'i bu ga zhes pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa'o //
translated: For example, in the pores and so forth also explains.

original: de yang go sla'o //
analyzed: de yang go sla'o //
translated: That is easy to understand.

original: phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi zad pa'i phyir na zhes pa ni snod dam pa la dbul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan yon bstan par bya ba'i phyir mi zad pa'i phyir na zhes pa ni snod dam pa la dbul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show the benefits, the verse says, ‚Äúbecause it is inexhaustible,‚Äù because it is given to a holy recipient.

original: skyes bu gang gis sangs rgyas la 'bul te //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gis sangs rgyas la 'bul te //
translated: The verse says, ‚ÄúWhatever a person gives to the Buddha,

original: de yi longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa mi zad 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yi longs spyod phun sum tshogs pa mi zad 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: his enjoyment will be inexhaustible.‚Äù

original: yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i don rab tu skyed pa'i nor bu'i bye brag ste zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yid la mngon par 'dod pa'i don rab tu skyed pa'i nor bu'i bye brag ste zhes pa ni /

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i khyim du gang yod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i khyim du gang yod pa'o //
translated: which are in the house of a universal monarch.

original: de dang 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa ste pha rol la rnams kyi yang dbul bo'i sdug bsngal bcom par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ni de dang mtshungs pa ste pha rol la rnams kyi yang dbul bo'i sdug bsngal bcom par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike that‚Äù means similar to that, which is to say, it destroys the suffering of poverty of others.

original: 'o na bsam pa dang dad pa dag gis gzhan la sbyin pa gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba rigs pa yin te /üîΩsbyin pa dad pas dbul bar bya //
analyzed: 'o na bsam pa dang dad pa dag gis gzhan la sbyin pa gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba rigs pa yin te / sbyin pa dad pas dbul bar bya //
translated: Well then, it is reasonable that the result of whatever is given to others by those with intention and faith is connected to them,

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: because it is said, ‚ÄúGive with faith.‚Äù

original: gang zhig dad pa'i sems ma byung ba'i ser sna can gyi nor stobs kyis phrogs pa de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba med na mi zad pa nyid smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: gang zhig dad pa'i sems ma byung ba'i ser sna can gyi nor stobs kyis phrogs pa de'i 'bras bu dang 'brel ba med na mi zad pa nyid smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If the result of the theft of the wealth of a miser who has not generated the thought of faith is not related to him, then what need is there to speak of the inexhaustibility of the result?

original: gang gi phyir dge ba 'am mi dge ba'i las thams cad kyi bya ba yid kyi bya ba dang 'brel pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dge ba 'am mi dge ba'i las thams cad kyi bya ba yid kyi bya ba dang 'brel pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the activity of all virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is related to mental activity, it is endowed with result.

original: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed yod na @5b yang de mngon du ma gyur pas don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi rnam par rig byed yod na @5b yang de mngon du ma gyur pas don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there is bodily and vocal intimation, since it is not manifest, it is meaningless.

original: bzlas pa dka' thub thams cad ni //
analyzed: bzlas pa dka' thub thams cad ni //
translated: All recitations and austerities

original: yun ring du yang byas pa ste //
analyzed: yun ring du yang byas pa ste //
translated: are done for a long time

original: gzhan gyi sems kyis byas pa na //üîΩde nyid rig pas don med gsungs //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyis byas pa na // de nyid rig pas don med gsungs //
translated: but are done by the mind of another.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: One who knows reality says they are meaningless.

original: ser sna can gyi sbyin pa'i sems med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang khros pa'i sogs kyang bskyed te rdzas dbrog par mthong bas so //
analyzed: ser sna can gyi sbyin pa'i sems med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang khros pa'i sogs kyang bskyed te rdzas dbrog par mthong bas so //
translated: Not only is there no thought of giving in a miser, but also, since one sees that wealth is taken away by the angry and so on, it is generated.

original: gang la smod pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: gang la smod pa'i sems bskyed pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The one who generates the thought of contempt is the bodhisattva.

original: byang chub sems dpa' la sems kyis smod pas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la sems kyis smod pas dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: By the thought of contempt for the bodhisattva, one is born in the hells.

original: de ltar yon bdag rgyal ba'i sras la ni //
analyzed: de ltar yon bdag rgyal ba'i sras la ni //
translated: Thus, the benefactor, the Victor‚Äôs son,

original: gang gi rang gi sems kyis smod byed pa ;üîΩ/ smod pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i grangs kyi ni //
analyzed: gang gi rang gi sems kyis smod byed pa ; / smod pa rnams ni 'byung ba'i grangs kyi ni //
translated: By his own mind, is contemptuous.üîΩThe Lord has said that the contemptuous

original: bskal par dmyal bar gnas zhes mgon pos gsungs //
analyzed: bskal par dmyal bar gnas zhes mgon pos gsungs //
translated: Will remain in hell for eons as numerous as the instances of contempt.

original: gal te gang gis yid ni dad gyur na //
analyzed: gal te gang gis yid ni dad gyur na //
translated: But if one‚Äôs mind becomes faithful,

original: de yi 'bras bu de las lhag par bskyed //üîΩgang phyir stobs ni chen pos sdig pa ni //
analyzed: de yi 'bras bu de las lhag par bskyed // gang phyir stobs ni chen pos sdig pa ni //
translated: The result will be greater than that.üîΩBecause the evil of the bodhisattva

original: rgyal ba'i sras la lhun gyis dge bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i sras la lhun gyis dge bar 'gyur //
translated: Is naturally purified by his great power.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na mi zad pa zhes rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mi zad pa zhes rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the bodhisattva‚Äôs evil is inexhaustible.

original: smras pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan gyi don bya ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mi spyod pa de gzhan gyi don yang snying rje chen po mngon du gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: smras pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gzhan gyi don bya ba las ma gtogs pa gzhan ni mi spyod pa de gzhan gyi don yang snying rje chen po mngon du gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: He said: Here, the bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva does not engage in anything other than benefiting others. That benefiting of others is preceded by the manifestation of great compassion.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni gzhan don phyir //
translated: Arousing the mind is for the sake of others,

original: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: yang dag rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod //
translated: Desiring perfect complete enlightenment.

original: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yis //
analyzed: mdor bsdus pa dang rgyas pa yis //
translated: In brief and in detail,

original: de ni ji ltar mdo bshad bya //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar mdo bshad bya //
translated: How is that explained in the s≈´tras?

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bas na snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ser sna can gyi rnam par smin pa tsha ba'i yi dags nyid rnam par spyod nas de las gdon pa'i bsam bas /
analyzed: de bas na snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ser sna can gyi rnam par smin pa tsha ba'i yi dags nyid rnam par spyod nas de las gdon pa'i bsam bas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva endowed with great compassion, having practiced as a hungry ghost with the hot hells' ripening due to stinginess, with the intention to rescue them from that,

original: gal te de'i nor sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor bas 'phrog na de'i tshe de'i sdom pa nyams par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de'i nor sngags dang phyag rgya'i sbyor bas 'phrog na de'i tshe de'i sdom pa nyams par mi 'gyur te /
translated: if their wealth is stolen through the application of mantra and mudrƒÅ, at that time their vow does not deteriorate,

original: bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with a special intention.

original: nor gyi bdag po rnams kyang snod dam pa'i lag tu byin pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nor gyi bdag po rnams kyang snod dam pa'i lag tu byin pas 'bras bu dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: And the owners of the wealth, by giving it to the hand of a worthy vessel, will have a result.

original: ji skad du /üîΩmes tshig pa'am chus khyer ba'am /üîΩrgyal po rnams kyis 'phrog pa'am //
analyzed: ji skad du / mes tshig pa'am chus khyer ba'am / rgyal po rnams kyis 'phrog pa'am //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThose who give their wealth to thoseüîΩwho are burned by fire, carried away by water,

original: gang zhig nor ni rang sbyin ba //
analyzed: gang zhig nor ni rang sbyin ba //
translated: or robbed by kings,

original: tshe phyi ma la drug 'gyur 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la drug 'gyur 'gyur //
translated: will have a sixfold result in the next life.

original: zhes 'byung bas bems pos khyer ba yang nor gyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi /üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i byang chub @6a * //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas bems pos khyer ba yang nor gyi 'bras bu dang ldan pa yin gyi / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba'i byang chub @6a * //
translated: Thus, even if the wealth is carried away by inanimate things, the owner of the wealth will have a result.

original: sems dpa'i phyag tu phyin na ji ltar 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dpa'i phyag tu phyin na ji ltar 'bras bu dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it falls into the hands of a bodhisattva free of faults such as attachment, how could it not have a result?

original: ser sna can la bsam pa med do zhes /üîΩgad smras pa de la yang smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: ser sna can la bsam pa med do zhes / gad smras pa de la yang smra bar bya ste /
translated: The miser has no thought.

original: ser sna can gyi chos ston pa la sogs pas bskal ba stong gis kyang gtong ba'i sems bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser sna can gyi chos ston pa la sogs pas bskal ba stong gis kyang gtong ba'i sems bskyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: We reply: Even if the miser teaches the Dharma and so on for a thousand eons, he will not generate the thought of giving.

original: de ma skyes pas rnam par smin pa ni dka' ba rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma skyes pas rnam par smin pa ni dka' ba rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is not produced, the result of evolution is not difficult to obtain.üîΩThe suffering of hungry ghosts experienced over a thousand eons is momentary compared to the suffering of having one‚Äôs possessions stolen.

original: bskal pa stong gis nyams su myong ba'i yi dags kyi sdug bsngal la skad cig rdzas 'phrog pa'i sdug bsngal skad cig ma yin pas mi gnong de ji skad du /
analyzed: bskal pa stong gis nyams su myong ba'i yi dags kyi sdug bsngal la skad cig rdzas 'phrog pa'i sdug bsngal skad cig ma yin pas mi gnong de ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: gsad bya'i lag pa bcad nas ni //
analyzed: gsad bya'i lag pa bcad nas ni //
translated: ‚ÄúIt would be better to cut off my arm

original: gtong bar gyur na ji ma rung //
analyzed: gtong bar gyur na ji ma rung //
translated: than to let go of the one to be killed.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIt would be better to be freed

original: ma yi mngal gyi dmyal ba las //üîΩgrol bar gyur na ci ma rung //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ma yi mngal gyi dmyal ba las // grol bar gyur na ci ma rung // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: from the hell of my mother‚Äôs womb.‚Äù

original: de bas na che ba dang chung ba'i bsam pas ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i dub pa'i sems kyi 'bras bu mchog mthong bas legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na che ba dang chung ba'i bsam pas ser sna can gyi skyes bu'i dub pa'i sems kyi 'bras bu mchog mthong bas legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is good to see the supreme result of the mind of a miserly person, whether great or small.

original: zhes skyon med do //
analyzed: zhes skyon med do //
translated: Thus there is no fault.

original: yang na ser sna can gyi nor bkug nas /
analyzed: yang na ser sna can gyi nor bkug nas /
translated: Or else, having gathered the wealth of a miser,

original: slar yang de nyid la byang chub sems dpas byin nas chos bstan par bya ste //üîΩbu smad kyi phyir nor bsrung ba //
analyzed: slar yang de nyid la byang chub sems dpas byin nas chos bstan par bya ste // bu smad kyi phyir nor bsrung ba //
translated: the bodhisattva should give it back to him and teach the Dharma.üîΩ‚ÄúHe who does not give for the sake of wife and children

original: gang zhig mi spyod ster ma yin //
analyzed: gang zhig mi spyod ster ma yin //
translated: is not a giver, but a guardian of wealth.‚Äù

original: de las sbyin par blang ba yi //
analyzed: de las sbyin par blang ba yi //
translated: From that, the one who takes the gift

original: dad spyod yi dags skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dad spyod yi dags skye bar 'gyur //
translated: will be born as a hungry ghost.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshig gi rgyud de nyid kyis de nyid btul la yang dag par gzung zhing nor de gtong ba la 'jug cing /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa'i tshig gi rgyud de nyid kyis de nyid btul la yang dag par gzung zhing nor de gtong ba la 'jug cing /
translated: Thus, by the very same Dharma teaching, the words of the tantra, he should subdue that very person, and having taken up the wealth, he should engage in giving it away.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs sngon du 'gro bar ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags la rim gyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs sngon du 'gro bar ye shes kyi tshogs nye bar bsags la rim gyis byang chub sems dpa' nyid dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes shin tu phal cher thal bas chog go //
translated: Having accumulated the accumulation of merit beforehand, he should accumulate the accumulation of wisdom, and gradually attain the state of a bodhisattva and buddhahood.

original: rnal ma rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
analyzed: rnal ma rnam par dpyad par bya ste //
translated: The natural state should be analyzed.

original: rdzas kyi bdag po zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdzas kyi bdag po zhes pa ni /
translated: The one who is the owner of the substance

original: ser sna can gyi skyes bu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ser sna can gyi skyes bu phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: will become a miserly person endowed with perfection.

original: 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'ga' zhig dgag par bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzas kyi phun sum tshogs pa 'ga' zhig dgag par bstan to //
translated: By worldly and so on, the perfection of substance is taught to be refuted.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sras kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi yang dag pa'i ye shes mngon du byas la slar yang rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du de nyid bstan par bya ste phyis de bzhin gshegs par
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sras kyi gtso bor gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi yang dag pa'i ye shes mngon du byas la slar yang rim pa gnyis bsgoms pas byang chub sems dpa' dang sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don du de nyid bstan par bya ste phyis de bzhin gshegs par
translated: The meaning of the foremost son of all the Buddhas and so forth is that one should manifest the perfect pristine awareness of the path of seeing, meditation, and so forth, and then again cultivate the two stages, whereby one will attain the state of a bodhisattva and buddhahood.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of one will later become a Tathagata is that one will become a buddha.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi @6b rigs kyi dam tshig nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas gti mug gi @6b rigs kyi dam tshig nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: By this and so forth, the pledge of the family of delusion is summarized.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba spyod pa'i rgyud ces bya ba 'dis lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba spyod pa'i rgyud ces bya ba 'dis lung tshad ma nyid du bstan to //
translated: The Tantra called The Manifest Enlightenment of Glorious Vairocana teaches the validity of the scriptures.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyis zhes pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i sku gsung thugs kyis so //
translated: By all bodhisattvas is meant by the body, speech, and mind of the bodhisattvas.

original: ma byin par len pa thams cad ces pa ni dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog las so //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa thams cad ces pa ni dman pa dang bar ma dang mchog las so //
translated: All taking of what is not given means from the inferior, the middling, and the superior.

original: ser sna can las ma gtogs pa'o zhes pa ni de la ldog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ser sna can las ma gtogs pa'o zhes pa ni de la ldog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Except for the miserly means that should not be averted from that.

original: 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi dam tshig la 'jug pa zhes pa 'dis 'od dpag med pa'i rigs bsgom pa'i sgo nas pha rol gyi bu smad la 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis 'dod pa thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi rigs kyi dam tshig la 'jug pa zhes pa 'dis 'od dpag med pa'i rigs bsgom pa'i sgo nas pha rol gyi bu smad la 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnal 'byor gyis 'dod pa thams cad kyi dbang phyug nyid du bstan to //
translated: By this, ‚Äúentering into the pledge of the family of passion,‚Äù he teaches that by the yoga of the nature of going to the wife of another through the cultivation of the family of AmitƒÅbha, one becomes the lord of all pleasures.

original: rang gi rang bzhin bsgyur bas zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs la rang gi ngo bo so sor snang bas so //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin bsgyur bas zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i tshogs la rang gi ngo bo so sor snang bas so //
translated: By changing one‚Äôs own nature means by the appearance of one‚Äôs own nature in the collection of sense organs such as the eyes.

original: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i spyod yul te yul lnga'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa zhes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i spyod yul te yul lnga'o //
translated: Form and so on means the five objects such as form, which are the domain of the sense organs such as the eyes.

original: thar pa 'dod pa zhes pa ni grol bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa zhes pa ni grol bar 'dod pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: Those who desire liberation means the yogis who desire liberation.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can ni spang ba'i mtshan
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de rnams sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid can ni spang ba'i mtshan
translated: The characteristic of the complete pacification of all suffering is that the nature of desire and so forth, which is the cause of all suffering, is completely pacified by the stages of mantra and mudra.

original: nyid sgrub par byed pa ste rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyid sgrub par byed pa ste rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of abandonment is accomplished, that is, perfected.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can yin pas na zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i bdag nyid do //
