original: gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga thams cad so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gis nye bar spyod cing blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga thams cad so sor sdud pa dang bsam gtan gyi yan lag dag gis nye bar spyod cing blang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should enjoy and take up all the five sense objects such as form, etc. by means of the branch of meditation and the individual withdrawal.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi //
translated: This is the nature of all the Buddhas

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: means Vajrasattva, the nature of all the Tathagatas.

original: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dod chags chen po'i tshul zhes pa ni 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i phyir snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i lam mo //
translated: The method of great passion means the path endowed with great compassion in order to perform the welfare of the world.

original: theg pa gzhan la ltos pas mchog go zhes pa ni phul du byung ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gzhan la ltos pas mchog go zhes pa ni phul du byung ba'o //
translated: Supreme means excellent in comparison to other vehicles.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang mngon par byang chub pa dang zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa rnams bstan to //
translated: By this he has taught the stages of self-consecration, clear light, and union.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dag gi dam tshig bstan te /
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa rin chen 'byung ldan dang don yod grub pa dag gi dam tshig bstan te /
translated: Then, etc. teaches the commitments of Ratnasa·πÉbhava and Amoghasiddhi.

original: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na sna tshogs so //
analyzed: brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid yin pas na sna tshogs so //
translated: Since it has the nature of both the stable and the moving, it is diverse.

original: rdo rje mi phyed gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to //üîΩphung po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brdzun dang rtsub mo'i tshig so so'i skye bo rnams la spyod yul ma yin pas thos par dka' ba rnal 'byor pas slob pa gang yin pa des ni myur
analyzed: rdo rje mi phyed gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bshad zin to // phung po la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa brdzun dang rtsub mo'i tshig so so'i skye bo rnams la spyod yul ma yin pas thos par dka' ba rnal 'byor pas slob pa gang yin pa des ni myur
translated: The meaning of the three indestructible vajras and so forth has already been explained.

original: du byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: du byang chub thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The yogi who is difficult to hear, that is, who is hard to hear, because the words of falsehood and harshness The aggregates and so forth do not exist as external objects and so forth are not the domain of ordinary beings, will quickly attain enlightenment.üîΩThis is what is taught.

original: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa @13b bstan to //
analyzed: des ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa @13b bstan to //
translated: This teaches the stage of the pure mind.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The definitive meaning is because the stage of completion is taught.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i 'khor gyi nang na gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ma 'ongs pa'i sems can rnams yongs su gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Residing in the retinue of Great Vajradhara and so forth is for the sake of taking care of future sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpas ji ltar 'dri ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas ji ltar 'dri ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The question asked by the Bodhisattva should be taught,

original: dam tshig lnga bstan pa'i 'og tu'o zhes pa ni khyad par gyi don mi shes pa'i dam tshig lnga bstan pa'i phyi nas so //
analyzed: dam tshig lnga bstan pa'i 'og tu'o zhes pa ni khyad par gyi don mi shes pa'i dam tshig lnga bstan pa'i phyi nas so //
translated: after the teaching of the five pledges.üîΩThe one who is equal to the Tathagatas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ste sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas na zhes pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig ste sdud pa po yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because he has become equal to all the Buddhas, is the pledge of all the Tathagatas, because he is the compiler.

original: / rdo rjes mtshan pas na zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag mtshan 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: / rdo rjes mtshan pas na zhes pa ni rdo rje'i phyag mtshan 'dzin pas so //
translated: He is marked with a vajra, because he holds the vajra as his hand implement.

original: de la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la sogs pa sngon du 'gro ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams te zhes pa ni sa'i snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas who have that as their beginning, etc., are Ksitigarbha and so on.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba'i tshig dang zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'gal ba'i tshig dang zhes pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i tshig go //
translated: The words that are contrary to the world are the words of killing, etc.

original: ldan pa ni pha rol la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ldan pa ni pha rol la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid de'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par zhes pa ni /
translated: Endowed with means that it is characterized by the benefit of others.üîΩThe special meditative stabilization is the stage of generation, which is characterized by the benefit of others through the stages of mantra and seal.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa la sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i mtshan nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa la yang sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pas 'od gsal ba rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid do ;
translated: The special meditative stabilization is also the stage of completion, which is characterized by the realization of clear light through the purification of the mind and so forth.

original: / ston par mdzad pas zhes pa ni de gsal bar gsungs pas so //
analyzed: / ston par mdzad pas zhes pa ni de gsal bar gsungs pas so //
translated: It is taught means that it is clearly taught.üîΩAstonished and amazed means that they were astonished by hearing words that contradict the world, and they were amazed by hearing its purification.

original: do mtshar du gyur cing rmad du gyur nas zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i tshig thos pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / de'i rnam par dag pa thos pas rmad du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'o //
analyzed: do mtshar du gyur cing rmad du gyur nas zhes pa ni 'jig rten dang 'gal ba'i tshig thos pas ngo mtshar du gyur pa dang / de'i rnam par dag pa thos pas rmad du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbye ba'o //
translated: This is the analysis.

original: gal te de ltar yin na slar yang ci'i phyir 'dri bar byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar yin na slar yang ci'i phyir 'dri bar byed ce na /
translated: If that is so, then why do they ask again?

original: smras pa ma 'ongs pa'i padma la sogs pa dbang po dman pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin no //
analyzed: smras pa ma 'ongs pa'i padma la sogs pa dbang po dman pa rjes su gzung ba'i phyir zhes bshad zin no //
translated: It was said that the future lotus and so forth are for the sake of guiding those of lesser faculties.

original: 'khor du gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bcos par 'dri ba zhes pa la sogs pas /
analyzed: 'khor du gtogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bcos par 'dri ba zhes pa la sogs pas /
translated: In the phrase to the Tathagatas who are included in the retinue, and so forth,

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tha mi dad par bstan to //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'chang dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams tha mi dad par bstan to //
translated: it is taught that Vajradhara and the Tathagatas, who are the nature of the Dharma and Enjoyment Bodies, are non-different.

original: tha mi dad pa yang bya ba gcig yin pas so //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa yang bya ba gcig yin pas so //
translated: And they are non-different because they have the same activity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po zhes pa 'dis ni gsung ba ngan pa mi ston pa nyid du bstan to //üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag po zhes pa 'dis ni gsung ba ngan pa mi ston pa nyid du bstan to // rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ste //
translated: By the phrase the lord of all Tathagatas, it is taught that he does not teach false speech.

original: zhes pa ni rab tu rnam par @14a * //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rab tu rnam par @14a * //
translated: It is said, The nature of the elements is to apprehend their own characteristics.

original: 'byed pa nyid du 'dzin pas na khams ni shes rab bstan to //
analyzed: 'byed pa nyid du 'dzin pas na khams ni shes rab bstan to //
translated: Since it is said, The nature of the elements is to apprehend their own characteristics, the elements are taught to be wisdom.

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab po zhes pa ni dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa'i blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi shes rab po zhes pa ni dngos po rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa'i blo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Wisdom, which has the characteristic of thorough differentiation. This means the mind that realizes the intrinsic identity of things.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas de nyid rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas chung ba la sogs pa'i dbye bas de nyid rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: And that, etc. shows that it is threefold, by way of the division into lesser, etc.

original: des na khams gsum pa dman pa la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des na khams gsum pa dman pa la sogs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with the wisdom of the inferior, etc. of the three realms.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pa ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyis mi 'da' ba'i tshig ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad las 'das pa ste zhes pa ni de rnams kyis mi 'da' ba'i tshig ma yin pa'o //
translated: It transcends all world-realms. This does not mean that it is a word that does not transcend them.

original: rab 'bring zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rab 'bring zhes bya ba la sogs pas don de nyid bstan to //
translated: The meaning of that is shown by the best, etc.

original: me'i grang ba bzhin no zhes pa'i dpes sngar ma byung ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: me'i grang ba bzhin no zhes pa'i dpes sngar ma byung ba nyid bstan to //
translated: The example of fire and cold shows that it is not something that has not existed before.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that very fact,

original: sngon chad ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: sngon chad ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: it is said, It is not something that has not existed before, etc.

original: rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin pas na zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gis thams cad 'jug par 'gyur bas so //üîΩgzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug par byed pa yin pas na zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gis thams cad 'jug par 'gyur bas so // gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it causes entry, means that all enter through the speech of the Lord.

original: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung blang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is to be grasped, means that the speech of the Tathagata is to be accepted.

original: 'khor gnyis kyi nang du zhes pa ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du'o //
analyzed: 'khor gnyis kyi nang du zhes pa ni rdzogs pa dang ma rdzogs pa'i tshogs kyi nang du'o //
translated: In the midst of the two assemblies, means in the midst of the assembly of the perfected and the assembly of the imperfect.

original: 'gyod pa skyed pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa dka' ba thos pa'i yid mi bde bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa skyed pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa dka' ba thos pa'i yid mi bde bar byed pa'o //
translated: It causes regret, means that it causes mental dissatisfaction by hearing the difficult ripening of killing and so on.

original: ma gsung shig ces bya ba ni gsung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma gsung shig ces bya ba ni gsung ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Do not speak, means that it is not proper to speak.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa la mkhas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa dbang po dman pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du dgongs pas bshad pa'i zab pa'i rdo rje'i tshig rnams 'dri
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa la mkhas pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma 'ongs pa dbang po dman pa'i sems can rnams rjes su gzung ba'i don du dgongs pas bshad pa'i zab pa'i rdo rje'i tshig rnams 'dri
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgatas, who are skilled in the intention of the BhagavƒÅn‚Äù and so on indicates that the TathƒÅgatas, in order to care for future sentient beings of lesser capacity, have composedüîΩthe profound vajra statements that are intentional.üîΩ

original: ba ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la lan btab po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ba ji lta ba bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' la lan btab po zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase just as they were explained and so forth indicates that the Tathagatas, who are skilled in the thought of the Bhagavat, have answered the Bodhisattva's questions just as they were asked, with profound vajra words that are intentional statements for the sake of guiding future sentient beings of inferior faculties.

original: sbyar ro zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa'i tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sbyar ro zhes pa ni bya ba byed pa'i tshig sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase in accordance with the meaning indicates that the words should be applied in accordance with the action.

original: don bshad zin pa ni le'u dang po nas so //
analyzed: don bshad zin pa ni le'u dang po nas so //
translated: The phrase the meaning of which has already been explained refers to the first chapter.

original: rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma dang bzhin gshegs pa dang yid bzhin nor bu dang dam tshig gi rigs so //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rigs la sogs pa zhes pa ni rdo rje dang padma dang bzhin gshegs pa dang yid bzhin nor bu dang dam tshig gi rigs so //
translated: The phrase the vajra lineage and so forth refers to the vajra, lotus, Tathagata, wish-fulfilling gem, and commitment lineages.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:üîΩHatred, delusion, desire,

original: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ste //
analyzed: zhe sdang gti mug 'dod chags dang // yid bzhin nor bu dam tshig ste //
translated: wish-fulfilling gem, and commitment

original: rigs ni de rnams lnga po ste //
analyzed: rigs ni de rnams lnga po ste //
translated: are those five lineages,

original: 'dod dang thar par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod dang thar par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: accomplishing desire and liberation.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said.

original: @14b de las skyes pas ni zhes pa la /
analyzed: @14b de las skyes pas ni zhes pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù means

original: rigs lnga'i dam tshig spyod pa dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs lnga'i dam tshig spyod pa dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: that the bodhisattva is endowed with the practice of the commitments of the five buddha families.

original: dam tshig la the tshom skye ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa tsam thos pa las skyes pa smod pa'i sgo nas so //üîΩngan cing dman pa'i 'du shes ni //
analyzed: dam tshig la the tshom skye ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sgra ji bzhin pa tsam thos pa las skyes pa smod pa'i sgo nas so // ngan cing dman pa'i 'du shes ni //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of doubt about the commitments‚Äù means by means of the disparagement that arises from merely hearing the literal meaning.üîΩ‚ÄúInferior attitude‚Äù means

original: zhes pa la chung ba'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: zhes pa la chung ba'i 'du shes so //
translated: a small attitude.

original: 'jig rten gyis smad pa'i 'du shes zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa sun 'byin pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis smad pa'i 'du shes zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa sun 'byin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAttitude of being despised by the world‚Äù means being reproached by the world.

original: de lta bu'i zhes pa la sogs pas rang gis smod pa dang / 'jig rten pas smod pa 'du shes gnyis bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i zhes pa la sogs pas rang gis smod pa dang / 'jig rten pas smod pa 'du shes gnyis bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù and so forth indicate that it is not right to have the two attitudes of disparaging oneself and being disparaged by the world.

original: dman pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i 'jigs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dman pa'i 'du shes bskyed pa'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa la rtsa ba'i ltung ba'i 'jigs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to show the fault of generating an inferior attitude‚Äù means because of seeing the fear of a root downfall.

original: rgyu gang gis na zhes pas de mi byed pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na zhes pas de mi byed pa nyid bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy what cause‚Äù shows that one should not do that.

original: bstan pa 'di la spyod pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la spyod pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of practice in this teaching:

original: mchog gi spyod pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi spyod pa dang / sngags kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: the practice of the supreme vehicle and the practice of the mantra vehicle.

original: de la mchog gi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de la mchog gi spyod pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the supreme vehicle is the practice of the bodhisattva.

original: sngags kyi spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi spyod pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the mantra vehicle is the practice of the TathƒÅgata.

original: 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba'i bya bas rang dang gzhan gyi don grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'am mi 'gal ba'i bya bas rang dang gzhan gyi don grub pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the bodhisattva is the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô goals by means of practices that are either in conflict with the world or not in conflict with the world.

original: de la 'gal ba'i spyod pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: de la 'gal ba'i spyod pa ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The practice that is in conflict with the world is the practice of taking life and so on.

original: mi 'gal ba'i spyod pa ni bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: mi 'gal ba'i spyod pa ni bstan pa dang smin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: The practice that is not in conflict with the world is the practice of teaching, ripening, and so on.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po rtogs pas mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa lnga po rtogs pas mnyam par bzhag pa dang / ma bzhag pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi don sgrub par byed pa'i spyod yul gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa'o //
translated: The practice of the TathƒÅgata is the practice of the five stages beginning with vajra repetition, which is the accomplishment of the goals of others by one who is in equipoise or not in equipoise through understanding.

original: de ltar slob pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa ste brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gi spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar slob pa'i dus su byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa dang / rdzogs pa'i dus su de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod pa ste brtags pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag gi spyod pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, the conduct of the yogis of the creation and perfection stages is taught: the conduct of the bodhisattva while training, and the conduct of the Tathagata when perfected.üîΩIn order to teach just that, it is said,

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mchog gi spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir mchog gi spyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: supreme conduct, and so forth.

original: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la zhes pa ni mthong ba'i chos la'o //
translated: In this very life means in the present life.

original: rang gi ngo bo yongs su brdze ba yin pas so zhes pa ni tha mal ba'i ngo bo spangs nas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob nas so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo yongs su brdze ba yin pas so zhes pa ni tha mal ba'i ngo bo spangs nas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob nas so //
translated: Because of the complete transformation of one's own nature means that, having abandoned the ordinary nature, one attains the state of glorious Vajradhara.üîΩThus, having summarized the two conducts, in order to teach the result of those, the accomplishment, from the perspective of the two truths, it is said,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa gnyis nye bar bsdus nas de'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ste tshig gi phrad bsdu ba ste zhes pa ni tshig phrad gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyod pa gnyis nye bar bsdus nas de'i 'bras bu bsgrub pa bden pa gnyis kyi sgo nas bstan par bya ste tshig gi phrad bsdu ba ste zhes pa ni tshig phrad gnyis so //
translated: the two phrases.

original: dper na zhes @15a * //
analyzed: dper na zhes @15a * //
translated: For example, and so forth.

original: bya ba'i don la zhes pa ni dpe ston pa'i sgra la 'jug ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i don la zhes pa ni dpe ston pa'i sgra la 'jug ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúobject‚Äù is used in the sense of a demonstrative.

original: tshig phrad kyi don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig phrad kyi don du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not the meaning of a preposition.

original: nam mkha' ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni /
translated: Space is the ultimate truth.

original: 'dus ma byas pa dang bstan pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa dang bstan pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is unconditioned, undemonstrable, and unobstructing.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos thams cad la rjes su song zhing khyab pa'o zhes pas ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang dbang dang gzhan byed pa po nyid bkag go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos thams cad la rjes su song zhing khyab pa'o zhes pas ni dngos po thams cad kyi rang dbang dang gzhan byed pa po nyid bkag go //
translated: It is said to pervade and extend to all dependently arisen phenomena. This refutes the independence and agency of all things.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i chos ni rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i chos ni rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: A phenomenon that arises from causes and conditions is called ‚Äúdependently arisen.‚Äù

original: rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnams ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba gang yin pa de rnams ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen is non-arisen.

original: ji skad du ;
analyzed: ji skad du ;
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig rgyu las bskyed pa nyid //
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu las bskyed pa nyid //
translated: What is produced from causes

original: rkyen med pas ni gnas mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rkyen med pas ni gnas mi 'gyur //
translated: Does not arise without conditions.

original: rkyen med pa ni 'gag 'gyur ba //
analyzed: rkyen med pa ni 'gag 'gyur ba //
translated: What does not arise without conditions

original: de ni yod ces ji ltar rtogs //
analyzed: de ni yod ces ji ltar rtogs //
translated: How can that be considered existent?

original: de ltar gyur pa'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i chos rnams la //
translated: Thus, the dharmas that have become so

original: nam mkha' khyab par 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: nam mkha' khyab par 'jug pa ste //
translated: pervade space,

original: de yi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de yi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: because that is their nature.

original: phung po la sogs pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa chos thams cad de nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: phung po la sogs pas phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa chos thams cad de nyid kyis khyab pa yin te /
translated: The aggregates, etc., all dharmas such as the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., are pervaded by that,

original: nam mkha' med pas de rnams la glags skabs mi ldan pas zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' med pas de rnams la glags skabs mi ldan pas zhes bstan to //
translated: because they are not without space.

original: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir chos dang chos nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir chos dang chos nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason, he says, because the dharmas and their reality are inseparable.üîΩBecause it is said in the Mother of the Victorious Ones:

original: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang stong pa nyid gzugs dang gzugs stong pa nyid do zhes rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor gzugs ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa dang stong pa nyid gzugs dang gzugs stong pa nyid do zhes rgyal ba'i yum las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subhuti, form is empty by nature, and emptiness is form, and form is emptiness and emptiness is form.

original: chos nyid las chos tha dad min //
analyzed: chos nyid las chos tha dad min //
translated: A dharma is not different from its reality.

original: rnam pa gnyis min gnyis med pa //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis min gnyis med pa //
translated: It is not dual and it is not nondual.

original: de ltar chos ni bsam par bya //üîΩmed par mi 'byung nges pa ni //üîΩbyas pa dang ni mi rtag bzhin //
analyzed: de ltar chos ni bsam par bya // med par mi 'byung nges pa ni // byas pa dang ni mi rtag bzhin //
translated: Thus, a dharma should be contemplated.üîΩIt is certain that it does not occur without that,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: like the produced and the impermanent.

original: 'dod pa'i khams la mi gnas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams la mi gnas so //
translated: He does not dwell in the desire realm.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i don spros nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i don spros nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having elaborated on the meaning explained previously, it should be explained.

original: gzugs la sogs pa tshol ba zhes pa ni yul spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa tshol ba zhes pa ni yul spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i 'dod pa'i khams yin pas so //
translated: The phrase seeking form and so on refers to the desire realm, which has the characteristic of engaging with objects.

original: rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa'i lha rnams zhes pa ni lha'i ris drug go //
analyzed: rgyal chen ris bzhi la sogs pa'i lha rnams zhes pa ni lha'i ris drug go //
translated: The phrase the gods of the Four Great Kings and so on refers to the six classes of gods.

original: de rnams 'dzin pa zhes pa ni de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'dzin pa zhes pa ni de'i gzhir gyur pa'i phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase grasping them refers to the aggregates and so on that serve as the basis for those.

original: der yang mi gnas te zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams rang bzhin med pas so //
analyzed: der yang mi gnas te zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams rang bzhin med pas so //
translated: The phrase he does not dwell there means that the desire realm lacks intrinsic nature.

original: rten med brten pa ni gang du gnas zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rten med brten pa ni gang du gnas zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The phrase without support, where does the supported abide? means that he does not abide in the form realm.

original: gtan tshigs @15b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs @15b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the reason,

original: 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: he taught the desire realm and so on.

original: gzugs tsam la chags pa zhes pa ni gzugs tsam la dmigs nas bsam gtan bzhi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs tsam la chags pa zhes pa ni gzugs tsam la dmigs nas bsam gtan bzhi gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase attached to mere form means abiding in the four concentrations by observing mere form.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan la gnas pas de rnams kyis tshor ba la sogs pa la chags pa med do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i bsam gtan la gnas pas de rnams kyis tshor ba la sogs pa la chags pa med do //
translated: By abiding in the meditative concentration of the absence of conceptual thought, etc., they are not attached to feelings, etc.üîΩThe abiding in mere consciousness, free from attachment to form, is the formless realm.

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par shes pa tsam du gnas pa de ni zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ste 'ba' zhig rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbye ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par shes pa tsam du gnas pa de ni zhes pa ni gzugs med pa ste 'ba' zhig rnam par rig pa tsam gyi dbye ba bzhi ste /
translated: It is the four divisions of mere representation,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang / yod min med min skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam dang / yod min med min skye mched kyi rnam par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: the mere representation of the sphere of infinite space, the mere representation of the sphere of infinite consciousness, the mere representation of the sphere of nothingness, and the mere representation of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: de dag na yang mi gnas so zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo de dag yin pas so //
analyzed: de dag na yang mi gnas so zhes pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'i ngo bo de dag yin pas so //
translated: They do not abide even in those, because they are the nature of ultimate truth.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rim gyis gnas pa'i zhes pa ni re zhig dang po sa'i 'og khyab nas gnas pa mtha' yas pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor yod de /
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor la sogs pa rim gyis gnas pa'i zhes pa ni re zhig dang po sa'i 'og khyab nas gnas pa mtha' yas pa rlung gi dkyil 'khor yod de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe wind ma·πá·∏çala and so on are arranged in sequence‚Äù means that the infinite wind ma·πá·∏çala exists first, pervading the space below the earth.

original: de'i steng du des bus pas me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du yang chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa can de'i steng du sa'i dkyil 'khor gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa rol pa'i mtsho bdun gyis bskor ba yod do zhes go rims pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du des bus pas me'i dkyil 'khor dang / de'i steng du yang chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po'i rnam pa can de'i steng du sa'i dkyil 'khor gling bzhi ri rab dang bcas pa rol pa'i mtsho bdun gyis bskor ba yod do zhes go rims pa'o //
translated: Above that, the fire ma·πá·∏çala is blown by the wind, and above that is the water ma·πá·∏çala, which has the shape of a circle. Above that is the earth ma·πá·∏çala, which has the four continents and Mount Meru, surrounded by the seven rings of the oceans.

original: rgyu ba ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can gyi skye gnas bzhi'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can gyi skye gnas bzhi'o //
translated: The moving [world] is the four birthplaces of the sentient beings of the six classes.

original: mi rgyu ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rgyu ba ni snod kyi 'jig rten gyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The unmoving [world] is the nature of the world of the environment.

original: gzhir gyur pa zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhir gyur pa zhes pa ni gnyi ga'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis‚Äù means that it is the support of both.

original: de la yang mi gnas te zhes pa ni phung po la sogs de rnams la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas te zhes pa ni phung po la sogs de rnams la yang gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit does not abide there‚Äù means that it does not abide in those aggregates and so on.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa'i phyir /
translated: The reason for that is explained.

original: thams cad kyang 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de dag thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: thams cad kyang 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni de dag thams cad stong pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni dpe las byung ba bstan par bya ste /üîΩdpe las byung ba de bzhin nyid de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar bshad de /üîΩrten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zhes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni dpe las byung ba bstan par bya ste / dpe las byung ba de bzhin nyid de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsal bar bshad de / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don zhes pa ni rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the Dharma.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the Sa·πÖgha.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four noble truths.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four foundations of mindfulness.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four right efforts.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni de rnams de la gnas pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni de rnams de la gnas pas so //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four legs of manifestation.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu dang zhes pa ni tshogs pa las @16a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu dang zhes pa ni tshogs pa las @16a * //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the five faculties.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the five powers.

original: byung ba nyid do //
analyzed: byung ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the seven factors of awakening.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the eightfold noble path.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang nyid ma grub pa zhes bya'o //üîΩgang yang gcig skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir rang nyid ma grub pa zhes bya'o // gang yang gcig skyed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the ten perfections.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: tshogs pa la ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung bas kha cig skye ba 'am 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa la ni skyed par byed pa yin no zhes 'byung bas kha cig skye ba 'am 'gog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four concentrations.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four immeasurables.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four formless absorptions.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the five higher perceptions.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the six higher knowledges.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the eight liberations.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the ten totalities.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four formless states.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four immeasurables.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the eight liberations.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the nine serial absorptions.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the ten totalities.üîΩThe meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the four formless states.üîΩThe meaning of dependent

original: 'dir ni kha cig mi skye zhing //
analyzed: 'dir ni kha cig mi skye zhing //
translated: But here, some are not born,

original: kha cig kyang ni 'chi mi 'gyur //
analyzed: kha cig kyang ni 'chi mi 'gyur //
translated: and some do not die.

original: sems kyi ngo bo rnams gnas pa'i //
analyzed: sems kyi ngo bo rnams gnas pa'i //
translated: The nature of mind is stable,

original: 'khor ba nyid du shes par bya //
analyzed: 'khor ba nyid du shes par bya //
translated: and one should know that it is samsara.

original: ma rig rkyen las 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: ma rig rkyen las 'byung ba ni //
translated: When one arises from the condition of ignorance,

original: yang dag ye shes mthong 'gyur na //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes mthong 'gyur na //
translated: and sees the truth of reality,üîΩit is not possible to establish

original: skye ba 'am ni 'gog pa dag / gang yang 'grub par mi rigs so //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: skye ba 'am ni 'gog pa dag / gang yang 'grub par mi rigs so // zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: either birth or cessation.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de ltar gyur pas mkhyen cing thugs su chud cing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang po dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la dmigs nas de dang mthun par ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de ltar gyur pas mkhyen cing thugs su chud cing de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dbang po dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba la dmigs nas de dang mthun par ston par mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the nature of things is like this. The Tathagatas, knowing and understanding this, and observing the distinctions of inferior and so on faculties, teach in accordance with that.

original: rnam par mi rtog kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang bum pa bzang po bzhin du sems can rnams la bstan pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog kyang sngon gyi smon lam gyi dbang gis yid bzhin gyi nor bu dang bum pa bzang po bzhin du sems can rnams la bstan pa dang / yongs su smin par mdzad de /
translated: Even without conceptualization, by the power of former vows, they teach and bring sentient beings to full maturity, like a wish-fulfilling gem and an excellent vase.

original: de rnams kyis kyang ston par byed pa dang bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bas dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyis kyang ston par byed pa dang bstan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dbye bas dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Those also do not become objects by the division of the conceptualization of the teacher and the teaching.

original: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i sgra'i nges pa'i don gyi sgo nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dam tshig lnga'i don shes par bya'o zhes pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i sgra'i nges pa'i don gyi sgo nas mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi dam tshig lnga'i don shes par bya'o zhes pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúnow,‚Äù the meaning of the five commitments of the TathƒÅgatas Ak·π£obhya, etc., should be understood by the door of the definitive meaning of the words of the prohibitions of killing, etc.üîΩThis is stated in the text.

original: da yang mkhyen nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bshad do //
analyzed: da yang mkhyen nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te rjes su rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i gzhung gis bshad do //
translated: Now, beginning with ‚Äúknowing thus,‚Äù the text explains with the passage up to ‚Äúshould be known in terms of the subsequent.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dam tshig rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bshad nas dpe'i sgo nas zung ngu 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par bya bar rdo rje'i sku bskyed pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i dam tshig rnams kyi rnam par dag pa bshad nas dpe'i sgo nas zung ngu 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par bya bar rdo rje'i sku bskyed pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Thus, etc. Having explained the purity of the previously explained commitments, one should undertake the generation of the vajra body to be attained by the samƒÅdhi of union by way of an example.

original: steng gi shing bu'i zhes pa ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: steng gi shing bu'i zhes pa ni byed pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúupper piece of wood‚Äù is the agent.

original: gzhi ste ni 'og ma'i shing bu'o //
analyzed: gzhi ste ni 'og ma'i shing bu'o //
translated: The base is the lower piece of wood.

original: gnyi ga bems po yin pas me skyed pa la mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga bems po yin pas me skyed pa la mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Since both are insentient, they are incapable of producing fire.

original: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba lhan cig byed pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i lag pa'i rtsol ba lhan cig byed pa'o //
translated: The activity of the human hand is the cooperating condition.

original: des na steng ma dang 'og ma'i shing bu ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang mi'i lag pa'i bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: des na steng ma dang 'og ma'i shing bu ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang mi'i lag pa'i bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, the upper and lower pieces of wood are the material cause, and the activity of the human hand is the cooperating cause.

original: yang na gsum po de dag kyang gsal ba'i rgyu yin te //
analyzed: yang na gsum po de dag kyang gsal ba'i rgyu yin te //
translated: Or, those three are the revealing cause of fire,

original: de rnams kyis me gsal bar byed @16b pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis me gsal bar byed @16b pas so //
translated: because they reveal fire.

original: de ltar shing la gnas pa'i me //
analyzed: de ltar shing la gnas pa'i me //
translated: Thus, fire that resides in wood

original: sgrub pa med par mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: sgrub pa med par mi 'byung ste //
translated: does not occur without the means of production.

original: de bzhin goms pa med pas ni //
analyzed: de bzhin goms pa med pas ni //
translated: In the same way, without cultivation,

original: 'dir ni byang chub thob mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir ni byang chub thob mi 'gyur // zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one will not attain enlightenment here.

original: gsum po de dag gi rkyen la brten cing zhes pa ni rgyu gsum po la dmigs nas so //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gi rkyen la brten cing zhes pa ni rgyu gsum po la dmigs nas so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin dependence on the conditions of those three‚Äù means that one focuses on those three causes.

original: dro ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas me bskyed pa'i go rims bstan to //
analyzed: dro ba'i 'og tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas me bskyed pa'i go rims bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúafter the heat‚Äù and so on teaches the order in which fire is produced.

original: 'dus te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi me'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dus te 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid kyi me'i khams so //
translated: The fire element is the nature of the four great elements.

original: des ni dngos po rnams rang dbang 'grub pa bkag go //
analyzed: des ni dngos po rnams rang dbang 'grub pa bkag go //
translated: This refutes the independent existence of things.

original: gtsub shing la yang mi gnas pa //
analyzed: gtsub shing la yang mi gnas pa //
translated: It does not reside in the kindling.

original: zhes pa ni steng gi shing bu la mi gnas pa ste gtsub stan dang mi'i lag pa'i bya ba med na gcig pu de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni steng gi shing bu la mi gnas pa ste gtsub stan dang mi'i lag pa'i bya ba med na gcig pu de las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not reside in the upper piece of wood, because it does not arise from that alone, without the activity of the friction board and the mans hands.

original: de bzhin du gtsub stan med pas ji ltar gnyi ga las mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtsub stan med pas ji ltar gnyi ga las mi 'byung ste /
translated: Similarly, how could it arise from both, since it does not exist in the friction board?

original: de ltar gcig cig med pas kyang mi 'byung ba zhes rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gcig cig med pas kyang mi 'byung ba zhes rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that it does not arise from the absence of one or the other.

original: gcig cig ni skyed pa po ma yin gyi tshogs pa ni skyed pa po yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig cig ni skyed pa po ma yin gyi tshogs pa ni skyed pa po yin zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said that one alone is not the producer, but the collection is the producer.

original: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: so sor dmigs su med do zhes pa ni re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so sor dmigs su med do zhes pa ni re re las mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not perceived individually, because it does not arise from each.

original: tshogs pa las zhes pa ni tshogs pa'i 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs pa las zhes pa ni tshogs pa'i 'brel pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the assembly‚Äù means from the connection of the assembly.

original: de dag gong nas gong du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gong nas gong du skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThey arise in succession‚Äù means

original: dman pa dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dman pa dang 'bring dang chen po nyid kyis so //
translated: in terms of lesser, middling, and greater.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe las 'byung ba bstan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe las 'byung ba bstan te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way,‚Äù and so on, teaches the example.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung bas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las sangs rgyas thams cad 'byung bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is the abode of all tathƒÅgatas‚Äù means that all buddhas arise from clear light.

original: rdo rje ni chen po stong pa nyid ngo zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa spong bas so ;
analyzed: rdo rje ni chen po stong pa nyid ngo zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa spong bas so ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe vajra is the emptiness of the great,‚Äù which is the elimination of the all-base consciousness.

original: / dam tshig ni shin tu spong ba nyid ces pa ni /
analyzed: / dam tshig ni shin tu spong ba nyid ces pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe pledge is the elimination of the extreme,‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par shes pa spangs pas so //
translated: which is the elimination of the afflicted consciousness.

original: stong pa nyid do zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dang po rtogs pas so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid do zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dang po rtogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe emptiness‚Äù is the first realization of the yogins.

original: gsum po de dag gis zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i phyi nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gsum po de dag gis zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i phyi nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The three are the subsequent appearances of the near attainment and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig rtogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces pa la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dam tshig rtogs pa bstan to //
translated: The all tathƒÅgatas and so on indicate the realization of the pledge of all tathƒÅgatas.üîΩ The three emptinesses are the stages of the ultimate truth.üîΩ The moon, sun, and space are the appearances of the moon, sun, and space that are seen by the process of mantra and seal, which are the abandonment of the natural and the apparent.üîΩ The clear light is the entry into the clear light that is like pure space.üîΩ Again, the return is the simultaneous emanation of the gnosis body from the clear light by the process of the great emptiness and so on of the self-consecration.üîΩ üîΩThe three are the three appearances of the near attainment and so on.üîΩ The three emptinesses are the stages of the ultimate truth.üîΩ The moon, sun, and space are the appearances of the moon, sun, and space that are seen by the process of mantra and seal, which are the abandonment of the natural and the apparent.üîΩ The clear light is the entry into the clear light that is like pure space.

original: stong pa gsum gyis rim gyi don dam pa'i bden par 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang snang ba spong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang @17a * //
analyzed: stong pa gsum gyis rim gyi don dam pa'i bden par 'gro ba'o zhes pa ni sngags dang phyag rgya'i rim pas rang bzhin dang snang ba spong bas zla ba dang nyi ma dang @17a * //
translated: Again, the return is the simultaneous emanation of the gnosis body from the clear light by the process of the great emptiness and so on of the self-consecration.üîΩ üîΩThe three are the three appearances of the near attainment and so on.üîΩ The three emptinesses are the stages of the ultimate truth.üîΩ The moon, sun, and space are the appearances of the moon, sun, and space that are seen by the process of mantra and seal, which are the abandonment of the natural and the apparent.

original: mtshams kyi snang ba mthong bas dag pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi snang ba mthong bas dag pa nam mkha' dang 'dra ba 'od gsal ba la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The clear light is the entry into the clear light that is like pure space.

original: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas stong pa chen po la sogs pa'i go rims kyis 'od gsal ba las cig car du ye shes kyi sku spro ba ni 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas stong pa chen po la sogs pa'i go rims kyis 'od gsal ba las cig car du ye shes kyi sku spro ba ni 'ong ba'o //
translated: Again, the return is the simultaneous emanation of the gnosis body from the clear light by the process of the great emptiness and so on of the self-consecration.üîΩ üîΩThe three are the three appearances of the near attainment and so on.üîΩ The three emptinesses are the stages of the ultimate truth.üîΩ The moon, sun, and space are the appearances of the

original: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa khong du chud nas zung ngu 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de rdzogs pa dang mi slob pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med pa zhes pa ni mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa khong du chud nas zung ngu 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'gro ba dang 'ong ba med de rdzogs pa dang mi slob pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout coming and going‚Äù means that, having understood the stage of manifest enlightenment, there is no coming and going in the samƒÅdhi of union, because it is perfected and beyond training.

original: zung 'jug ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas slar zhing gang la'ang mi slob po //
analyzed: zung 'jug ting nge 'dzin la gnas pas slar zhing gang la'ang mi slob po //
translated: Dwelling in the samƒÅdhi of union, one does not train in anything again.

original: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor zhes //
translated: This is called the yoga of perfection.

original: de yang rdo rje 'chang chen po //
analyzed: de yang rdo rje 'chang chen po //
translated: And that is MahƒÅvajradhara,

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog ldan pa //
translated: endowed with the supreme of all aspects,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa de las 'byung //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa de las 'byung //
translated: arising from the omniscient one.

original: zhes bstan pas so //
analyzed: zhes bstan pas so //
translated: This is taught.

original: rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa yongs su rdzogs pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn perfection‚Äù and so on means in the perfection of the stage of perfection.

original: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: Here this is the condensed meaning:

original: ji ltar gtsub shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pa phrad pa las me bskyed de /
analyzed: ji ltar gtsub shing la sogs pa'i tshogs pa phrad pa las me bskyed de /
translated: Just as fire is generated from the assembly of the collection of the rubbing stick and so on,

original: 'on te de rnams rnam par dpyad na logs su bskyed par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa rim gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de rnams rnam par dpyad na logs su bskyed par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'gro ba dang 'ong ba la sogs pa rim gyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par shes par bya'o //
translated: But if they are analyzed, they are not generated separately. In the same way, one should understand that through the stages of going and coming, etc., one attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa rang med pas kyang rdo rje 'chang gi sku rdzogs par byed de //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa rang med pas kyang rdo rje 'chang gi sku rdzogs par byed de //
translated: And even though going, etc., do not exist in themselves, they complete the body of Vajradhara.

original: de bas na rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba 'di rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rol mo sna tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rten cing 'brel pa las 'byung ba 'di rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi rol mo sna tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this dependent origination is of various kinds and is the various displays of the Buddha.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob nas dga' bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar thob pa'i don mchog tu 'dzin pas bstod pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de kho na nyid thob nas dga' bar 'gyur ba byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ji ltar thob pa'i don mchog tu 'dzin pas bstod pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Thus, etc. Having attained reality, the bodhisattvas are delighted, and in order to demonstrate the praise of the supreme meaning that they have attained, it is said, I will compose.

original: de nas skad cig de nyid las zhes pa ni dang po myong ba'i skad cig ma la'o //
analyzed: de nas skad cig de nyid las zhes pa ni dang po myong ba'i skad cig ma la'o //
translated: Then, in that very instant is in the first instant of experience.

original: snang ba skyes pas zhes pa ni stong pa la sogs pa'i rim pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum bskyed pas so //
analyzed: snang ba skyes pas zhes pa ni stong pa la sogs pa'i rim pas snang ba la sogs pa'i ye shes gsum bskyed pas so //
translated: By the arising of appearance, by the generation of the three intuitions of appearance, etc. , by the process of void, etc.

original: de nas chos nyid rtogs nas zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba mngon du byas nas so //
analyzed: de nas chos nyid rtogs nas zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba mngon du byas nas so //
translated: Then, having realized reality, having realized clearlight transparency,

original: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ma rig pa myong ba'i 'og tu thabs kyi ye shes bskyed cing snang ba'i ye shes kyi mig gdangs pa zhes pa ni @17b ye shes kyi sku dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas ma rig pa myong ba'i 'og tu thabs kyi ye shes bskyed cing snang ba'i ye shes kyi mig gdangs pa zhes pa ni @17b ye shes kyi sku dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: again, by the process of self-consecration, after the experience of nescience, the intuition of the means is generated, and the eye of the intuition of appearance is opened, which means that one comes to possess the intuition-body.

original: des ni stong pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba myong zhing yang stong pa chen po la sogs pa'i rim pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ye shes kyi sku gzung ba nye bar bstan to //
analyzed: des ni stong pa la sogs pa'i rim pas 'od gsal ba myong zhing yang stong pa chen po la sogs pa'i rim pas byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ye shes kyi sku gzung ba nye bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that by the process of void, etc. , one experiences clearlight transparency, and again by the process of great void, etc. , the intuition-body is grasped by the Bodhisattvas.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de dag dbang po rno ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon du byas pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis nye bar ston pa gang yin pa de dag dbang po rno ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis mngon du byas pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, those who are taught by the Tathagatas are the Bodhisattvas of sharp faculties.

original: de nas don 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstod pa'i sgro nas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas don 'di nyid byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bstod pa'i sgro nas bstan par bya ste /
translated: Then, this very meaning is taught by the sound of the praise of the Bodhisattvas:

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i chos nyid ston pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i chos nyid ston pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba la rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the reality which is individually intuited is the illumination of clear light.

original: rmad byung chen po'i chos rnams ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad de nyid du thim pa dang de las byung bas so //
analyzed: rmad byung chen po'i chos rnams ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni dngos po thams cad de nyid du thim pa dang de las byung bas so //
translated: The dharmas of the great marvel are the ultimate truth, because all things dissolve into that reality and arise from it.

original: spyi la mang po'i tshig gis zhes pa ni dngos po re re la khyab par byed pa zhes bya bas gsal ba'i phyogs la brten te /
analyzed: spyi la mang po'i tshig gis zhes pa ni dngos po re re la khyab par byed pa zhes bya bas gsal ba'i phyogs la brten te /
translated: The word ‚Äúgenerally‚Äù in ‚Äúin the general sense‚Äù means that it is a pervader of each thing, and it is based on the side of manifestation.

original: de'i spyi la mang po'i tshig brten nas smin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i spyi la mang po'i tshig brten nas smin pa bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúgenerally‚Äù is based on the generality of that, like a ripened fruit.

original: thams cad du khyab pas na zhes pas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i tshogs khyab par byed pas so //
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pas na zhes pas brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po'i tshogs khyab par byed pas so //
translated: Since it pervades everything, it pervades the collection of entities that are stable and moving.

original: ji skad du /üîΩbu ram mngar ba me yi ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / bu ram mngar ba me yi ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩJust as sweetness is the nature of molasses

original: ji ltar dro ba'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: ji ltar dro ba'i rang bzhin te //
translated: and heat is the nature of fire,

original: chos kun gyis ni stong pa nyid //
analyzed: chos kun gyis ni stong pa nyid //
translated: so emptiness is the nature of all phenomena.

original: de bzhin du ni rang bzhin 'dod //üîΩrnam ba du mas tha dad pa //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni rang bzhin 'dod // rnam ba du mas tha dad pa //
translated: Thus, it is asserted to be their nature.üîΩThings, which are differentiated in many ways,

original: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra //üîΩstong pa nyid mes bsregs gyur pa'i //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni gos dang 'dra // stong pa nyid mes bsregs gyur pa'i //
translated: are like clothes.üîΩThere is no differentiation in the ashes

original: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med //üîΩces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thal ba'i dbye ba gang yang med // ces 'byung ngo //
translated: that are burned by the fire of emptiness.

original: rtog ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtog ge pa rnams kyis phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgo nas de kho na nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: rtog ge zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtog ge pa rnams kyis phyogs dang gtan tshigs dang dpe'i sgo nas de kho na nyid rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: The words speculation, etc., mean that the truth cannot be realized by logicians through positions, reasons, and examples,

original: de spros pa med pas so //
analyzed: de spros pa med pas so //
translated: because it is free from conceptual elaborations.

original: ji skad du //üîΩrnam par rtog pa gzhan byed pa //
analyzed: ji skad du // rnam par rtog pa gzhan byed pa //
translated: As it is said:üîΩConceptualization is said to be the relative,

original: rnam par rtog pa kun rdzob bshad //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa kun rdzob bshad //
translated: because it is the cessation of conceptualization.

original: de nyid dam pa'i don yin te //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ldog pas so //
analyzed: de nyid dam pa'i don yin te //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ldog pas so //
translated: That is the ultimate.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: And likewise,

original: rten cing ma nges mi khyab pa //
analyzed: rten cing ma nges mi khyab pa //
translated: Dependent, not fixed, not pervasive,

original: kun rdzob dang ni tha dad ldan //üîΩbyis pas brten pa'i rtogs ge ni //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni tha dad ldan // byis pas brten pa'i rtogs ge ni //
translated: Different from the conventional,üîΩThe reasoning of the childish is not

original: de phyir de yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: de phyir de yi spyod yul min //
translated: The domain of that.

original: zhes bcom ldan 'das byams pas kyang gsungs so //üîΩrtog ge pas ni mi shes pa //
analyzed: zhes bcom ldan 'das byams pas kyang gsungs so // rtog ge pas ni mi shes pa //
translated: So it is said by the Lord Maitreya.üîΩThe yogi does not understand it,

original: rnal 'byor byis pas rtogs mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor byis pas rtogs mi 'gyur //
translated: Nor does the childish logician.

original: zhes dgongs pa lung bstan pa @18a * //üîΩlas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes dgongs pa lung bstan pa @18a * // las 'byung ngo //
translated: So it is said in the Sandhivyakarana.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i sku ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i sku ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The body which is like an illusion is the conventional truth.

original: yongs su dag pas na zhes pa ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa dag gis mi snang bar byed pas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pas na zhes pa ni ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa dag gis mi snang bar byed pas so //
translated: Because it is purified means that it is made to disappear by the whole- retention and the subsequent-destruction.

original: mig gi dbang po'i yul du gyur pas na zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa las cig car du langs te gdul bya rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i yul du gyur pas na zhes pa ni rim pa bzhi pa las cig car du langs te gdul bya rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the object of the eye faculty means that it arises all at once in the fourth stage and appears to the disciples.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'o zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i skur gyur to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'o zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis rdo rje'i skur gyur to //
translated: The body of Great Vajradhara is the body of the Vajra, which is attained by the concentration of union.üîΩFrom the ultimate truth up to the words ‚Äúhow wonderful!‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i bden pa nas brtsams te ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes pa ni stong bar gyur pas kyang sku gzung ba 'dzin pas 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas ngo mtshar ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa nas brtsams te ngo mtshar che'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o zhes pa ni stong bar gyur pas kyang sku gzung ba 'dzin pas 'gro ba'i don mdzad pas ngo mtshar ro //
translated: is the wonder that, although empty, the body performs the welfare of the world by means of the apprehension of objects.

original: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis pa dang bzhi pas rtogs par bya ba'o //
translated: The clear light is to be realized by means of the second and fourth stages.

original: des dag pas ni rang bzhin dang snang ba sgyu ma'i sku dag pas so //
analyzed: des dag pas ni rang bzhin dang snang ba sgyu ma'i sku dag pas so //
translated: By means of that purity, the purity of the natural and the illusory body.

original: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ces bya ba ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: Reality is the ultimate truth.

original: don ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: don ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The meaning is the conventional truth.

original: de dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bo yin pas de kho na nyid kyi don ni zung ngu 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: de dang dbyer med pa'i ngo bo yin pas de kho na nyid kyi don ni zung ngu 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The meaning of reality is the Vajra Body, which is to be attained by means of the stage of union, because it is the nature of the inseparability of those two.

original: des ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni sems rnam par dag pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi pa'i bdag nyid can bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos bstan pa yin no //
translated: That is the teaching of the Great Vajradhara, the Lord of the fourth stage, the stage of the pure mind, and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen pos zhes bstan to //
translated: it is taught that the Great VajradharaüîΩis the one who does not pass beyond just that,

original: de nyid ni 'da' bar mi bya bas na zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis som par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas nges par bsgom par bya bas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'da' bar mi bya bas na zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis som par byed pa'i rnal 'byor pas nges par bsgom par bya bas so //
translated: because the yogi who is doubtful about the two stages should definitely meditate on it.

original: de ston pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de ni le'u zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ston pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de ltar gyur pa'i rdo rje 'chang chen po ston par byed pa'i gzhung gi tshogs gang yin pa de ni le'u zhes bstan to //
translated: That which teaches that, and so on, is the collection of texts that teach the Great Vajradhara who is like that. That is taught to be a chapter.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas rdzogs pa'i rim pa so sor bstan pas so //
translated: Explained with an intention is because the perfect stage is taught individually by the application of contradictory words.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u dgu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the ninth chapter in the Illumination of the Lamp treatise.

original: // / sgrub pa mchog dang tha mal pa la gnas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu pa'i bshad pa brtsam par bya ste /

analyzed: des na don 'di yin te rim pa gnyis bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor pa le'u drug gis 'grub pa dang / spros pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa rnams su le'u bdun pa nas rtsol bar byas pa dang de bzhin @18b du le'u brgyad pa dang dgu pa dag gis gsang ba'i dbang bskur dang dam tshig rnams la gzhol ba byas pas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The yogi/nƒ´ who meditates on the two stages accomplishes the six chapters, and having exerted himself/herself in the conduct with elaboration, and so on, in the seventh chapter, and likewise in the eighth and ninth chapters, he/she is engaged in the secret empowerment and the commitments.

original: kyis mi gzigs pa dang / rigs 'bring yin pas gang gi tshe dngos grub thob par ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: kyis mi gzigs pa dang / rigs 'bring yin pas gang gi tshe dngos grub thob par ma gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: The tathƒÅgatas do not see him/her, and since he/she is of middling family, when he/she does not attain power,

original: rang gi lha'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang gi lha ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i snying po bskul ba ni de'i thugs ka'i nus pa 'gugs pa sngon du 'gro bar rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bas le'u bcu pa brtsam
analyzed: rang gi lha'i dngos grub bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir rang gi lha ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i snying po bskul ba ni de'i thugs ka'i nus pa 'gugs pa sngon du 'gro bar rang gi bdag nyid la 'jug par bya'o zhes bya bas le'u bcu pa brtsam
translated: Thus, chapter 10 should be composed.

original: par bya'o // le'u 'di'i bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: par bya'o // le'u 'di'i bsdus pa'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The summarized meaning of this chapter is as follows:

analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas lo skor ram zla ba drug gam gsum mam gnyis sam zla ba phyed kyi bar du rgyun mchad pa'i sgom par byed pas gang gi tshe dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis nying
translated: When a practitioner of the creation stage meditates continuously for a year, six months, three months, two months, or half a month, and if spiritual powers are not attained, then by summoning the essence of all tathƒÅgatas,

analyzed: po bskul bas 'grub par 'gyur ro //

translated: Because the Blessed Ones, Ak·π£obhya and so forth, the TathƒÅgatas, experience bliss and mental pleasure in the Buddha-fields of Abhirati and so forth, together with their own consorts, through the enjoyment of the play of the great bliss which is characterized by non-emission.

analyzed: de mi gzigs pas sgrub pa pos dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they do not look upon him, the adept does not attain power.

analyzed: de bas na de rnams kyis sgrub pa po la gzigs par bya ba'i phyir snying po bskul ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order that they look upon the adept, one should meditate on the invocation of the essence.

original: de'i thabs ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i thabs ni bzhi ste /

analyzed: bzang ba dang / sbyin pa dang / dbye ba dang / 'chad pa'o //

original: de la bzang gi rim pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bzang gi rim pa 'di yin te /

translated: In this regard, first of all, the yogƒ´ endowed with the yoga of the deity as desired should emanate a mass of light rays from the seed syllable bindu in the heart of the gnosis being.

analyzed: de nyid gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i gzugs su gyur nas nam mkha'i khams khyab nas mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing khams thob nas tshig snyan pa dang sgeg pa'i nyams dang ldan pas gsol ba gdab par bya ste /
translated: That [mass of light rays] should transform into the forms of the goddesses such as R≈´pavajrƒÅ, and so forth, pervading the realm of space. Having attained the buddhafields such as Abhirati, and so forth, [the goddesses] should supplicate with sweet words and a mood of flirtation.

translated: ‚ÄúO BhagavƒÅn, all tathƒÅgatas, for the sake of that person named so-and-so, who has faith and affection for you, in order to accept him, you should quickly look upon him.‚Äù

original: zhu ba rdzogs nas mchod pa phul zhing slar yang bsdu ba'i rim pas de rnam rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyis ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi thig le la 'jug par bya'o zhes pa ni bzang po'o //
analyzed: zhu ba rdzogs nas mchod pa phul zhing slar yang bsdu ba'i rim pas de rnam rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyis ye shes sems dpa'i snying ga'i sa bon gyi thig le la 'jug par bya'o zhes pa ni bzang po'o //

analyzed: de ltar byas kyang 'grub par ma gyur na de'i tshe sbyin pa'i thabs 'di ltar brtsam par bya'o //
translated: If one does it that way and it is not accomplished, then at that time one should begin this method of giving.

analyzed: de'i rim pa ni snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor pas ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi thig le la 'od kyi tshogs spros la de nyid me tog rdo rje ma la sogs pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo'i gzugs su 'gyur nas mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa
translated: The process is as follows: The yogin emanates a mass of light from the drop of the seed syllable of the gnosis being, and that itself becomes the form of the offering goddesses such as Pu·π£pavajrƒÅ, and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa la mchod pa byas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa la mchod pa byas te /
translated: They make offerings to the tathƒÅgatas such as Cittavajradhara and so forth who reside in the buddhafields such as Abhirati and so forth.

original: tshig 'jam pa la sogs pas bstod cing //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pa la sogs pas bstod cing //

analyzed: phyi dang nang dang gsang ba'i mchod pa byas te sgrub pa po'i ming bstan nas bcom ldan 'das la gsol ba btab ste /

original: des kyang gal te dngos grub mi gsal na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du rang gi thugs ka'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi thig le las kha dog nag po zhal gsum phyag drug pa zhal rnam par 'gyur pa /
analyzed: des kyang gal te dngos grub mi gsal na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du rang gi thugs ka'i ye shes sems dpa'i sa bon gyi thig le las kha dog nag po zhal gsum phyag drug pa zhal rnam par 'gyur pa /
translated: If even by that one does not clearly perceive the spiritual power, then just as before, from the drop of the seed syllable of the gnosis-being in one‚Äôs heart, one should imagine that one emanates a black, three-faced, six-armed, wrathful face-changing

analyzed: g-yon brkyang pa la zhags pa dang lcags kyu dang thob dang rdo rje dang dril bu dang sdigs mdzub 'dzin pa gnod mdzes khro bo'i rgyal po spros te bka' nod par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Nƒ´lada·πá·∏ça, who stands with his left leg straight, holding a noose, a goad, a sword, a vajra, a bell, and a threatening forefinger, and who is imagined to be listening to the command.

original: de nas de la bka' bsgo bar bya'o /
analyzed: de nas de la bka' bsgo bar bya'o /
translated: Then one should give him the command.

original: kye mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gsol ba thob shig / de nas de song nas nam mkha'i dkyil la gnas pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ting
analyzed: kye mngon par dga' ba la sogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la gsol ba thob shig / de nas de song nas nam mkha'i dkyil la gnas pa sangs rgyas kyi zhing la bzhugs pa mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i ting

analyzed: che ge mo zhes rdo rje can //

analyzed: khyed kyi @19b bstan pa la dga' ba //

analyzed: myur du dngos grub don gnyer ba //

analyzed: de ltar byas kyang 'grub par ma gyur na de'i tshe 'chad pa'i thabs bstan par bya ste /
