translated: First, the yogi meditates on the triangular fire ma·πá·∏çala arisen from ra·πÉ inside the dharma mudra of the mudra of the mother. analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa yang dangs shing mar me dang 'dra bar yongs su gyur nas yi ge h'um gi rnam par bsams la /

analyzed: rim pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the sequence‚Äù means ‚Äúin the order.‚Äù

original: bden ba gnyis gnyis su med par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bden ba gnyis gnyis su med par gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can no zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the characteristic of the non-duality of the two truths‚Äù means ‚Äúdwelling in the samadhi of union.‚Äù

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba yin pas zhes pa'i sku la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mchog yin no zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba yin pas zhes pa'i sku la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i mchog yin no zhes pa ni drang ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the secret of body, speech, and mind‚Äù means that the supreme of Vairochana, etc. is the body, etc. This is the interpretable meaning.

original: rus spal ma dang zla ba ma dang 'dod pa'i gdugs gsum byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bos khyab pas na zab pa ste nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: rus spal ma dang zla ba ma dang 'dod pa'i gdugs gsum byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bos khyab pas na zab pa ste nges pa'i don to //
translated: The three, the tortoise, the moon, and the parasol of desire, are profound, i.e., of definitive meaning, because they are pervaded by the nature of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: gdul bya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba'i dbye bas bzang ba la sogs pa'i thabs bzhi'i rim pas tha dad pa'i bsgom pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni bsam pa ji lta ba'i dbye bas bzang ba la sogs pa'i thabs bzhi'i rim pas tha dad pa'i bsgom pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The disciples and so on indicate the teaching of the meditation which is differentiated by the sequence of the four means, good and so on, by the division according to the various intentions.

original: mkhyen pa ni de la brten pa de'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: mkhyen pa ni de la brten pa de'i ngo bos so //
translated: The knowledge is based on that, and is of its nature.

original: mi slu ba ni ji ltar bya ba'i snying po bskul ba'i 'bras bu ster ba'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba ni ji ltar bya ba'i snying po bskul ba'i 'bras bu ster ba'o //
translated: The non-deceptive is the bestowal of the fruit which is the essence of what is to be done, the arousal of the Thought of Enlightenment.

original: a'a li dang k'a li las skyes pa rnams te /
analyzed: a'a li dang k'a li las skyes pa rnams te /
translated: The arisen from the vowels and consonants are the winds.

original: rlung bskul bas gnas brgyad po las skyes pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rlung bskul bas gnas brgyad po las skyes pa'i dbyangs dang gsal byed las byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they arise from the eight places, i.e., the vowels and consonants which are aroused by the winds.

original: sbrul dang mgo med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni le'u bcu bzhi pa nas nges pa'i tshig 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbrul dang mgo med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni le'u bcu bzhi pa nas nges pa'i tshig 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The serpent, headless, and so on, will be explained etymologically in chapter fourteen.

original: gtso bo ste yi ge aom la sogs gsum mo zhes pa ni pho dang mo dang ma ning gi dbye bas de rnams de nyid du bsdus pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo ste yi ge aom la sogs gsum mo zhes pa ni pho dang mo dang ma ning gi dbye bas de rnams de nyid du bsdus pas so //
translated: The principal ones are the three syllables, A, U, and M, because they are included in those three by the division into male, female, and neutral.

original: gsal bar byas pa'o zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas yi ge gsum gsal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gsal bar byas pa'o zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas yi ge gsum gsal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: They are made manifest, because the three syllables are made manifest by the arousing of the essence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The Tathagatas, because they are the nature of the purities of body and so forth.

original: gsang ba'o zhes btags pa'i zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sbas pa nyid du mngon par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba'o zhes btags pa'i zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis sbas pa nyid du mngon par bzhed pa'o //
translated: They are called secret, because they are intended as hidden by all the Tathagatas.

original: dngos grub chen po'i thabs so zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos grub chen po'i thabs so zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The means of the great attainment, because they are the first union and so forth.

original: phul du byung ba'o zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: phul du byung ba'o zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas myur du dngos grub thob par 'gyur bas so //
translated: They are excellent, because one quickly attains the attainment by arousing the essence.

original: mi slu ba ste thes pa ni ji ltar byas pa'i snying pos bskul ba'i de ltar 'bras bu bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mi slu ba ste thes pa ni ji ltar byas pa'i snying pos bskul ba'i de ltar 'bras bu bskyed pa'o //
translated: They are infallible, because the result is produced in that way by the arousing of the essence in that way.

original: shes rab dang zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas so //
analyzed: shes rab dang zhes pa ni shes rab dang thabs dang nye bar thob pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas so //
translated: Wisdom is the nature of wisdom, method, and near attainment.

original: thabs kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pas ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thabs kyi ye shes kyi bdag nyid yin pas na zhes pas ni snang ba mched pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: Since it is the nature of the wisdom of method, it is the nature of the wisdom of the increase of appearance.

original: 'dod chags @20b la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags @20b la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang 'dod chags bar ma'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are attachment, freedom from attachment, and middling attachment.

original: de rnams kyi dbye ba dang rjes su dbye ba zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang / ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi dbye ba dang rjes su dbye ba zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin sum cu rtsa gsum dang thabs kyi rang bzhin bzhi bcu dang / ma rig pa'i rang bzhin bdun no //
translated: Their divisions and subdivisions are the thirty-three that are the nature of wisdom, the forty that are the nature of method, and the seven that are the nature of ignorance.

original: rjes su dbye ba ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su dbye ba ni nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: The subdivisions are the two divisions of day and night.

original: brgya drug cu'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: brgya drug cu'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The divisions are one hundred and sixty.

original: rgya mtsho dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rgya mtsho dang mnyam pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni /
translated: Because it is equal to the ocean.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis brgal bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyis brgal bar mi nus pa'i phyir rgya mtsho dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is like an ocean because it is not possible for ordinary people to cross it.

original: de rnams kyi zhes pa ni de'i yul du'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes pa ni de'i yul du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir‚Äù means in its domain.

original: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin rnams ni sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: The nature of suffering, mental unhappiness, and so on are mental factors.

original: zil gyis mnan nas zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i lam gyis spangs nas so //
analyzed: zil gyis mnan nas zhes pa ni snang ba nye bar thob pa la sogs pa'i rim pa dang sngags dang phyag rgya la sogs pa'i lam gyis spangs nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving overcome‚Äù means having abandoned them by the path of obtaining the light, and so on, and by the path of mantra, seal, and so on.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin mngon du byas nas so //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin mngon du byas nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of supreme joy‚Äù means having actualized the nature of clear light.

original: rol bar mdzad pas na zhes pa ni spyod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rol bar mdzad pas na zhes pa ni spyod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy play‚Äù means by conduct.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ces pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ste sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ces pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ste sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúAll suffering‚Äù is the consciousnesses of engagement, and so on, because they are the cause of all suffering.

original: de rnams bsreg bu yin pa'i phyir bud shing ngo //
analyzed: de rnams bsreg bu yin pa'i phyir bud shing ngo //
translated: They are fuel because they are to be burned.

original: de rnams 'od gsal ba'i mes srag  par mdzad pas na 'bar ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'od gsal ba'i mes srag  par mdzad pas na 'bar ba'o //
translated: Since he burns them with the fire of clear light, he is blazing.

original: de nyid kyis na drag po ste //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na drag po ste //
translated: And just because of that, he is fierce.

original: zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: This is because he has the nature of wisdom.üîΩHe is the one who arises as the nature of wrath, because he has conquered the habitual tendencies of all conceptual thoughts.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.

original: khro bo'i bdag nyid can du byung ba'o zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa'i bag chags bcom pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo //üîΩtha mal pa bas kyang zhes pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ma skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: khro bo'i bdag nyid can du byung ba'o zhes pa ni rnam par rtog pa ma lus pa'i bag chags bcom pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang ngo // tha mal pa bas kyang zhes pa ni rnam par 'byed pa ma skyes pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis kyang ngo //
translated: He is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.

original: rab tu rgyas pa'i spyan bgrad par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni chog mi shes pas mi rgyas par byed pas so //üîΩgsung la rtag tu 'jug pa ste //üîΩzhes pa ni gsung 'jug pa de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rgyas pa'i spyan bgrad par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni chog mi shes pas mi rgyas par byed pas so // gsung la rtag tu 'jug pa ste // zhes pa ni gsung 'jug pa de la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.

original: de la gzhol par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las rlung byung zhing de la yi ge la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: de la gzhol par mdzad pa yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las rlung byung zhing de la yi ge la sogs pa rab tu 'jug go //
translated: He is the one who is more wrathful than the wrathful, because he is the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara.üîΩHe is the one who is more

original: nam mkha' las ni rlung 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pas so //üîΩsku dang gsung dang @21a * //
analyzed: nam mkha' las ni rlung 'byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pas so // sku dang gsung dang @21a * //
translated: The statement wind arises from space and so on is explained.üîΩCultivation by way of the vajra body, speech, and mind.

original: thugs rdo rje'i tshul gyis bsgom pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid rjes su dran nas bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje'i tshul gyis bsgom pa zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i chos nyid rjes su dran nas bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate by recollecting the reality of the body and so on.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: yongs su shes pas zhes pa ni dbyer med pas zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pas zhes pa ni dbyer med pas zhes pa'o //
translated: By thorough knowledge means by indivisibility.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nges par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni nges par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate means one should ascertain.

original: bya ba'i khyad par 'di ni zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bya ba'i khyad par 'di ni zhes pa ni bsgom pa'i bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinctive activity, which is the distinctive activity of cultivation.

original: 'di ni lus so zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni lus so zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i bdag nyid do //
translated: This is the body, which is the nature of the four great elements.

original: 'di ni ngag go zhes pa ni a'a li k'a li ngo bo rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ngag go zhes pa ni a'a li k'a li ngo bo rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is speech, which is the nature of the vowels and consonants, along with conceptuality.

original: 'di ni yid do zhes pa ni dngos po yongs su shes pa'i bdag nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yid do zhes pa ni dngos po yongs su shes pa'i bdag nyid rtog pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: This is mind, which is the nature of the thorough knowledge of entities, along with conceptuality.

original: de dag de kho na nyid du bsam par 'gyur na tha dad par mi dmigs te dbyer med pas na logs su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag de kho na nyid du bsam par 'gyur na tha dad par mi dmigs te dbyer med pas na logs su mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one considers them in reality, they are not perceived as separate, because they are inseparable, and therefore not perceived as distinct.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang bsam gtan gyi lus yod pa dang / srid pa bar mdor yang dbang po tshang bas phra mo'i lus can yin pas so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang bsam gtan gyi lus yod pa dang / srid pa bar mdor yang dbang po tshang bas phra mo'i lus can yin pas so //
translated: And in the formless realm, there is a body of the absorptions, and in the intermediate existence, there is a body of subtle form, since the faculties are complete.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: gcig la gcig brten pa med pa zhes smos te ngag dang sems dag gi lus ni rten du rigs pa ma yin te gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa med pa zhes smos te ngag dang sems dag gi lus ni rten du rigs pa ma yin te gzugs can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout mutual dependence,‚Äù because it is not logical that speech and mind are the support of the body, since they are not form.

original: ngag dang sems ni lus can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ngag dang sems ni lus can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Speech and mind are not embodied.

original: de bzhin du ngag dang sems dag kyang lus kyi rten ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ngag dang sems dag kyang lus kyi rten ma yin no zhes bshad par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, it should be stated that the body is not the support of speech and mind,

original: sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pas so //
analyzed: sems lus lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pas so //
translated: because it is said in the second chapter: ‚ÄúThe body is like the mind, etc.‚Äù

original: dbyer med pas sku la sogs pa ni gsum ro gcig pa ste mtshungs par 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyer med pas sku la sogs pa ni gsum ro gcig pa ste mtshungs par 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, inseparable, the body, etc., are of one taste, i.e., they are of the same luminous nature.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gang na yang mi gnas pa zhes pa ni so sor nges pa med pas kun du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gang na yang mi gnas pa zhes pa ni so sor nges pa med pas kun du gnas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúit does not abide anywhere‚Äù means that it abides everywhere, since it is not restricted to any particular place.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the intended meaning‚Äù means that it is taught by the very clear reality.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dbyer med pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdu ba bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, etc. explains the summary of the indivisible concentration.

original: sdud par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul ba'i gnas skabs bstan te /
analyzed: sdud par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul ba'i gnas skabs bstan te /
translated: The state of arousing the essence is taught by the one who gathers, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i go 'phang thob pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i go 'phang thob pas so //
translated: The tathƒÅgatas are those who have attained the stage of non-conceptuality.

original: spyan la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgya mtsho las rnam par dag pa'i grus pha rol du gshegs so //
analyzed: spyan la sogs pa zhes pa ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rgya mtsho las rnam par dag pa'i grus pha rol du gshegs so //
translated: The eyes, etc. are those who have gone to the other shore by the ship of the purification of the ocean of the four great elements.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste @21b zhes pa ni yi ge gsum las 'byung bas so //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa ste @21b zhes pa ni yi ge gsum las 'byung bas so //
translated: Vairocana, etc. are those who arise from the three syllables.

original: de dag phan tshun kun du chags pa zhes pa ni snying po bskul ba'i rim pa dang mthun pas phan tshun bde ba chen po myong nas so //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun kun du chags pa zhes pa ni snying po bskul ba'i rim pa dang mthun pas phan tshun bde ba chen po myong nas so //
translated: Mutual passion means that, in accordance with the process of arousing the essence, they experience great bliss mutually.

original: de nyid mi 'jig pa nyid pas //
analyzed: de nyid mi 'jig pa nyid pas //
translated: Because of that, they are not destroyed.

original: zhes pa ni bskal ba la sogs pa'i bar du bzhugs pas mi phyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni bskal ba la sogs pa'i bar du bzhugs pas mi phyed pa'o //
translated: Since they remain for an eon and so forth, they are not divided.

original: thugs rtse gcig tu bzhag cing zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rgyur gyur pa snying po bskul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la'o //
analyzed: thugs rtse gcig tu bzhag cing zhes pa ni thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i rgyur gyur pa snying po bskul ba'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par la'o //
translated: The phrase with their minds one-pointed refers to the special meditative concentration that has the characteristic of arousing the essence, which is the cause of the nondual union of means and wisdom.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa'i zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa'i zhes pa ni snying po bskul bas don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The phrase they supplicate means that they long for the arousal of the essence.

original: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: 'di skad ces bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul bar bya ba'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: The phrase they say this and so forth teaches the cause of arousing the essence.

original: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni byed tshig dang po'i tshig gi mtha' can no //
analyzed: 'dir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgra ni byed tshig dang po'i tshig gi mtha' can no //
translated: Here, the word tathƒÅgata has the ending of the first-person singular.

original: gcig ni bod pa dang gnyis ni byed pa la'o //
analyzed: gcig ni bod pa dang gnyis ni byed pa la'o //
translated: One is for the present and two are for the action.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that, it says, The two of them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúall tathƒÅgatas‚Äù and so on is taught.

original: bstan pa'i bya ba la mngon par sbyor ba ste zhes pa ni byed pa po'i gsum pa mi mngon pas byed tshig dang po'i mang po'i tshig go //
analyzed: bstan pa'i bya ba la mngon par sbyor ba ste zhes pa ni byed pa po'i gsum pa mi mngon pas byed tshig dang po'i mang po'i tshig go //

analyzed: rdzogs pa'o zhes pa ni byang chub kyi shing drung la grub pa'o //

translated: ‚ÄúThe goddesses‚Äù are the mothers of the families and so on.

original: de rnams lan cig spyod pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas zhes pa ni pho nya mo dang bka' nyan mo dang bran mo'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: de rnams lan cig spyod pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas zhes pa ni pho nya mo dang bka' nyan mo dang bran mo'i dbye bas so //

analyzed: tshad med pa gnyis pas zhes pa ni sems can gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis lha mo rnams kyang mtha' yas pa yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the two immeasurables‚Äù is because the goddesses are infinite by the power of the wishes of sentient beings.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin mtha' yas pa zhes le'u bcu gsum pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúInfinite samƒÅdhis‚Äù is from the thirteenth chapter.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,

analyzed: nye bar mtshon pa tsam du gyur pa ste zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚Äúmerely an illustration‚Äù is taught.

original: yul la nye bar spyod pas thar pa thob par 'dod pa'o zhes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams las bskyed pas yul gyi bde ba 'dod pa'i sgo nas thar par 'dod pas so //

original: 'dun pa dang rjes su mthun pas zhes pa ni snyigs ma lnga'i dus su chags pa'i rol pa la sogs pa'i rgya che ba'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pas rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa'o //

translated: The desire for liberation through the conformity of desire is the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara through the conduct that has the characteristic of vastness, such as the enjoyment of passion, in the time of the five degenerations.

original: de'i ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i'o //üîΩbdag nyid ces bya ba la @22a * //
analyzed: de'i ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i'o // bdag nyid ces bya ba la @22a * //

analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po gcig pus 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rigs can gyis sems can gyi khams rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir bud med dang skyes pa'i dbye ba dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbye ba rol mo dang 'dra bar bstan par mdzad pa de nyid
translated: The one Great Vajradhara, in order to take care of the realm of sentient beings of the type of passion, etc.,

translated: The ‚Äúassembly‚Äù is the rite of the assembly wheel, and that has already been explained.

original: thabs dang ni zhes pa la zhi ba la sogs pa la ltos pas me thab bzhi dang las thams cad pa'i thab gcig ste lnga'o //
analyzed: thabs dang ni zhes pa la zhi ba la sogs pa la ltos pas me thab bzhi dang las thams cad pa'i thab gcig ste lnga'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMethod‚Äù refers to the five hearths: the four hearths for pacification and so forth, and the one hearth for all activities.

original: de rnams kyi zlum po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang tshad kyang lung ji lta ba bzhin du 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zlum po la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang tshad kyang lung ji lta ba bzhin du 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: The shapes of the circles and so on and their measurements should be followed according to the scriptures.

original: gzhan dag na re me thab ni mtha' yas par @23b zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re me thab ni mtha' yas par @23b zer ro //
translated: Others say that the hearth is limitless.

original: rigs kyi dbye ba yis ni lngar rigs so //
analyzed: rigs kyi dbye ba yis ni lngar rigs so //
translated: It is classified as five by the division of the families.

original: zhes kho bo cag gi bla ma'i zhal lnga nas gsung ngo //
analyzed: zhes kho bo cag gi bla ma'i zhal lnga nas gsung ngo //
translated: This is what our teacher's mouth has said.

original: nges pa'i don gyi phyogs su kha ni thab yin no zhes sngar bshad zin pas 'dir ma bstan to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi phyogs su kha ni thab yin no zhes sngar bshad zin pas 'dir ma bstan to //
translated: Since it has already been explained that the hearth is in the direction of the definitive meaning, it is not taught here.

original: gtor ma ni lha dang lha ma yin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa du ma ste mdor bsdus na rnam pa gsum yin te /
analyzed: gtor ma ni lha dang lha ma yin pa'i dbye bas rnam pa du ma ste mdor bsdus na rnam pa gsum yin te /
translated: The bali offering is of many types by the division of gods and demigods, but in brief there are three types:

original: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i gtor ma dang / 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma dang / khro bo'i rgyal po'i gtor ma ste sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bzhi'i gtor ma dang / 'byung po thams cad kyi gtor ma dang / khro bo'i rgyal po'i gtor ma ste sngar bshad zin to //
translated: the bali offering of the four great kings, the bali offering of all spirits, and the bali offering of the king of wrathful deities, as explained before.

original: nges pa'i don gyi phyogs su thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid de nang gi bdag nyid ni gtor ma'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi phyogs su thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i mtshan nyid de nang gi bdag nyid ni gtor ma'o //
translated: In the direction of the definitive meaning, the bali offering is of the nature of the union of method and wisdom.

original: lus dang ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lus dang ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The body and the voice are of two kinds.

original: rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma gnyis kyi'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma gnyis kyi'o //
translated: They are those of the male and female practitioners.

original: de yang lus dang ngag gi brda'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de yang lus dang ngag gi brda'i bdag nyid do //
translated: And they are of the nature of the bodily and verbal signs.

original: de rnams las rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig mthun par shes nas 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams las rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi dam tshig mthun par shes nas 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From among those, the male and female practitioners, knowing the common pledges, gather together.

original: de la lus kyi brda ni sor mo gcig dang sor mo gnyis rab tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la lus kyi brda ni sor mo gcig dang sor mo gnyis rab tu bstan pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Therein, the bodily signs are characterized by the display of one finger or two fingers.

original: ngag gi brda ni bhu su ku la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ngag gi brda ni bhu su ku la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The verbal signs are characterized by bhusuku and so forth.

original: go rims dang zhes pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: go rims dang zhes pa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The sequence is fivefold.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste de rnams kyis ngag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid mngon du bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa dang / sems rnam par dag pa dang / bdag la byin gyis brlab pa dang / mngon par byang chub pa dang / zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa ste de rnams kyis ngag la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid mngon du bya'o //
translated: Reality should be realized by means of the stages of vajra repetition, mind purification, self-consecration, manifest enlightenment, and union, through the purification of speech and so forth.

original: de nyid ni rnam pa drug ste rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / yongs su brtag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam pa drug ste rlung gi de kho na nyid dang / sngags kyi de kho na nyid dang / ye shes kyi de kho na nyid dang / lha'i de kho na nyid dang / dkyil 'khor gyi de kho na nyid dang / yongs su brtag pa'i lha'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: That is sixfold: the reality of the wind, the reality of the mantra, the reality of the intuition, the reality of the deity, the reality of the mandala, and the reality of the imagined deity.

original: de yang le'u drug pa las bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang le'u drug pa las bshad zin to //
translated: And that has been explained in the sixth chapter.

original: de ni rnam pa bdun gyi sngags kyi tshul grags pa ste rim pa gnyis rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bdun gyi sngags kyi tshul grags pa ste rim pa gnyis rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mantra way is renowned as having seven aspects, because it expresses the two stages.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin la gnas nas zhes pa ni rnam par dag pa mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: Having entered the concentration of the perfection stage means having realized the pure.

original: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhal gyi man ngag gi rim pas sngags kyi spyod pa rnam pa bdun 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i tshul gyi chos ni lam gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de las rdzogs pa ni 'byung ba ste phyi
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas zhal gyi man ngag gi rim pas sngags kyi spyod pa rnam pa bdun 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i tshul gyi chos ni lam gyi chos nyid gang yin pa de las rdzogs pa ni 'byung ba ste phyi
translated: That way is the reality of the path, from which perfection arises, that is, the path of seeing.

original: rol du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rol du 'byung ba'o //
translated: and the result is the arising of the enjoyment.

original: @24a * // tshig phrad rnams mngon du ma yin pas de'i sgras ni mang du gces par mi mdzad pa'i don bstan to //
analyzed: @24a * // tshig phrad rnams mngon du ma yin pas de'i sgras ni mang du gces par mi mdzad pa'i don bstan to //
translated: Since the particles are not manifest, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù indicates the teaching of the meaning of the non-existence of the many.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas las dang po pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma gzigs pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas las dang po pa rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ma gzigs pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows that the TathƒÅgatas do not see the beginners.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te yan lag dang nyid lag dang bcas pa'i sngags kyi theg pa ji srid yod pa de gzung ba'am bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten pa 'dis mi nus so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te yan lag dang nyid lag dang bcas pa'i sngags kyi theg pa ji srid yod pa de gzung ba'am bsgrub par bya ba 'jig rten pa 'dis mi nus so //
translated: The idea is this: As long as the Mantra Vehicle with its branches and sub-branches exists, it cannot be grasped or accomplished by this worldly [person].

original: 'on kyang sngags tsam la brten te 'ba' zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams mi gzigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngags tsam la brten te 'ba' zhig tu zad par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de rnams mi gzigs so //
translated: However, it is only by relying on the mere mantra that [the worldly person] will be exhausted, and thus the TathƒÅgatas do not see him.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs pa med pas de rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de rnams kyis gzigs pa'i thabs snying po bskul ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gzigs pa med pas de rnams 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas de rnams kyis gzigs pa'i thabs snying po bskul ba'i mtshan nyid bshad par bya ste /
translated: Thus, in order to explain the method of their seeing, which is the characteristic of the invocation of the essence, he says,

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan par bya ste /
translated: for that reason... and so on.

original: rol pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: rol pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes pa ni spros pa dang bcas pa'i spyod pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: By means of play and so on refers to the conduct with elaboration.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'i bde ba'o //
translated: The bliss of supreme joy is the bliss of clear light.

original: sgrub pa po la gzigs par mi mdzad de zhes pa ni de la mngon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la gzigs par mi mdzad de zhes pa ni de la mngon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Do not see the adept means that they do not manifest to him.

original: thugs rje chen pos gzhan dbang du gyur pas skyes bu yang yin la ye shes thob pas chen po yang yin pa ste /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos gzhan dbang du gyur pas skyes bu yang yin la ye shes thob pas chen po yang yin pa ste /
translated: He is a great being because he is under the control of great compassion, and he is great because he has attained gnosis.

original: skyes bu chen po mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The great beings are Akshobhya and so on.

original: sgrub pa po la mngon sum du mdzad pas zhes pa ni sgrub pa po la mngon du gyur pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la mngon sum du mdzad pas zhes pa ni sgrub pa po la mngon du gyur pas so //
translated: The phrase because of being manifest to the adept means because of being manifest to the adept.

original: dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dad pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to generate faith,

original: zhes pa ni dngos grub mthong bas sgrub pa po'i sems dga' ba dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dngos grub mthong bas sgrub pa po'i sems dga' ba dang ldan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means in order to cause the adept's mind to be endowed with joy by seeing the spiritual powers.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang bar 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang bar 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni sku rdo rje la sogs pa de las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge that is the secret of body, speech, and mind is the knowledge of the body vajra, etc., because it is born from that.

original: sprul la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi lha rnams so zhes pa ni sprul la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
analyzed: sprul la sogs pa'i gsang sngags kyi lha rnams so zhes pa ni sprul la sogs pa byin gyis rlob par byed pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams so //
translated: The mantra deities such as Nƒ´laka·πá·π≠ha are the tathƒÅgatas who consecrate Nƒ´laka·πá·π≠ha, etc.

original: srog gi thugs yin pas so //
analyzed: srog gi thugs yin pas so //
translated: Because they are the life-mind of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: rab tu sad par byed pa zhes pa ni rang rang gi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sgrub pa po gang gis mngon du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu sad par byed pa zhes pa ni rang rang gi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams sgrub pa po gang gis mngon du byas pa'o //
translated: The awakeners are the tathƒÅgatas who abide in their own samƒÅdhi, which are manifested by the adept.

original: snod ma yin pa rnams la zhes pa ni skal ba med pa nyan @24b thos pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: snod ma yin pa rnams la zhes pa ni skal ba med pa nyan @24b thos pa la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: To those who are not vessels means to those who are unfortunate, such as the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: mchog tu sba bar bya'o zhes pa ni shin tu bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu sba bar bya'o zhes pa ni shin tu bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: It should be extremely concealed, that is, it should not be taught at all.

original: gti mug gi rigs can rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can no //üîΩde rnams kyi spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ste sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can sngags gang gis yang dag par byon cing zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni dam
analyzed: gti mug gi rigs can rnams zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs can no // de rnams kyi spyan ma la sogs pa rnams kyi sku la sogs pa mi phyed pa'i ngo bo ste sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can sngags gang gis yang dag par byon cing zhes pa ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba de ni dam
translated: Those who are of the family of delusion means those who are of the family of Vairocana.

original: tshig ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshig ces bya'o //
translated: The body and so forth of LocanƒÅ and so forth, which is of the nature of indivisibility, which is the nature of the three beings, by which mantra they come forth means that which is endowed with the supreme of all aspects. That is called commitment.

original: de bzhin du sngags pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sngags pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Similarly, by the mantra practitioners means by those who are yogis of the creation stage.

original: dmigs shing ni gzung bar bya ba'o//
analyzed: dmigs shing ni gzung bar bya ba'o//
translated: Contemplating means apprehending.

original: yid la byed pas ni zhes pa ni yid kyi bya ba bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pas ni zhes pa ni yid kyi bya ba bsgom pa'i bdag nyid kyis dmigs pa'o //
translated: By mental activity means by the mental activity of the nature of meditation, one apprehends.

original: yi ge aom ni phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge aom ni phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: The syllable O·πÄ is the salutation.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rgyur gyur pa'i sngags bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas thugs rdo rje 'chang gi rgyur gyur pa'i sngags bstan par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, etc.

original: yi ge h'um ni sprin gyi sgra'o //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ni sprin gyi sgra'o //
translated: The syllable H≈™·πÄ is the sound of the clouds.

original: chos 'dzin pa thams cad ces pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: chos 'dzin pa thams cad ces pa ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs can rnams kyi'o //
translated: All the holders of the Dharma are those who belong to the family of AmitƒÅbha.

original: sku la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sku la sogs pa dmigs pa zhes pa ni sku la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The visualization of the body, etc. is the completion of the body, etc.

original: yi ge a'a:zhes pa ni /
analyzed: yi ge a'a:zhes pa ni /
translated: The syllable A·∏§ is

original: gsung rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsung rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the seed of VƒÅgƒ´≈õvara.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de zhes pa ni thams cad kyi nang du chud pas so //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po nyid de zhes pa ni thams cad kyi nang du chud pas so //
translated: The Great Vajradhara is the one who includes all.

original: de'i sku las yi ge aom zhes pa ni sku'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: de'i sku las yi ge aom zhes pa ni sku'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: From his body, the syllable O·πÄ, because it is the nature of the body.

original: gsung la yi ge a'a:zhes pa ni gsung gi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: gsung la yi ge a'a:zhes pa ni gsung gi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: From his speech, the syllable A·∏§, because it is the nature of speech.

original: thugs la yi ge h'um zhes pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: thugs la yi ge h'um zhes pa ni thugs kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: From his mind, the syllable H≈™·πÄ, because it is the nature of mind.

original: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs las so //
analyzed: go rims ji lta ba bzhin du zhes pa ni sku gsung thugs las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn due order‚Äù means from body, speech, and mind.

original: tshig gi lam ni kha ste zhes pa ni zhal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi lam ni kha ste zhes pa ni zhal zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe path of words‚Äù is the mouth, which is called ‚Äúface.‚Äù

original: ston pa'o zhes pa ni gsung gis yi ge gsum ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ston pa'o zhes pa ni gsung gis yi ge gsum ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe teacher‚Äù is the speech that teaches the three syllables.

original: thugs dang sku dag kyang zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thugs dang sku dag kyang zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mind and body‚Äù

original: thugs dang sku la dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: thugs dang sku la dbyer med pas so //
translated: are inseparable from the mind and body.

original: sems ni lus lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems ni lus lta bu zhes pa la sogs pa le'u gnyis pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said in the second chapter, ‚ÄúThe mind is like the body.‚Äù

original: gsal ba'i tshig gis zhes pa ni thugs dang sku'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'i gsung gis so //
analyzed: gsal ba'i tshig gis zhes pa ni thugs dang sku'i ngo bor yongs su gyur pa'i gsung gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúWith clear words‚Äù means with the speech that has become the essence of the mind and body.

original: ji lta ba'i gsung zhen zhes pa ni las kyi yul 'dri ba'o //üîΩbud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi yi ge rnams te zhes pa ni de la bud med kyi rang @25a * //
analyzed: ji lta ba'i gsung zhen zhes pa ni las kyi yul 'dri ba'o // bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning gi yi ge rnams te zhes pa ni de la bud med kyi rang @25a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat kind of speech?‚Äù is the question about the object of the action.

original: bzhin aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
analyzed: bzhin aa la sogs pa dbyangs bcu drug go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe letters of female, male, and neutral‚Äù means that among them, the nature of the female is the sixteen vowels beginning with a.

original: skyes pa'i rang bzhin ka nas ma'i bar du gsal bya nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rang bzhin ka nas ma'i bar du gsal bya nyi shu rtsa lnga'o //
translated: The nature of the male is the twenty-five consonants from ka to ma.

original: ma ning gi rang bzhin ni mthar gnas dang drod kyi yi ge brgyad do //
analyzed: ma ning gi rang bzhin ni mthar gnas dang drod kyi yi ge brgyad do //
translated: The nature of the neuter is the eight letters of the end-state and heat.

original: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: de yang sngar bshad zin to //
translated: And that has been explained previously.

original: gang du bsdus par gyur pa zhes pa ni yi ge gsum la'o //
analyzed: gang du bsdus par gyur pa zhes pa ni yi ge gsum la'o //
translated: Where is it collected? In the three letters.

original: de la shes rab kyi rang bzhin dbyangs kyi sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi rang bzhin dbyangs kyi sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las bud med kyi rang bzhin ni yi ge aa'o //
translated: There, the nature of wisdom is the class of vowels, which is transformed into the nature of a woman, the letter A.

original: thabs kyi rang bzhin gsal bya'i sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um ngo //
analyzed: thabs kyi rang bzhin gsal bya'i sde tshan yongs su gyur pa las yi ge h'um ngo //
translated: The nature of method is the class of consonants, which is transformed into the letter Hum.

original: ma ning gi rang bzhin ya la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i rang bzhin ni aom mo //
analyzed: ma ning gi rang bzhin ya la sogs pa yongs su gyur pa las thabs dang shes rab snyoms par zhugs pa'i rang bzhin ni aom mo //
translated: The nature of the neuter is the ya class, etc., which is transformed into the nature of the union of method and wisdom, the letter Om.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,

original: yi ge gsum gsungs so zhes ston to //
analyzed: yi ge gsum gsungs so zhes ston to //
translated: it is said that the three letters are taught.

original: sngags bsdus pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge gsum gyi nus pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags bsdus pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge gsum gyi nus pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the power of the three letters begins with the teaching of the condensed mantra, etc.

original: yi ge gsum po 'di gsungs tsam gyis te zhes pa ni sgrub pa pos brjod pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: yi ge gsum po 'di gsungs tsam gyis te zhes pa ni sgrub pa pos brjod pa tsam gyis so //
translated: By merely uttering these three syllables, that is, by the mere utterance of the practitioner.
