original: ji ltar rang gi ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as their own places.

original: rigs dang 'brel pa'i lha yi tshogs //
analyzed: rigs dang 'brel pa'i lha yi tshogs //
translated: The hosts of gods related to the clans.

original: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs las byung ba khro bo dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rigs las byung ba khro bo dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs so //
translated: The hosts of wrathful deities, goddesses, and bodhisattvas who have arisen from the clans of Vairochana, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis so zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gtso bo yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bzhi'i nye bar mtshon pa nyid kyis so zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa gtso bo yin pas so //
translated: By the very indication of the four Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc. are the chief ones.

original: gtso bo gzung bas yon tan yod pa yang don gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtso bo gzung bas yon tan yod pa yang don gyis gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the retention of the chief ones, the existence of the qualities is also retained by implication.

original: rdo rje ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: rdo rje ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes so //
translated: The vajra is the intuition of the Dharma-realm.

original: de nyid dam tshig gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i dam tshig ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid dam tshig gang la yod pa de ni rdo rje'i dam tshig ste chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: That is the commitment which exists in it, and it is the commitment of the vajra, which is of the nature of the intuition of the Dharma-realm.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes pa ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: The Great Vajradhara is the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gis bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pas dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gis bskyed pa'i dkyil 'khor ba rnams nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches the withdrawal of the mandala deities generated by the supreme victor mandala.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor dang bcas pas kyang snying po bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor dang bcas pas kyang snying po bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: There, etc. teaches the invocation of the essence by the retinue.

original: dam pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la ltos nas mchog go //
analyzed: dam pa ni bya ba'i rgyud la sogs pa la ltos nas mchog go //
translated: Supreme means supreme in comparison to Action Tantra, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka'i nus pa dgug pa gsang ba yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs ka'i nus pa dgug pa gsang ba yin pas so //
translated: Secret of the Tathagatas means secret of the power of the heart of the Tathagatas.

original: dbyer med pas zhes pa ni rten dang brten pa dbyer med pa nye bar brtags pas tshem bu du ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyer med pas zhes pa ni rten dang brten pa dbyer med pa nye bar brtags pas tshem bu du ba bzhin no //
translated: By the indivisibility, etc. means by the imagination of the indivisibility of the support and the supported, like a painted cloth.

original: dkyil 'khor ba de rnams kyi re re'i zhes pa ni lha re re'i'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba de rnams kyi re re'i zhes pa ni lha re re'i'o //
translated: Of each of those mandala deities means of each deity.

original: snying ga'i zla ba la gnas zhes pa ni dam tshig sems dpa'i snying ga'i padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i zla ba la gnas zhes pa ni dam tshig sems dpa'i snying ga'i padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Residing on the moon in the heart means residing on the moon and lotus in the heart of the commitment being.

original: bsgom par bya zhing khyad par du //
analyzed: bsgom par bya zhing khyad par du //
translated: One should meditate on the essence mantra

original: zhes pa ni med du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar yang bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni med du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar yang bsgom par bya'o //
translated: This should be meditated upon as being like the indispensable.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhes pa ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas na zhes pa ni sems kyi rnam pa yongs su gyur pas so //
translated: Since it is the nature of gnosis, it is the transformation of the aspect of the mind.

original: ye shes sems dpa' bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni mthe bong gi tshad tsam bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni mthe bong gi tshad tsam bsam par bya'o //
translated: The meditation on the j√±ƒÅnasattva is the meditation on the thumb-sized [vajra].

original: thugs kyi zla bar chud pa zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thugs kyi zla bar chud pa zhes pa ni ye shes sems dpa'i thugs ka'i padma dang zla ba la gnas pa'o //
translated: Entering into the heart of the moon means abiding on the lotus and moon in the heart of the j√±ƒÅnasattva.

original: de bzhin du dbus kyi gtso bo dang 'dra bar khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbus kyi gtso bo dang 'dra bar khyad par bstan to //
translated: In the same way, the distinctions are taught as being similar to the central principal.

original: so so'i yi ge @27b zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa re re la thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: so so'i yi ge @27b zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor pa re re la thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon dgod par bya'o //
translated: The individual syllables are the seed syllables of Cittavajradhara that should be placed on each of the ma·πá·∏çala members.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The nature of the unchanging means that it is the nature of the gnosis of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: mi shigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mi shigs pa las byung ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las 'byung bas so //
translated: Because it arises from the indestructible means that it arises from the clear light.

original: yi ge h'um zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas so //
analyzed: yi ge h'um zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i bskyed pa'i gnas yin pas so //
translated: The syllable H≈™·πÄ is the place of generation of Ak·π£hobhya and so forth.

original: sgrub pa po'i mchog la sbyor bar byed pas na zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rnal 'byor ba sbyor bar byed pas so //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i mchog la sbyor bar byed pas na zhes pa ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ye shes kyis rnal 'byor ba sbyor bar byed pas so //
translated: It is applied to the supreme adepts, because the gnosis of the realm of phenomena is applied by the yogƒ´.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi sems dpa'o zhes pa ni de nyid yi ge h'um zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi sems dpa'o zhes pa ni de nyid yi ge h'um zhes bya'o //
translated: The letter H≈™·πÄ is the samƒÅdhisattva.

original: de las ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las so //
analyzed: de las ni yi ge h'um yongs su gyur pa las so //
translated: From that, from the transformation of the letter H≈™·πÄ.

original: kha rnam par gyes pa bsam zhing zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kha rnam par gyes pa bsam zhing zhes pa ni 'bar ba'i rdo rje bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Imagining the mouth open, one should meditate on the blazing vajra.

original: tshul 'dis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor rnams kyang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: tshul 'dis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor rnams kyang sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid du bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By this method, and so forth, it is taught that the retinue should also be imagined as having the nature of the three beings.

original: de rnams kyi lcags gyu 'dra bas ni kyo ba ste zhes pa la dbang du byed pa dang mngon du gyur par byas pas bskul ba bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi lcags gyu 'dra bas ni kyo ba ste zhes pa la dbang du byed pa dang mngon du gyur par byas pas bskul ba bstan to //
translated: Their hooks are like hooks, it is taught that they are summoned by subjugating and manifesting.

original: glang po che bzhin no zhes pa ni dpe ste glang po che ni lcags kyus dbang du 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: glang po che bzhin no zhes pa ni dpe ste glang po che ni lcags kyus dbang du 'gyur bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúLike an elephant‚Äù is the example, because an elephant is brought under control by the goad.

original: de'i sbyor ba ni zhes pa la de spro ba'o //üîΩrdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi snying ga dang de bzhin du rang gi snying ga las spros pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis mchog tu dga' ba'i bde
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba ni zhes pa la de spro ba'o // rdo rje gsum gyis zhes pa ni sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyi snying ga dang de bzhin du rang gi snying ga las spros pa'i gnod mdzes kyi rgyal pos phyag rgya dang snyoms par zhugs pa'i dbang gis mchog tu dga' ba'i bde
translated: ‚ÄúIts application‚Äù is the application of that, the emanation.üîΩ‚ÄúBy the three vajras‚Äù is the ma·πá·∏çala deities who are the nature of the three sattvas.üîΩThe one to be accomplished, the deity, is struck in the heart by the Ak·π£obhya who emanates from one‚Äôs heart and who is in union with the consort through the power of supreme joy.

original: ba myong ba'i bsgrub bya'i lha dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kar brdegs pa ni gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje'i tho bas thugs la brdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: ba myong ba'i bsgrub bya'i lha dang mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kar brdegs pa ni gsol ba gdab pa sngon du 'gro bar rdo rje'i tho bas thugs la brdeg par bya'o //
translated: The deity is struck in the heart with the vajra hammer, preceded by supplicating.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: bdag po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: bdag po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: ‚Äúthe lord, etc.,‚Äù is taught.

original: gcig tu gyur ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis zhes pa ni 'od zer gyi tshogs yongs su gyur pa gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po gang yin pa lcags kyu dang 'dra ba des so //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis zhes pa ni 'od zer gyi tshogs yongs su gyur pa gnod mdzes kyi rgyal po gang yin pa lcags kyu dang 'dra ba des so //
translated: The mass of light rays that have become one, that is, the mass of light rays that have become one, with that hook-like SumbharƒÅja.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i lha'i zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyis bskul ba ni thugs la brdeg par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i lha'i zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gyis bskul ba ni thugs la brdeg par bya'o //
translated: The deity to be accomplished, that is, the one whose nature is Ak·π£obhya, etc., whose nature is the three beings, should be urged, that is, struck in the mind.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di nyid rgyas par @28a * //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di nyid rgyas par @28a * //
translated: This very meaning is taught extensively by the vajra hook, etc.

original: bstan to // 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: bstan to // 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefit is taught by this, etc.

original: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems rab tu bsgrub pa ni zhes pa la byang chub nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems so //
analyzed: de rnams kyi byang chub kyi sems rab tu bsgrub pa ni zhes pa la byang chub nges par byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi sems so //
translated: The accomplishment of their bodhicitta, that is, the mind whose nature is the production of enlightenment.

original: 'gugs pa'o zhes pa ni drangs ba'o //
analyzed: 'gugs pa'o zhes pa ni drangs ba'o //
translated: Attracting, that is, drawing.

original: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis kyang snying po bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis kyang snying po bskul bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase just explained and so forth teaches that even the yogis of Vairochana and so forth should invoke the essence.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sgyu ma lta bu nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po bskul ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis sgyu ma lta bu nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase this and so forth teaches the illusion-like nature by the samadhi of invoking the essence.

original: de ni rol mo ltar byung bas na zhes pa ni dper mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rol mo ltar byung bas na zhes pa ni dper mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase it arises like a performance is the brief teaching of the example.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa'i don sngar gyi lo rgyus bstan pa'i bdag nyid kyi rol mo la gar mkhan gcig pus kyang lha'i dbang po brgya byin la sogs pa'i cha lugs byas nas ltad mo ba rnams la dga' bar byed pa
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyas par bstan pa'i don sngar gyi lo rgyus bstan pa'i bdag nyid kyi rol mo la gar mkhan gcig pus kyang lha'i dbang po brgya byin la sogs pa'i cha lugs byas nas ltad mo ba rnams la dga' bar byed pa
translated: The phrase just as and so forth is the extensive teaching of the meaning of the example, which is the nature of the previous story. In a performance, even a single dancer can take on the appearance of Indra, the lord of the gods, and so forth, and delight the audience.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,üîΩthe yogi who has attained the samadhi of invoking the essence should think, I will perform the dance of the great mudra of the Tathagata.

original: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa gcig pus bsgrub bya la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snying po skul bar byed de de la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa gcig pus bsgrub bya la sogs pa'i tshul gyis snying po skul bar byed de de la mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i lha'i tshogs ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: The assembly of deities such as Ak·π£obhya is the object of attainment.

original: sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po ni rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The practitioner is the yogin.

original: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de dgug pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje lcags kyu la sogs pa'i sbyor bas de dgug pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The union is the summoning of them by the application of the vajra hook, etc.

original: don dam par rnam par dpyad na gsum po yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: don dam par rnam par dpyad na gsum po yang mi dmigs so //
translated: In ultimate analysis, the three are not observed.

original: 'on kyang dngos grub don du gnyer ba'i sgrub pa po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang dngos grub don du gnyer ba'i sgrub pa po rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Nevertheless, it is taught that they should be accomplished by practitioners who seek powers.

original: dus kyi tshad ces pa ni zhag gcig la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dus kyi tshad ces pa ni zhag gcig la sogs pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The measure of time is the division into one day, etc.

original: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams te zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The vajra is the tathƒÅgatas, etc. is Cittavajradhara, etc.

original: cho ga gang gis khrid cing drangs pa zhes pa ni rang gi snying ga nas spros pa'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar byed pa'i tshig snyan pa dang sgeg pa la sogs pas dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de
analyzed: cho ga gang gis khrid cing drangs pa zhes pa ni rang gi snying ga nas spros pa'i gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar byed pa'i tshig snyan pa dang sgeg pa la sogs pas dga' bar byed pa gang yin pa de
translated: By which rite they are led and drawn means that one delights the Tathagatas with the speech of pleasing words, coquettishness, and so on, of Rupavajra and so on, who are emanated from one's heart.

original: rnams so // de la mchog tu gyur cing phul du byung bas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar byed pa sbyin ba la sogs pa ste skad cig gis bsgrub bya yin pas so //
analyzed: rnams so // de la mchog tu gyur cing phul du byung bas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar byed pa sbyin ba la sogs pa ste skad cig gis bsgrub bya yin pas so //
translated: That which is supreme and excellent is the giving and so on which delights the Tathagatas, because it is to be accomplished in an instant.

original: de'i cho ga rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni bzang ba'i thabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i cho ga rjes su bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa ni bzang ba'i thabs kyis de bzhin gshegs pa rnams mgu bar bya'o //
translated: One should accomplish the rite of that means one should delight the Tathagatas by the means of good.

original: des ni bzang ba'i thabs dang @28b sbyin pa'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bzang ba'i thabs dang @28b sbyin pa'i thabs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the means of good and the means of giving.

original: brtsam pa'i nyin mo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtse gcig pa dang brtan pa nges pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos zhag gang nas brtsams te snying po bskul ba'i cho ga bsgom pa de nas zhag bdun gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtsam pa'i nyin mo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rtse gcig pa dang brtan pa nges pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i sgrub pa pos zhag gang nas brtsams te snying po bskul ba'i cho ga bsgom pa de nas zhag bdun gyis 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the day of undertaking and so on: the adept who has the mind of one-pointedness, stability, and certainty, from whatever day he undertakes the ritual of arousing the essence, in seven days he will accomplish it.

original: gzhung des ni dbye ba'i thabs bstan to //
analyzed: gzhung des ni dbye ba'i thabs bstan to //
translated: By that passage, the method of division is taught.

original: cho ga'i phan yon gsungs pa zhes pa ni thabs bzhi dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bskul ba'i phan yon gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga'i phan yon gsungs pa zhes pa ni thabs bzhi dang ldan pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bskul ba'i phan yon gsungs pa'o //
translated: The benefits of the ritual are the benefits of arousing the essence of the Tathagata endowed with the four means.

original: bla ma'i lung las rnyed pa yin pas so //
analyzed: bla ma'i lung las rnyed pa yin pas so //
translated: Because it is obtained from the guru's instruction.

original: zhes pa ni snying po bskul bde ni sba bar bya ba yin pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni snying po bskul bde ni sba bar bya ba yin pas so //
translated: Because that arousing of the essence is to be kept secret.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra ba sgrub pa po'i sku la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra ba sgrub pa po'i sku la sogs pa 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By what is to be accomplished and so on, it is taught that the adept's body and so forth will be accomplished like the Tathagata.

original: 'da' bas 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes kyi dbang thob pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las grol ba'o //
analyzed: 'da' bas 'jigs pa'o zhes pa ni ye shes kyi dbang thob pas 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las grol ba'o //
translated: The phrase frightened by the fear of passing away means that they are liberated from the fear of cyclic existence by obtaining the knowledge empowerment.

original: de ltar gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyang zhes pa ni thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the Tathagatas who are like that refers to Cittavajra Holder and so forth.

original: skrag 'gyur nas zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skrag 'gyur nas zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase terrified is the brief explanation.

original: thugs rje'i dbang du gyur pas zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: thugs rje'i dbang du gyur pas zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The phrase overcome by compassion is the extensive explanation.

original: yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab tu stsol bas zhes pa ni rang gi ngo bo sgrub pas rnal 'byor pa rjes su gzung ba mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa'i dngos grub rab tu stsol bas zhes pa ni rang gi ngo bo sgrub pas rnal 'byor pa rjes su gzung ba mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase bestowing the desired accomplishments means that they take care of the yogis by accomplishing their own nature.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te thabs rnam pa bzhis snying po bskul na sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyid dang 'dra bar sgrub pa po la mdzad do zhes pa tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te thabs rnam pa bzhis snying po bskul na sangs rgyas rnams kyis nyid dang 'dra bar sgrub pa po la mdzad do zhes pa tshig gi don to //
translated: This is what is being said: if the essence is invoked by these four methods, the Buddhas will accomplish the practitioner as if he were their own self. This is the meaning of the words.

original: de yang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi yan lag yin no zhes bla ma rnams kyis gsungs so ;
analyzed: de yang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi yan lag yin no zhes bla ma rnams kyis gsungs so ;
translated: Moreover, the Gurus say that this is a branch of the Subsequent Yoga.

original: / kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi mthar zhes zer te dngos grub mngon du ma gyur na zhag bdun gyis de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / kha cig na re ting nge 'dzin gsum gyi mthar zhes zer te dngos grub mngon du ma gyur na zhag bdun gyis de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say that it is the end of the three meditative stabilizations, because if one does not manifest power, one will achieve it in seven days.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'dra ba nyid thob na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dngos grub kyang stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'dra ba nyid thob na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis dngos grub kyang stsol bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that when one attains the state of being like all the Ones-Gone-Thus, the Ones-Gone-Thus also grant power,

original: yid la mngon par mgu bas zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: yid la mngon par mgu bas zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúwith mental satisfaction‚Äù means in accordance with desire.

original: dngos grub rgya che zhing zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi bdag po'i tshul can no //
analyzed: dngos grub rgya che zhing zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi bdag po'i tshul can no //
translated: ‚ÄúExtensive power‚Äù means the state of lord of the three realms.

original: 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang phra ba la sogs pa rnams so //üîΩ'jig @29a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa dang sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa dang phra ba la sogs pa rnams so // 'jig @29a * //
translated: Mundane [powers] are pacification and so forth, the power of body and so forth, and subtlety and so forth.

original: rten las 'das pa ni mkha' spyod pa la sogs pa dang rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten las 'das pa ni mkha' spyod pa la sogs pa dang rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Supramundane [powers] are the state of sky-farer and so forth and the attainment of the state of Vajradhara and so forth.

original: su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa pos mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya rnams kyis dngos grub stsol ba'i byed pa po nyid bstan to //
analyzed: su zhig ces bya ba la sogs pas sgrub pa pos mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya rnams kyis dngos grub stsol ba'i byed pa po nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase whoever and so forth indicates the agent who grants the powers to the practitioner's desired objects.

original: byams pa la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i dgongs pas zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: byams pa la sogs pa'i zhes pa ni sgrub pa po'i dgongs pas zhes tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase loving and so forth is a continuation of the sentence, by the intention of the practitioner.

original: byang chub nyid la slob pa'i zhes pa ni slob bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub nyid la slob pa'i zhes pa ni slob bzhin pa'o //
translated: The phrase who are training in enlightenment means those who are in the process of training.

original: grub pa'i skyes bu rnams so zhes pa ni spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas dngos grub thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: grub pa'i skyes bu rnams so zhes pa ni spyod pa rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas dngos grub thob pa'i rnal 'byor pa gang yin pa de rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase accomplished beings means those yogis who have attained power by means of the three kinds of conduct.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po skul bar mi byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la don med par dus zad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas snying po skul bar mi byed pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la don med par dus zad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase thus and so forth indicates that the yogis who do not exhort the essence will waste their time without purpose.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni sa thob pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o zhes pa ni sa thob pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The phrase this is a tathagata means the buddhas who have attained the levels.

original: bdag ni tha mal pa'o zhes pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni tha mal pa'o zhes pa so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase I am ordinary means those who abide on the level of ordinary beings.

original: gang yongs su rtog pa de ni tha dad pa'i rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang yongs su rtog pa de ni tha dad pa'i rtog pa'o //
translated: That is a different conception.

original: de lta de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin no //
translated: By in such and such a way, etc. , it is shown that the Tathagata is omniscient,

original: bdag ni tha mal pa yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rtog pas rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bdag ni tha mal pa yin no zhes tha dad pa'i rtog pas rnal 'byor pas dngos grub thob par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and by I am an ordinary person, that the yogi will not attain power through a different conception.

original: srog gi tha ma zhes pa ni de'i las tsam la zhen pa de'i srog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog gi tha ma zhes pa ni de'i las tsam la zhen pa de'i srog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The end of life is the life of one who is attached to mere action.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir las gang gis dngos grub tu 'dod pa'i las te zhes pa ni dngos grub thob par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las kyis so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir las gang gis dngos grub tu 'dod pa'i las te zhes pa ni dngos grub thob par 'dod pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi las kyis so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, it says by whatever action one desires power, that is, by an action characterized by the desire to attain power.

original: srog zad par 'gyur gyi zhes pa ni dngos grub ma thob par shi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog zad par 'gyur gyi zhes pa ni dngos grub ma thob par shi par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will exhaust one's life means that one will die without attaining power.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,

original: snying po yang dag par bskul ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: snying po yang dag par bskul ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: it says because of the absence of the true invocation of the essence. The meaning is that it is so considered.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the words are‚Äù is supplied.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snying po bskul ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snying po bskul ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the invocation of the essence of the yogis of the creation stage,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang bshad par bya ste zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la yang bshad par bya ste zhes bstan to //
translated: he teaches that it should be explained to the yogis of the completion stage as well.

original: sngags kyi gsang ba la zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: sngags kyi gsang ba la zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The secret of the mantra is the samƒÅdhi of the nature of union.

original: zhugs pa'i skyes bu zhes pa ni sngags kyi skyes bu ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom @29b ba'i sgrub pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhugs pa'i skyes bu zhes pa ni sngags kyi skyes bu ste rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom @29b ba'i sgrub pa po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The person who has entered is the mantra person, the practitioner who cultivates the completion stage.

original: des yongs su gang bas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdul phra rab kyi mdzad pa'i sku dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: des yongs su gang bas na zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyis rdul phra rab kyi mdzad pa'i sku dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is said to be completely filled with the bodies of the atoms of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: dngos po thams cad ni bshad ma thag dang 'og nas bshad pa ste zhes pa ni sngar bshad zin pa dang le'u bcu gsum pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ni bshad ma thag dang 'og nas bshad pa ste zhes pa ni sngar bshad zin pa dang le'u bcu gsum pa la sogs pas 'chad par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: All things are as just explained and as will be explained below.üîΩThe application of the established and the object of establishment, etc.

original: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras sgrub pa po'i yang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang bsgrub par bya ba la sogs pa'i rab tu sbyor ba'o zhes pa ni sogs pa'i sgras sgrub pa po'i yang sbyor ba'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the application of the establisher.

original: bskyed pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni mngon du bya ba'o //
translated: Generation is manifestation.

original: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi dang don dam la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi dang don dam la sogs pa'o //
translated: The two truths are the conventional and the ultimate, etc.

original: gcig tu bsdus pa de zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: gcig tu bsdus pa de zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: That which is included in one is the samƒÅdhi whose characteristic is the inseparability of the two truths, etc.

original: des gzung zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i tshig yin te de nyid kyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des gzung zhes pa ni nges par gzung ba dang bcas pa'i tshig yin te de nyid kyis 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By that, it is said, is meant that it is definitely a statement of inclusion, and by that alone is it transformed.

original: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang bral bas zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pas 'grub par mi 'gyurüîΩro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ni sngar bshad pa'i mtshan nyid can gang yin pa de ni dbang po gnyis kyi sbyor ba dang bral bas zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin med pas 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, whatever is the accomplishment, mundane and supramundane, which has the characteristics explained above, that is not accomplished without the union of the two organs, that is, without the concentration of union.

original: sgrub pa rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa rdzogs par byed pa zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so //
translated: The one who has completed the practice is the form of the Great Seal of the indivisibility of the two truths.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba'i zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang 'brel ba'i zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa dang ro gcig par gyur pa ste zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: Connected with all the Tathagatas means that it has become of one taste with Akshobhya and so forth, because the concentration of union is the nature of all the Tathagatas.

original: 'da' bar mi bya ba gang yin pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'da' bar mi bya ba gang yin pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor pa rnams so //
translated: The one who should not transgress is the yogis.

original: de rnams kyi bsgom pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i thabs 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi bsgom pa'i thabs so zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po'i thabs 'di nyid yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The method of their meditation is this method of the Great Seal.

original: sbyor ba'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bzung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i thabs zhes bya ba la sogs pas mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bzung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: The method of application, etc. teaches the samadhi of entry into the attainment of the meditation of the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i sgom pa thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pa'i sgom pa thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the clear light which is to be attained by the meditation of the stage of the seal and samadhi.

original: der ni rgyur 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: der ni rgyur 'gyur bas so //
translated: It is the cause because it is the cause of that.

original: phung po la sogs pa rnams mi snang bar byas nas zhes pa ni tha mal ba rnams stong par byas nas so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa rnams mi snang bar byas nas zhes pa ni tha mal ba rnams stong par byas nas so //
translated: Having made the aggregates, etc. invisible means having emptied the ordinary ones.

original: kun rdzob dang zhes @30a * //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang zhes @30a * //
translated: The conventional, etc.

original: bya ba la sogs pas chad pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sbyor pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas chad pa'i phyogs spang bar bya ba'i phyir kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i sbyor pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: teaches the meditation of the samadhi of the union of the conventional and the ultimate in order to abandon the extreme of nihilism.üîΩ üîΩThe conventional is the clear light of the stage of the seal and samadhi.

original: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phrin las bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi phrin las bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the action of the samƒÅdhi of union is to be explained, beginning with ‚Äúthen,‚Äù and so on.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs pa'i 'og tu zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba man ngag bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i 'og tu'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la zhugs pa'i 'og tu zhes pa ni phyag rgya dang ting nge 'dzin gyi rim pas thob par bya ba man ngag bzhi pa la zhugs pa'i 'og tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAfter entering into ultimate truth‚Äù means after entering into the fourth intimate instruction, which is to be attained by means of the stage of the seal and samƒÅdhi.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi zhes pa ni kun rdzob dang don dam la sogs pa dbyer med pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving the nature of the two truths‚Äù means the nature of the inseparability of the conventional and ultimate, and so on.

original: rang gi phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own mahƒÅmudrƒÅ‚Äù means the nature of the body of MahƒÅvajradhara.

original: bskyed pa ni cig car du spros nas so //
analyzed: bskyed pa ni cig car du spros nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúGeneration‚Äù means emanating all at once.

original: de khams gsum du zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de khams gsum du zhes pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the three realms.

original: khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams la snying rje'i dbang du gyur bas chags pa dang de rnams gdon pa'i phyir chos ston pa'i dam bca' ba la zhen pa de bzhin du de la gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las
analyzed: khams gsum gyi nang na gnas pa'i sems can gyi khams la snying rje'i dbang du gyur bas chags pa dang de rnams gdon pa'i phyir chos ston pa'i dam bca' ba la zhen pa de bzhin du de la gnas pa'i sems can gyi tshogs 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las
translated: Likewise, in order to liberate the hosts of sentient beings dwelling there from the fears of cyclic existence,

original: dgrol ba'i phyir dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed pa'i phyir srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid kyi sdug bsngal gyis nye bar 'joms pa bdag cag dang 'dra ba 'di pha yin no zhes chags pa dang bcas par dgongs pa dang bcas pa yid ches pa dang
analyzed: dgrol ba'i phyir dang rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku bskyed pa'i phyir srid pa'i sdug bsngal dang yid kyi sdug bsngal gyis nye bar 'joms pa bdag cag dang 'dra ba 'di pha yin no zhes chags pa dang bcas par dgongs pa dang bcas pa yid ches pa dang
translated: and in order to generate the body of Great Vajradhara, he is our father, who is destroyed by the sufferings of existence and mental suffering.üîΩThus, he is to be seen with attachment, with intention, with confidence,

original: gus pa dang bcas par blta bar bya ba dang / dad pa'i blos yongs su bsnyen bkur du bya ba shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas par blta bar bya ba dang / dad pa'i blos yongs su bsnyen bkur du bya ba shes par bya ba ni rtogs par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: and with devotion, and he is to be known as one who is to be served with a faithful mind.

original: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs de nyid nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i snying pos bskul ba mngon par brjod nas rnal 'byor ba'i 'jug pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste /üîΩrnam par snang mdzad la sogs par yongs su brtags pa'i zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i ngo bo yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs de nyid nye bar bsdus pa bstan to // de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i snying pos bskul ba mngon par brjod nas rnal 'byor ba'i 'jug pa'i khyad par bstan par bya ste / rnam par snang mdzad la sogs par yongs su brtags pa'i zhes pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i ngo bo yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: The phrase this very form of the Great Seal indicates the withdrawal of that form.

original: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi ngo bo nyid de zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Having thus described the invocation with the essence mantra along with its cause and effect, [the BhagavƒÅn] teaches the special engagement of the practitioner: Thus, having generated the five Buddhas in this way, one should visualize the form of the Great Seal of Vairocana and so forth, which is the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses of form and so forth, as the nature of the five TathƒÅgatas.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The nature of those is the ultimate truth, which is the clear light.

original: de las skyes pas na zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pas na zhes pa ni 'od gsal ba las cig car du 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arisen from that means arisen simultaneously from the clear light.

original: de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po ste @30b dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
analyzed: de nyid rdo rje 'chang chen po ste @30b dpal rdo rje sems dpa'o //
translated: That is the Great Vajradhara, glorious Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur du gyur pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi cod pan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi dbang bskur du gyur pa zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi cod pan du gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase empowerment of all the buddhas means that [the bodhicitta] becomes the diadem of all the tathagatas.

original: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs bstan to //
translated: The phrase for that very reason and so forth teaches the reason.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur du gyur pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi dbang bskur du gyur pa de ni sangs rgyas thams cad kyi mchog ces bya'o //
translated: That empowerment of all the tathagatas is called the supreme of all buddhas.

original: bka' stsal ba'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'o //
analyzed: bka' stsal ba'o zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba'o //
translated: The phrase the Blessed One said means that the Bhagavan said.

original: mtha' yas shing mu med pa zhes pa ni ma lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams la'o //
analyzed: mtha' yas shing mu med pa zhes pa ni ma lus pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams la'o //
translated: The phrase infinite and limitless refers to the entire world system.

original: tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lha mo ji srid yod pa de rnams sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku'i phyogs la dmigs nas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa lha mo ji srid yod pa de rnams sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku'i phyogs la dmigs nas spro bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase the last and so forth means that one should emanate the goddesses such as Rupavajra and so forth, as many as there are, in the direction of the mantra body and the gnosis body.

original: sngags kyi sku ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis dkyil 'khor ba rnams spro ba dang / ye shes kyi skus skad cig ma gcig gis spro bar bya'o zhes khyad par ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i dkyil 'khor rgyal ba mchog gi ting nge 'dzin gyis dkyil 'khor ba rnams spro ba dang / ye shes kyi skus skad cig ma gcig gis spro bar bya'o zhes khyad par ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is the distinction.

original: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bshad par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain that,üîΩit is taught:

original: bya ba grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba grangs med ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The emanations are countless... and so forth.

original: grangs med pa ni sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa yin pas de rnams sbyang ba'i don du sprul ba'i sku yang mtha' yas pa bstan to //
analyzed: grangs med pa ni sems can gyi khams mtha' yas pa yin pas de rnams sbyang ba'i don du sprul ba'i sku yang mtha' yas pa bstan to //
translated: Since the realm of sentient beings is limitless, for the sake of purifying them, countless emanation bodies are taught.

original: gang gi phyir sprul pa gcig gis cig car du thams cad gdon par mi nus te gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sprul pa gcig gis cig car du thams cad gdon par mi nus te gdul bya rnams kyi bsam pa sna tshogs pas so //
translated: Because one emanation cannot simultaneously liberate all, due to the various dispositions of those to be tamed.

original: rdo rje can gyis spro ba zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor pas spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje can gyis spro ba zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi rang bzhin gyi rnal 'byor pas spro bar bya'o //
translated: The vajra holder's emanation means the emanation by the practitioner who is of the nature of Vajradhara.

original: byang chub dam tshig ste zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa'i don du ldang bar mi bya ba rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub dam tshig ste zhes pa ni byang chub thob pa'i don du ldang bar mi bya ba rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The pledge of enlightenment is the meaning of ‚Äúgreat vajra holder.‚Äù

original: 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
translated: The benefits are taught by ‚Äúby this‚Äù and so forth.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad la rtogs par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dang ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad la rtogs par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni khams gsum na gnas pa'i sems can thams cad dang ngo bo nyid nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid thob par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCausing the realization of all natures‚Äù means causing all sentient beings dwelling in the three realms to attain the nature of experience.

original: byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: byang chub ni rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang ngo //
translated: Enlightenment is the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa byang chub kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The nature of Vajra Body and so forth is the characteristic of enlightenment of Vairochana and so forth.

original: reg par byar med pas zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: reg par byar med pas zhes pa ni nam mkha' dang 'dra ba nyid thob par 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúBeing unapprehendable‚Äù means attaining the state of being like space.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyi @31a * //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i phyi @31a * //
translated: The unconditioned is the nature of the three bodies.

original: ro ; ; rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ro ; ; rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pas zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTaste‚Äù is a remainder of the phrase ‚Äúthe yoga of the perfection stage.‚Äù

original: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phan yon bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the benefits of the yoga of perfection,

original: slob bzhin pa'i yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob bzhin pa'i yang bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the benefits of the yoga of training,

original: slob pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste slob pa la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bskul ba la slob bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa la gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ste slob pa la gnas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po bskul ba la slob bzhin pa'o //
translated: he says ‚Äúabiding in training,‚Äù and so on. Abiding in training is training in the invocation of the essence of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: nye bar brtags pas na zhes pa ni gzhi dang gzhi can dbyer med pas so //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pas na zhes pa ni gzhi dang gzhi can dbyer med pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy examination‚Äù means by the inseparability of the basis and the possessor of the basis.

original: yon tan nyid rgyal ba ste zhes pa ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan nyid rgyal ba ste zhes pa ni stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe qualities are the victors‚Äù means the ten powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on.

original: ji ltar rgya mtsho rin po che kun gyi gnas su gyur pa bzhin zhes pa ni slob bzhin pa de yang rin po che ltar yon tan de rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtsho rin po che kun gyi gnas su gyur pa bzhin zhes pa ni slob bzhin pa de yang rin po che ltar yon tan de rnams kyi gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the ocean is the source of all jewels,‚Äù the one in training is like a jewel, the source of those qualities.

original: bde ba dam pa dang zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi longs spyod kyi tshogs las 'byung ba lus bde ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: bde ba dam pa dang zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi longs spyod kyi tshogs las 'byung ba lus bde ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Supreme bliss is the nature of bodily bliss that arises from the collection of external enjoyments.

original: nad med pa ni skye 'chi med pa'o //
analyzed: nad med pa ni skye 'chi med pa'o //
translated: Health is immortality.

original: sogs pa'i sgras rga ba dang gnyer ma la sogs pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras rga ba dang gnyer ma la sogs pa med pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the word ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù the attainment of freedom from old age, wrinkles, and so on is included.

original: tshe ring ba ni bskal pa stong gi bar du gson cing gnas pa ste de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshe ring ba ni bskal pa stong gi bar du gson cing gnas pa ste de gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Long life is living and remaining for a thousand eons.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sbyor bas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúintentional‚Äù means that the teaching of reality is by the application of contradictory terms.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub ni zhes pa ni zhi pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub ni zhes pa ni zhi pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mundane powers are pacification and so on.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub ni dpal rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Supramundane powers are the attainment of the state of glorious Vajrasattva and so on.

original: de 'grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'grub pa'i phyir zhes pa ni de thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of their attainment means for the sake of their acquisition.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po bskul pa zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kyi nus pa dgug pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po bskul pa zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i thugs kyi nus pa dgug pas so //
translated: The phrase invoking the essence of all the Tathagatas means summoning the power of the mind of Akshobhya and so forth.

original: so sor ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya'o //
analyzed: so sor ston par byed pa'i tshig gi tshogs ni le'u zhes bya'o //
translated: A chapter is a collection of words that teaches individually.

original: le'u dang po las gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: le'u dang po las gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: This concludes the first chapter of the commentary on the Light of the Two Systems.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'i k'a las le'u bcu pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the extensive explanation of the tenth chapter of the commentary on the Light of the Two Systems.

original: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gcig pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gcig pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: The eleventh chapter begins with the words thus and so forth.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnam pa gnyis zhes pa ni bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The two types of yogis are the two types of yogis of the generation and completion stages.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i sgom pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i sgom pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: The two types are distinguished by the analysis and completion stages.

original: brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa @31b rnams kyis zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa @31b rnams kyis zhes pa ni rim pa gnyis kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The two types of yogis are the yogis of the two stages.

original: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis po zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lha'i sku dag go //
analyzed: lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis po zhes pa ni yongs su dag pa dang ma dag pa'i lha'i sku dag go //
translated: The two kinds of divine body refers to the completely pure and impure divine bodies.

original: le'u dang po las gsungs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa nyid du gsungs so //
analyzed: le'u dang po las gsungs pa zhes pa ni mdor bstan pa nyid du gsungs so //
translated: It is stated in the first chapter refers to the brief introduction.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir zhes pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to clarify it refers to the extensive explanation.

original: le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs te zhes pa ni sdud pa pos zhes tshig lhag ma'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa gsungs te zhes pa ni sdud pa pos zhes tshig lhag ma'o /
translated: The eleventh chapter is stated refers to the compiler.

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni le'u dang po nas lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi sgom pa'i khyad par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni le'u dang po nas lha'i sku rnam pa gnyis kyi sgom pa'i khyad par gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir rgyas par bshad par bya ste /
translated: The idea here is that the difference in the meditation on the two kinds of divine body stated in the first chapter is to be explained here extensively.

original: de bas na le'u dang po'i yan lag tu gyur pa yang le'u bcu pa'i yang yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na le'u dang po'i yan lag tu gyur pa yang le'u bcu pa'i yang yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, being a branch of the first chapter, it also becomes a branch of the tenth chapter.

original: gang gi phyir lha rnams kyi snying po bskul ba'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir lha rnams kyi snying po bskul ba'i sgo nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku thob pa gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: For, the attainment of the body of the Tathagata by way of invoking the essence of the gods is twofold:

original: sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste de bstan par bya ba'i phyir le'u 'di yin zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku ste de bstan par bya ba'i phyir le'u 'di yin zhes bya bas so //
translated: The mantra body and the gnosis body; in order to teach that, this chapter is.

original: de bas na 'grel pa mkhan gyis kyang le'u bcu gcig pa nas bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na 'grel pa mkhan gyis kyang le'u bcu gcig pa nas bshad pa'i phyag rgya chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, the commentator also says that the great seal explained in the eleventh chapter is twofold:

original: sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku'o //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku dang / ye shes kyi sku'o //
translated: the mantra body and the gnosis body.

original: de la brtag pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags kyi sku bskyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i thabs bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la brtag pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la sngags kyi sku bskyed pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i thabs bshad par bya ste /
translated: Among them, in order to generate the mantra body for the yogis who are trainees, the method of meditation is explained.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni zhes pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rdo rje ni zhes pa la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The vajra of all the Ones-Gone-Thus is the cause of generating Vairochana and so forth.

original: aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum mo zhes bya ba ni aom a'a:h'um mtshan nyid can gyi yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: aom la sogs pa'i yi ge gsum mo zhes bya ba ni aom a'a:h'um mtshan nyid can gyi yi ge gsum mo //
translated: The three syllables Om and so forth are the three syllables characterized by Om, Ah, and Hum.

original: des bskyed par gyur pa'i zhes pa ni yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: des bskyed par gyur pa'i zhes pa ni yongs su gyur pa las phyag mtshan gyi phyag rgya las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Generated by that is arisen from the seal of the insignia that has transformed from the three syllables.

original: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pas skyes bu yang yin la sems pa gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas mchog yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pas skyes bu yang yin la sems pa gsum gyi bdag nyid yin pas mchog yin te /
translated: He is a person because he is endowed with the best of all aspects, and he is supreme because he is the nature of the three thoughts.

original: skyes bu mchog go //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme person.

original: lha rnams te ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rdzogs pa ni sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: lha rnams te ni rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa drug gi rdzogs pa ni sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: The gods are the six Tathagatas, Vajradhara and so forth, and their perfection is the mantra body.

original: de la thugs rtse gcig tu bzhag nas zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs nas so //
analyzed: de la thugs rtse gcig tu bzhag nas zhes pa ni de ltar gyur pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dmigs nas so //
translated: Having placed his mind one-pointedly on that, means having focused on that kind of samadhi.

original: 'di gsungs te ni bka' stsal to //
analyzed: 'di gsungs te ni bka' stsal to //
translated: He spoke this means he uttered this.

original: sngags ni sbas nas smra ba dang yid skyob pas sngags kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po dang gsang ba yin pas rdo rje'i rigs pa yin te /üîΩde bzhin gshegs pa thams @32a * //
analyzed: sngags ni sbas nas smra ba dang yid skyob pas sngags kyang yin la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi snying po dang gsang ba yin pas rdo rje'i rigs pa yin te / de bzhin gshegs pa thams @32a * //
translated: It is a mantra because it is a secret utterance and it protects the mind, and it is the vajra lineage because it is the essence and secret of all Tathagatas.

original: cad kyi sngags kyi rdo rje'i rigs pa'i sgras yi ge gsum bstan to //
analyzed: cad kyi sngags kyi rdo rje'i rigs pa'i sgras yi ge gsum bstan to //
translated: The mantra vajra lineage of all Tathagatas indicates the three syllables with the term mantra vajra lineage.

original: de rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim pas byung ba skyes bu'i lha ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa dang po sbyor ba la sogs pa'i rim pas byung ba skyes bu'i lha ste /
translated: Those and so forth. The deity of the person is generated by the three syllables and so forth, by the stage of the first union and so forth.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gang du yod pa de ni de ltar gyur pa'i le'u bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gang du yod pa de ni de ltar gyur pa'i le'u bstan to //
translated: Wherever the body of the Tathagata exists, that is the chapter of that nature.

original: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: de ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: That is just an illustration.

original: bdag lus byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas kyang ye shes kyi sku bsgrub pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lus byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas kyang ye shes kyi sku bsgrub pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The body of wisdom is also taught to be accomplished by the stage of the consecration of one's own body.

original: sdud pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sdud pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says the compiler and so forth.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'i yi ge rnams la yang de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs rdo rje'o zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rdzogs par byed pa'i yi ge rnams la yang de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Body, speech, and mind vajra refers to the syllables that complete Vairochana and so forth.

original: sngags kyi dbye ba bdun khri nyis stong gi rgyur gyur pa dang de nyid la sngags thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngags kyi dbye ba bdun khri nyis stong gi rgyur gyur pa dang de nyid la sngags thams cad bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of the seventy-two thousand divisions of mantra and because all mantras are generated from them.

original: ji srid du ya ra la wa'i bar zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: ji srid du ya ra la wa'i bar zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: and so on.

original: des phyag rgya chen po rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des phyag rgya chen po rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni yi ge gsum gyis bskyed pa'o //
translated: By that, one should meditate on the Great Seal, which is produced by the three syllables.

original: sa 'og sa steng sa bla ni khams gsum mo //
analyzed: sa 'og sa steng sa bla ni khams gsum mo //
translated: The underworld, the earth, and the sky are the three realms.

original: des mchod par bya'o zhes pa ni bkur sti bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des mchod par bya'o zhes pa ni bkur sti bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that, one should worship, because it is the service.

original: che ba'i dga' zhing mgu ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams la chog mi shes pa'i gzugs kyis so //
analyzed: che ba'i dga' zhing mgu ba zhes bya ba ni gdul bya rnams la chog mi shes pa'i gzugs kyis so //
translated: The great joy and satisfaction is by the form of the insatiable one for the disciples.

original: son par gyur pas na zhes pa ni ster bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: son par gyur pas na zhes pa ni ster bar mdzad pas so //
translated: Having arrived, one should worship, because it is the bestowal.

original: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje lha'i sku sgrub pa la brtson pas na /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi rdo rje lha'i sku sgrub pa la brtson pas na /
translated: The one who is intent on the accomplishment of the divine body of the deity, the vajra, which is the nature of the five intuitions,

original: ye shes rdo rje sgrub pa po //
analyzed: ye shes rdo rje sgrub pa po //
translated: is the one who accomplishes the intuition-vajra.

original: zhes bya'o // mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan dang spro ba dang bsdu bas sku rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // mngon par byang chub pa rnam pa lnga ni zla ba dang nyi ma dang yig 'bru dang phyag mtshan dang spro ba dang bsdu bas sku rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The fivefold manifest enlightenment is the completion of the body by the moon, sun, seed, insignia, emanation, and gathering.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: le'u dang po nas de bzhin nyid dang mtshan ma dang yig 'bru dang sku'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: le'u dang po nas de bzhin nyid dang mtshan ma dang yig 'bru dang sku'i rim pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first chapter is called the ‚Äústage of suchness, signs, seed syllables, and bodies.‚Äù

original: des bya ba'o zhes pa ni yi ge gsum mo //
analyzed: des bya ba'o zhes pa ni yi ge gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúThat which is to be done‚Äù refers to the three seed syllables.

analyzed: des byin gyis brlabs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje yongs su gyur pa las phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By ‚Äúempowered by that‚Äù and so forth, it is taught that one should imagine the great seal body from the transformation of the vajra.

original: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming bstan to //
translated: By ‚Äúits cause‚Äù and so forth, the name of the samadhi is taught.

original: sgrub pa po'i nan tan zhes pa ni gnas gzung bo sngon du 'gro bar ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nges pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i nan tan zhes pa ni gnas gzung bo sngon du 'gro bar ting nge 'dzin la brten pa nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe practitioner‚Äôs practice‚Äù is the reliance on samadhi preceded by the taking of the pledge.

original: skye bo 'dus pa dang bral bar zhes pa ni dgon pa la sogs pa 'am grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa dang nye ba'i ri la'o //
analyzed: skye bo 'dus pa dang bral bar zhes pa ni dgon pa la sogs pa 'am grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa dang nye ba'i ri la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn a place free of crowds‚Äù is in a forest and so forth, or near a town or city or mountain.

original: me tog ces bya ba la sogs pas yid bde ba'i rgyu bstan te /
analyzed: me tog ces bya ba la sogs pas yid bde ba'i rgyu bstan te /
translated: By ‚Äúflowers‚Äù and so forth, the cause of mental satisfaction is taught.

original: bde ba dang ldan pas sems mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pas sems mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Since one is endowed with bliss, the mind becomes concentrated.

original: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa'o //
translated: What was just explained is the branch that is the first application.

original: sbyor ba ni yan lag dang po'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni yan lag dang po'o //
translated: The application is the first branch.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang chen po bsgrub par bya ba ni thob par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i sbyor bas rdo rje 'chang chen po bsgrub par bya ba ni thob par bya'o //
translated: Thus, by the application that has occurred, one should attain the accomplishment of Great Vajradhara.üîΩ One becomes confident in the domain of the guru and the deities.

original: bla ma dang lha rnams kyi yul la yid ches par 'gyur pa ste zhes pa ni bla ma'i yul du yang dag par dad pa dang des bstan pa'i yi dam gyi lha la yang dag pa'i blta ba'o //
analyzed: bla ma dang lha rnams kyi yul la yid ches par 'gyur pa ste zhes pa ni bla ma'i yul du yang dag par dad pa dang des bstan pa'i yi dam gyi lha la yang dag pa'i blta ba'o //
translated: This means that one has perfect faith in the domain of the guru and the perfect view of the pledged deity that is taught by the guru.üîΩ If one is not diligent in that, then one will not accomplish Vajradhara without doubt, but not otherwise.

original: de la gal te brtson pa ma yin na de'i tshe the tshom med par rdo rje 'chang 'grub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la gal te brtson pa ma yin na de'i tshe the tshom med par rdo rje 'chang 'grub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: It is said,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa la //
translated: By relying on the spiritual friend,

original: sangs rgyas byang chub nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub nyid du 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
translated: one will attain buddhahood itself.

original: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum mngon du byas nas rigs brgya'i dbye bas lus rnam par dben ba bsgoms te /
analyzed: rim pa 'dis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gsum mngon du byas nas rigs brgya'i dbye bas lus rnam par dben ba bsgoms te /
translated: By this process and so on indicates that, having realized the three meditative stabilizations, one cultivates the body isolation by way of the one hundred families.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi nye bar dmigs nas rim pa lnga pas thob par bya ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la brten nas rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa la sogs pa'i rim pa bzhi nye bar dmigs nas rim pa lnga pas thob par bya ba'i zung du 'jug pa'i rim pa la brten nas rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having observed the four stages of vajra repetition and so on, one becomes Great Vajradhara in dependence on the stage of union to be attained by the fifth stage.

original: dgongs so zhes pa ni bla ma'i man ngag go //
analyzed: dgongs so zhes pa ni bla ma'i man ngag go //
translated: The intention is the esoteric instruction of the guru.

original: bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas pa'i //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim la legs gnas pa'i //
translated: Those who are well-established in the generation stage

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams la //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'dod rnams la //
translated: and who desire the completion stage

original: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: thabs 'di rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: are taught this method by the perfect Buddha

original: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
analyzed: skas kyi rim pa lta bur gsungs //
translated: like the steps of a staircase.

original: zhes bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bla ma'i zhal snga nas kyis gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what the guru has said.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis @34b rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi bsgom pa bstan nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis @34b rdzogs pa'i rdo rje 'chang gi bsgom pa bstan nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Having thus taught the meditation on perfect Vajradhara with the first concentration, he should explain it for Vairochana and so forth.

original: dran pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa gcig pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The concentration of single mindfulness is the definition of the concentration of yoga, which is the branch of the first concentration.

original: dngos po med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows.

original: gnas gzung ba dang snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid dang ye shes kyi sa gzhi dang gzhal yas khang dang / lhag par mos pa dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / gdan la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang /
analyzed: gnas gzung ba dang snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro bas bgegs bskrad pa dang stong pa nyid dang ye shes kyi sa gzhi dang gzhal yas khang dang / lhag par mos pa dang don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / gdan la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang de yongs su gyur pa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor dang /
translated: Having first taken the place and gone for refuge, having expelled the obstructors, and having created the ground of emptiness and wisdom, the celestial mansion, and the special visualization of the ultimate mandala, the divisions of the seat and so forth, and having transformed that into a moon mandala,

original: yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo las byung ba sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid zhal gsum pa la sogs pa lta bu dpal rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge gsum yongs su gyur pa'i 'khor lo las byung ba sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid zhal gsum pa la sogs pa lta bu dpal rnam par snang mdzad sku rdo rje'i rnal 'byor pas bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One who is a practitioner of the glorious Vairocana, the vajra of body, should meditate on the three syllables, which transform into a wheel, and from that arise the three beings, with three faces, and so forth.üîΩThis is taught.

original: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la yang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsung rdo rje dang thugs rdo rje dag la yang sbyar ro //
translated: And likewise, it should be applied to the vajra of speech and the vajra of mind.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that,üîΩthe verse sequence is as follows:

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni gnas gzung ba la sogs pa byas nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i rim gyis zhes pa ni gnas gzung ba la sogs pa byas nas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having performed the apprehension of the site and so forth, one should meditate on the ultimate mandala.

original: gzhal yas khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgoms pa'i 'og tu gzhal yas khang pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sa gzhi bsgoms pa'i 'og tu gzhal yas khang pa dang lhag par mos pa'i dkyil 'khor bstan to //
translated: The celestial mansion and so forth indicate the celestial mansion and the mandala of resolute faith.

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa bstan to //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a zhes bya ba la sogs pas don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor bsgom pa bstan to //
translated: Om shunyata and so forth indicate the meditation on the ultimate mandala.

original: yi ge aom la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdan gyi dbye ba bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge aom la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas gdan gyi dbye ba bstan to //
translated: The o·πÉ ƒÅ·∏• h≈´·πÉ and so forth indicates the division of the seats.

original: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can chos kyi dbyings bsgom pa bstan to //üîΩzla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma las byung ba /
analyzed: de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa can chos kyi dbyings bsgom pa bstan to // zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du zhes bya ba la sogs pas yi ge bhr'um yongs su gyur nas rnam par snang mdzad kyi mtshan ma las byung ba /
translated: The all of those completely transform and so forth indicates the cultivation of the moon-disk-shaped dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi bsgom pa bstan to ;
analyzed: dpal rnam par snang mdzad kyi bsgom pa bstan to ;
translated: The upon the moon-disk and so forth indicates the cultivation of the glorious Vairocana arisen from the sign of the letter bhr≈´·πÉ completely transformed.

original: ; de ni rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: ; de ni rnal 'byor ro //
translated: That is the yoga.

original: de'i thugs kar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa zhes bya ba rjes su rnal 'byor bstan to //üîΩ'od zer lnga dang ldan pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i khyad par te de bzhin gshegs pa @35a * //
analyzed: de'i thugs kar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa' dang / ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bsgom pa zhes bya ba rjes su rnal 'byor bstan to // 'od zer lnga dang ldan pa zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i khyad par te de bzhin gshegs pa @35a * //
translated: The at his heart and so forth indicates the cultivation of the gnosis-being and the concentration-being, which is called the subsequent yoga.

original: lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: lnga'i bdag nyid yin pas so //
translated: The endowed with five light-rays is a particularity of the concentration-being, because it is the nature of the five tathƒÅgatas.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbang byed pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis zhes pa ni dbang byed pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
translated: The phrase those who are yogis of Vairochana indicates the state of mastery.
