original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge aom las rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi don bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs zhes pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge aom las rnam par snang mdzad kyi tshogs spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis gzhan gyi don bstan to //
translated: The phrase an assembly of Vairochanas means that one should emanate an assembly of Vairochanas from the syllable Om, which is the nature of the concentration being. This indicates the benefit for others.

original: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las 'byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di yis zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las 'byung ba'i rnal 'byor pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase by this and so forth indicates the yogi who has arisen from the Vairochana lineage.

original: de'i lus 'grub par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra ba'i skur 'gyur te de'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas so //
analyzed: de'i lus 'grub par 'gyur ba zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra ba'i skur 'gyur te de'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pas so //
translated: The phrase his body will be accomplished means that he will attain a body like that of Vairochana, by cultivating that concentration.

original: de rnams gang la gnas pa zhes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa gang la yod pa de ni gzung ba ste /
analyzed: de rnams gang la gnas pa zhes pa ni 'dzin par byed pa gang la yod pa de ni gzung ba ste /
translated: The phrase in which they abide means that which is the support is the object.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is form and so forth.

original: de nyams su myong bas zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dag gang yang rung ba la gnas pa so sor sdud pa'i rim pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod cing gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyams su myong bas zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes kyi phyag rgya dag gang yang rung ba la gnas pa so sor sdud pa'i rim pas 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga nye bar spyod cing gnas par bya'o //
translated: By experiencing that means that one should abide in either a pledge seal or a wisdom seal, and by the process of withdrawal one should enjoy the five sense objects.

original: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad do //
analyzed: mtshan thams cad dang ldan pa zhes pa ni mtshan dang dpe byad skyes bu chen po'i mtshan nyid ni thams cad do //
translated: Endowed with all the marks means that all the marks and signs are the characteristics of a great being.

original: ldan pa ni des spras pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa ni des spras pa'o //
translated: Endowed means that he is adorned with them.

original: de dang 'dra pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes pa ni ji ltar rnam par snang mdzad la rdzu 'phrul mnga' ba de bzhin du de la yang yod do //
analyzed: de dang 'dra pa'i rdzu 'phrul zhes pa ni ji ltar rnam par snang mdzad la rdzu 'phrul mnga' ba de bzhin du de la yang yod do //
translated: Having a magic power like his means that just as Vairocana has magic power, so does he.

original: zla ba phyed kyi sgras ni don mang po la sbyor ba mthong ba ste /
analyzed: zla ba phyed kyi sgras ni don mang po la sbyor ba mthong ba ste /
translated: The word half-month is seen to be applied to many meanings.

original: 'dir ni mngon par zhen pa'i don gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni mngon par zhen pa'i don gzung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of attachment should be accepted.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la kun du zhen pa tsam zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin la kun du zhen pa tsam zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that he is merely attached to meditative stabilization.

original: bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin tsam dngos grub kyi rgyu yin gyi spros pa gzhan dgos pa med do zhes bstan to zhes bya bas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin tsam dngos grub kyi rgyu yin gyi spros pa gzhan dgos pa med do zhes bstan to zhes bya bas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The summary is taught by the cause of the accomplishment of all activities, and so on, which teaches that the cause of accomplishment is just the meditative stabilization, and that there is no need for any other elaboration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin gyi ming nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary of the name of the meditative stabilization is taught by all tathƒÅgatas, and so on.

original: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni rdo rje nyid las phyag mtshan thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'khor lo zhes pa ni rdo rje nyid las phyag mtshan thams cad 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The wheel of indivisible nature is the vajra itself, because all hand implements arise from it.

original: de bzhin du thams cad bskyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad bskyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bstan to //
translated: Similarly, having generated all, and so on, teaches the meditative stabilization of AmitƒÅbha.

original: thams cad ni bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All refers to the expulsion of obstructors, and so on.

original: dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag mtshan @35b no ;
analyzed: dmar po 'dab ma brgyad pa zhes bya ba ni 'od dpag tu med pa'i phyag mtshan @35b no ;
translated: The eight-petaled red lotus is the hand implement of AmitƒÅbha.

original: / rang gi sngags kyi skyes bu zhes pa ni rang gi sngags las byung ba'i lha'i sku gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: / rang gi sngags kyi skyes bu zhes pa ni rang gi sngags las byung ba'i lha'i sku gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who is the being of his own mantra is the one who has the body of the deity arisen from his own mantra.

original: des ni dam tshig sems dpa'i sgom pa rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: des ni dam tshig sems dpa'i sgom pa rab tu bstan to //
translated: By this he has taught the meditation of the commitment being.

original: ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gnyis kyi lhag par mos pa bstan to ;
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gnyis kyi lhag par mos pa bstan to ;
translated: The one who is the wisdom being, etc. teaches the imagination of the two beings.

original: / mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bstan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: / mi phyed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces pa ni ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' bstan pa yin pas so //
translated: The one who has the nature of indivisibility is the concentration being.

original: 'od dpag tu med par rtogs pa'i sems kyi 'jug pas bkod pa'o zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje 'chang gi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med par rtogs pa'i sems kyi 'jug pas bkod pa'o zhes pa ni gsung rdo rje 'chang gi rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis dgod par bya'o //
translated: The one who is arrayed by the entry of the mind which has realized AmitƒÅbha is the one who is to be arrayed by the yogis of VƒÅgƒ´≈õvara.

original: dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gsung rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid can gsung rdo rje bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The one who is the commitment, etc. teaches that one should meditate on VƒÅgƒ´≈õvara as having the nature of the three beings.

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom pa de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa yang bsgom par bya'o zhes tshul 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar dang po sbyor ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyis 'od dpag tu med pa bsgom pa de bzhin du rin chen 'byung ldan la sogs pa yang bsgom par bya'o zhes tshul 'di nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: In order to teach that, it is said, ‚ÄúJust as one meditates on AmitƒÅbha with the samƒÅdhi of the first union, so one should meditate on Ratnasa·πÉbhava and so on.‚Äù

original: sems dpa' gsum brtsegs mar byas nas zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gcig tu byas nas so //
analyzed: sems dpa' gsum brtsegs mar byas nas zhes pa ni dam tshig dang ye shes dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' gcig tu byas nas so //
translated: Having made the triple-being Cakrasa·πÉvara is explained by ‚Äúin this way.‚Äù

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsdus so //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin to zhes pa ni snang ba mtha' yas kyi ting nge 'dzin bsdus so //
translated: The samƒÅdhi of AmitƒÅbha is the samƒÅdhi of AmitƒÅbha.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni tha mal pa rnams kyis phyed par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o zhes pa ni tha mal pa rnams kyis phyed par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The conventional truth is that it cannot be perceived by ordinary people.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa zhes pa ni chos thams cad kyi chos nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: The ultimate truth is that it is the essence of the nature of all phenomena.

original: chos dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa las 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'o zhes pa ni bar gyi tshig mi mngon pa las 'dzin pa'o //
translated: Endowed with dharma is understood from the elided middle word.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgoms nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgoms nas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i mthar thug pa rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of great Vajradhara and so forth is that by meditating on the creation stage, one will attain the state of great Vajradhara, the culmination of the completion stage.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus ba bstan to /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus ba bstan to /
translated: The phrase all tathƒÅgatas and so forth teaches the summary of the samƒÅdhi of the nature of the three beings.

original: thams cad bskyed pa zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa byas nas so //
analyzed: thams cad bskyed pa zhes pa ni bgegs bskrad pa la sogs pa byas nas so //
translated: The phrase having generated everything means having performed the expulsion of obstructors and so forth.

original: dam tshig sems dpa' zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku rnam par bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyi @36a * //üîΩbrlab pa bstan to //
analyzed: dam tshig sems dpa' zhes pa ni mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku rnam par bsgoms nas de'i 'og tu sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' byin gyi @36a * //üîΩbrlab pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase pledge being means having meditated on the form of the great seal of Ak·π£obhya, and then below that, the phrase mind and so forth teaches the consecration of the gnosis being and the concentration being.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pas mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i sku bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, etc. teaches that the yogin of Ak·π£obhya should cultivate the body of the great seal of Ak·π£obhya.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i thun bzhi la rtag tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i thun bzhi la rtag tu bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to ;
translated: Thus, etc. teaches that one should always cultivate in the four periods of the day and night.

original: / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas zhes pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pas zhes pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ni gsum ste /
translated: By the full maturation of the roots of virtue means that the roots of virtue are three:

original: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags med pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'o //
translated: non-greed, non-hatred, and non-delusion.

original: de rnams smin pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams smin pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Their maturation is their completion.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon par rtogs nas zhes pa ni mngon du byas nas so //
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin mngon par rtogs nas zhes pa ni mngon du byas nas so //
translated: Having realized the vajra-like meditative stabilization means having actualized it.

original: tshe 'di nyid ni mthong ba'i chos la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba ni rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin gyi dpal zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par byed pa rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid ni mthong ba'i chos la phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub thob par 'gyur ba ni rdo rje'i sku'i rang bzhin gyi dpal zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas thob par byed pa rdo rje 'chang gi go 'phang mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this very life, one attains the power of the Great Seal, which is the attainment of the state of Vajradhara, the state of glorious union, which is the nature of the vajra body.

original: ston pa rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi skus chos bstan pa'i sgo nas lha dang mi rnams rjes su bstan pa dang gdul bar mdzad pas ston pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ston pa rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpal rdo rje 'chang gi skus chos bstan pa'i sgo nas lha dang mi rnams rjes su bstan pa dang gdul bar mdzad pas ston pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: The verse that begins The teacher, Vajra and so forth explains that he is the teacher because he teaches and trains gods and humans through the Dharma teachings of the body of glorious Vajradhara.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa brgyad ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The eight, beginning with the lord of desire, have already been explained.

original: 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung gnas yin pa'i phyir zhes pa ni sku'i dbang phyug la sogs pa de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase because he is the source means that he is the source of those, such as the lord of body.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi thugs rdo rje 'chang sprul par byed pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa pos bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi thugs rdo rje 'chang sprul par byed pa bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos bka' stsal to zhes sdud pa pos bstan to //
translated: The one called Vajra and so on indicates that the BhagavƒÅn Great Vajradhara, who emanates the mind vajra of the nature of the three beings, has spoken. This is taught by the compiler.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i don zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rab tu dbye ba brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i don zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i rab tu dbye ba brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of division is that the divisions of the five tathƒÅgatas' creation stage should be expressed.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi tshig gis gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang dang mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang de bzhin du lnga'i tshig gis don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang gi tshig gis gsungs pa rdo rje 'chang dang mi bskyod pa dang 'od dpag tu med pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dang de bzhin du lnga'i tshig gis don yod grub pa dang rin chen 'byung ldan
translated: By Great Vajradhara and so on, the meaning of the five words of Vajradhara, Ak·π£obhya, AmitƒÅbha, Vairocana, and likewise Amoghasiddhi and Ratnasambhava is taught by their own words.

original: yang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang de bzhin du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should meditate in the same way.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rnal 'byor gyi ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the words‚Äù means that the yogic meditative stabilization is taught separately as the branch of union of the six-faced Great Vajradhara and the first of the five Tathagatas.

original: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sogs pa'i sgras shes par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood by the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù

original: sgras de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i @36b rim pa'i rnal 'byor rim gyis sgom par byed pas de rdzogs na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sgras de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i @36b rim pa'i rnal 'byor rim gyis sgom par byed pas de rdzogs na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the words‚Äù and so forth teaches that the result of the completion stage will also arise when it is complete, since one cultivates the sequential yoga of the creation stage in sequence.

original: de mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid bstan par bya ste gang gi phyir brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku sngar bshad pa de dag las sngags kyi sku bstan
analyzed: de mngon sum nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa nyid bstan par bya ste gang gi phyir brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa dag la sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku sngar bshad pa de dag las sngags kyi sku bstan
translated: ‚ÄúThat is direct perception‚Äù and so forth teaches the completion stage itself, since the mantra body and the gnosis body, which were previously explained for the analytic and completion yogis, are taught from among those.

original: nas ye shes kyi sku bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nas ye shes kyi sku bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the mantra body, in order to teach the gnosis body,

original: shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: The wisdom and so on are taught by wisdom and so on.

original: ye shes kyi sku yang rnam pa gnyis te sgyu ma'i sku dang rdo rje'i sku'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku yang rnam pa gnyis te sgyu ma'i sku dang rdo rje'i sku'o //
translated: The wisdom body is also of two kinds: the illusory body and the vajra body.

original: de la sgyu ma'i sku ni rim pa gnyis pa las ldang bar bya ba dang / rdo rje'i sku ni rim pa bzhi las ldang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la sgyu ma'i sku ni rim pa gnyis pa las ldang bar bya ba dang / rdo rje'i sku ni rim pa bzhi las ldang bar bya'o //
translated: The illusory body is to be arisen from the second stage, and the vajra body is to be arisen from the fourth stage.

original: da ni rim pa bzhi pa'i man ngag 'od gsal ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rim pa bzhi pa'i man ngag 'od gsal ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the clear light, the instruction of the fourth stage,

original: ye shes ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa nyid bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i tshul du snang bas so //
analyzed: ye shes ni rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'o zhes bya ba ni shes pa nyid bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i tshul du snang bas so //
translated: wisdom is moving and unmoving means that consciousness itself appears in the manner of being both inanimate and not inanimate.

original: tshogs zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: tshogs zhes pa ni 'gro ba rigs drug pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The assembly is the sentient beings of the six classes of migrating beings.

original: de nyid 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten gsum ni khams gsum pa'o //
translated: That itself is the three worlds, the three realms.

original: rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs zhes ba ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las byung ba rdo rje 'chang gi skur langs nas so ;
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs zhes ba ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob pa 'od gsal ba'i de kho na nyid las byung ba rdo rje 'chang gi skur langs nas so ;
translated: The form of one's own great seal is arisen as the body of Vajradhara from the reality of clear light attained by the stage of the purified mind.

original: / rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba rnams la'o zhes pa ni rang gzhan la'o //
analyzed: / rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba rnams la'o zhes pa ni rang gzhan la'o //
translated: In the moving and unmoving, that is, in oneself and others.

original: nam mkha' byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od gsal ba nyid du bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi 'od gsal ba nyid du bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the statement ‚Äúhaving made space the agent, etc.,‚Äù it is taught that one should make the clear light of the subsequent dissolution.üîΩThe firm ones, the moving ones,

original: brtan pa dag ni g-yo ba dag / sngon du 'od gsal bar ni byas //
analyzed: brtan pa dag ni g-yo ba dag / sngon du 'od gsal bar ni byas //
translated: having been made clear light

original: phyi nas de bzhin bdag nyid bya //üîΩrjes su 'jug pa'i rim 'di yin //
analyzed: phyi nas de bzhin bdag nyid bya // rjes su 'jug pa'i rim 'di yin //
translated: afterwards, one should do the same to oneself.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is the process of subsequent dissolution.

original: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor ba sngar gang yin pa de ni gcig pur 'gyur te 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems dpa' gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rnal 'byor ba sngar gang yin pa de ni gcig pur 'gyur te 'od gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The yoga of the identity of the three beings, which was previously one, becomes one again, with the identity of clear light.

original: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la phyi'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas zhugs la 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin la gnas
analyzed: 'od gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas nang gi bdag nyid kyi dkyil 'khor la phyi'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor rdo rje phreng ba las gsungs pa'i don dam pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas zhugs la 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin la gnas
translated: The phrase illuminating and so forth refers to the inner nature of the mandala, which is the outer nature of Vairochana and so forth. Having entered the mandala of the ultimate nature of the vajra garland, one should abide in the nature of the clear light.üîΩüîΩ

original: par bya'o zhes bstan to //üîΩrim pa gnyis pa 'od gsal ba la @37a * //
analyzed: par bya'o zhes bstan to // rim pa gnyis pa 'od gsal ba la @37a * //
translated: By luminous and so on, he teaches that one should enter the external mandala of Vairochana and so on, which appear in the internal nature of the mandala, by the sequence of the ultimate mandala as taught in the Vajra-dhƒÅtu Mandala, and abide in the nature of luminous clarity.

original: 'jug pa'i phyir bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyir bstan par bya ste /
translated: In order to enter the second stage, luminous clarity, he teaches:

original: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi rim pa'am phyag rgya'i rim pas ye shes gsum mngon du byas la slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis 'od gsal ba la zhugs par bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab ces bya ba la sogs pas sngags kyi rim pa'am phyag rgya'i rim pas ye shes gsum mngon du byas la slar yang rim pa de nyid kyis 'od gsal ba la zhugs par bstan to //
translated: By wisdom and so on, he teaches that one should actualize the three exalted wisdoms by the mantra stage or the seal stage, and again by that very stage enter luminous clarity.

original: ye shes gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ye shes gsum ni snang ba la sogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The three exalted wisdoms are the three beginning with appearance.

original: de dang mnyam bar gyur cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas de mi snang bar byed pa 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor rnal 'byor pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang mnyam bar gyur cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas de mi snang bar byed pa 'od gsal ba'i ngo bor rnal 'byor pa 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By becoming the same as that and so on, he teaches that the yogi becomes the nature of luminous clarity, which is the non-appearance of that.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po ni nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: Great Vajradhara is taught to be the summary.

original: 'og nas bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku yongs su gzung ba dang rdo rje'i sku gzung ba bstan te /
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku yongs su gzung ba dang rdo rje'i sku gzung ba bstan te /
translated: By taught below and so forth, the wisdom body and the vajra body are taught.

original: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi sku'o //
translated: The great seal is the body of Vajradhara.

original: de mi snang ba zhes pa ni de dag par byed pa 'od gsal ba ste sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa 'am mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas thob par bya'o //üîΩde las 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhes pa 'dis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'am /
analyzed: de mi snang ba zhes pa ni de dag par byed pa 'od gsal ba ste sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pa 'am mngon par byang chub kyi rim pas thob par bya'o // de las 'byung bar 'gyur pa zhes pa 'dis bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa'am /
translated: Its disappearance is the clear light that purifies it, which is to be attained by the stage of the pure mind or the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas ldang ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi sku bstan to //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas ldang ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi sku bstan to //
translated: By arising from that, the stage of self-consecration or the stage of union is taught, which is the arising of the body of Vajradhara.

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos so thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku de'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba'i dngos so thams cad kyi bdag nyid can zhes pa ni ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku de'i rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The nature of all things moving and unmoving is the nature of the wisdom body and the vajra body.

original: sgyu ma lta bu dang gnyis su med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu dang gnyis su med pa yin pas so //
translated: because it is like an illusion and non-dual.

original: ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste rdo rje'i sku yang ngo //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'o zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste rdo rje'i sku yang ngo //
translated: The ‚Äúbody of intuition‚Äù is a synecdoche for the vajra body.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i skus 'jug pa zhes pa ni gdul bya'i dbye bas so //üîΩde zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid nye bar bsdu ba bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i skus 'jug pa zhes pa ni gdul bya'i dbye bas so // de zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid nye bar bsdu ba bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe entry of the body of Vairochana, etc.‚Äù is by way of the distinctions of those to be trained.üîΩ‚ÄúThat‚Äù and so forth teaches the summary of that.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid spros nas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas de nyid spros nas bstan par bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe meditative concentration‚Äù and so forth teaches the elaboration of that.

original: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi skur dmigs la srog dang rtsol ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje bzlas pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'i rdo rje 'chang gi skur dmigs la srog dang rtsol ba'i bdag nyid kyi rdo rje bzlas pa la gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe vajra ma·πá·∏çala‚Äù and so forth teaches that one should abide in the vajra repetition which has the nature of vitality and exertion, visualizing the body of Vajradhara arising from the clear light.

original: yongs su dag pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su zhes pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'am zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs su zhes pa ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'am zung du 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe form of the completely pure great seal‚Äù is to be attained by the meditative concentration of self-consecration or union.

original: sgom pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am /
analyzed: sgom pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am /
translated: Meditation is the arising from clear light, which is to be attained by the stage of the pure mind,

original: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par byang chub pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'o //
translated: or which is to be attained by the stage of manifest enlightenment.

original: sems can tha mal ba'i @37b zhes pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sems can tha mal ba'i @37b zhes pa ni gdul bya rnams kyi'o //
translated: The ordinary beings are those to be trained.

original: yul du gyur pa zhes pa ni brtan pa la sogs pa thob pa'i don du mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yul du gyur pa zhes pa ni brtan pa la sogs pa thob pa'i don du mig gi dbang po'i spyod yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The object is the object of the eye faculty, for the sake of attaining stability and so forth.

original: sprul pa'i sku yongs su gzung ba zhes pa ni spros nas so //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku yongs su gzung ba zhes pa ni spros nas so //
translated: The emanation body is the one that is emanated.

original: srog dang rtsol ba'i yan lag tu gyur cing zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba'i yan lag tu gyur cing zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum gyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The branch of life and exertion is the cause of the three, entry and so forth.

original: mi shigs pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa las 'byung ba mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi shigs pa zhes pa ni yi ge aa las 'byung ba mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The indestructible is the one that arises from the letter A and is unchanging.

original: thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ba'i yi ge ha ni h'um zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thugs rdo rje 'chang gi sa bon nye bar mtshon par 'gyur ba'i yi ge ha ni h'um zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The letter Ha, which is the seed of Cittavajra, is the meaning of Hum.

original: snying gar gzhag ste zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi po la cha cha'i dbye bas de nyid phyi nas gsang ba'i bzlas pa bya ste /
analyzed: snying gar gzhag ste zhes pa ni dkyil 'khor bzhi po la cha cha'i dbye bas de nyid phyi nas gsang ba'i bzlas pa bya ste /
translated: Placing it at the heart means that one should perform the outer and secret recitations of the four ma·πá·∏çalas by dividing them into parts.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de nas rnal 'byor dbang phyug la //
analyzed: de nas rnal 'byor dbang phyug la //
translated: Then, to the lord of yogins,

original: thabs kyi dam pa rab bstan pa //
analyzed: thabs kyi dam pa rab bstan pa //
translated: the supreme method is well taught,üîΩthe secret syllables that bestow

original: rnal 'byor dngos grub 'bras ster pa'i //üîΩgsang ba'i yi ge bshad par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor dngos grub 'bras ster pa'i // gsang ba'i yi ge bshad par bya //
translated: the result of the accomplishment of yoga.

original: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyis ni //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa tsam gyis ni //
translated: By merely knowing them,

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams mchog ster 'gyur //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams mchog ster 'gyur //
translated: the yogins will be granted the supreme.

original: dang po'i yi ge'i sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dang po'i yi ge'i sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the application of the first syllable,

original: dbugs ni rtag tu brngub par bya //
analyzed: dbugs ni rtag tu brngub par bya //
translated: the breath is always inhaled.

original: brgyad pa'i mtha' dang yang dag ldan //
analyzed: brgyad pa'i mtha' dang yang dag ldan //
translated: Endowed with the end of the eighth,

original: yi ge au dang thig ler bcas //
analyzed: yi ge au dang thig ler bcas //
translated: the syllable u with a drop,

original: rnal 'byor pas ni dbugs dbyung bya //üîΩde ni ci dga'i bzlas par bshad //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni dbugs dbyung bya // de ni ci dga'i bzlas par bshad //
translated: the yogin should exhale.

original: ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ces 'byung ngo //
translated: That is explained as the recitation of one's choice.

original: gzhan las kyang /üîΩsnying ga'i padmar mgo med gnas //üîΩmgrin pa'i padmar mgo bo ste //
analyzed: gzhan las kyang / snying ga'i padmar mgo med gnas // mgrin pa'i padmar mgo bo ste //
translated: And in another source:üîΩThe headless one resides in the heart lotus.üîΩThe head is in the lotus of the throat.

original: gsang ba'i padmar dbyangs yig gnas //
analyzed: gsang ba'i padmar dbyangs yig gnas //
translated: The vowels reside in the secret lotus.

original: lte ba'i padmar sgra mtha'o //
analyzed: lte ba'i padmar sgra mtha'o //
translated: At the navel lotus, the sound end.

original: 'gro dang 'ong par de byed pas //üîΩthig le rnal 'byor rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong par de byed pas // thig le rnal 'byor rab tu 'jug / ces bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: By his going and coming,üîΩthe yogi enters the drop yoga.

original: 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba'i dus su g-yas pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi kha dog dmar po la sogs pa 'od zer gyi sgo nas rdo rje bzlas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'od zer zhes bya ba la sogs pas dkyil 'khor bzhi 'byung ba'i dus su g-yas pa la sogs pa'i lam gyi kha dog dmar po la sogs pa 'od zer gyi sgo nas rdo rje bzlas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The light rays and so forth indicate that at the time of the arising of the four mandalas, one should practice vajra repetition by way of the light rays of the right and so forth paths, red and so forth.

original: srog dang rtsol ba la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: srog dang rtsol ba la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni 'jug pa la sogs pa gsum la gnas pa'o //
translated: The abiding in life and exertion is abiding in the three, entering and so forth.

original: 'od zer bcu po zhes pa ni rlung dang nye ba'i rlung rab tu rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer bcu po zhes pa ni rlung dang nye ba'i rlung rab tu rgyu ba'o //
translated: The ten light rays are the movement of the winds and the near winds.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that,üîΩhe says,

original: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: and so forth.

original: ha zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon bstan to //
analyzed: ha zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i sa bon bstan to //
translated: The ha is the seed that is the cause of vajra repetition.

original: brjod du med pa'i zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba las 'byung ba'i phyir yang brjod du med pa zhes pa ni rang rig pa yin pa ste @38a * //
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i zhes pa ni mi 'gyur ba las 'byung ba'i phyir yang brjod du med pa zhes pa ni rang rig pa yin pa ste @38a * //
translated: Since inexpressible arises from unchanging bliss, inexpressible is self-awareness.

original: rdo rje'i tshig ni sgra med pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: rdo rje'i tshig ni sgra med pa'o zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The inexpressible is the self-awareness that arises from the unchanging, because of the explanation that the vajra word is soundless.

original: 'jam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon gyi sgo nas rim pa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa bstan to //üîΩ'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon gyi sgo nas rim pa bzhi'i bdag nyid kyis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob pa bstan to // 'od gsal ba'o zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'am /
translated: The smooth and so forth indicate the attainment of the state of Great Vajradhara by means of the four stages, by way of the benefit.

original: rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa bzhi pas thob par bya'o //
translated: The clear light is to be attained by means of the stage of the pure mind, or by means of the fourth stage.

original: de las byung bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'am zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku las rdo rje'i skur ldang bar bstan to //
analyzed: de las byung bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa 'am zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas ye shes kyi sku las rdo rje'i skur ldang bar bstan to //
translated: From that, arising and so forth indicate the arising of the vajra body from the gnosis body by means of the stage of self-consecration or the stage of union.

original: phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi yul du byas pas na zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas sa bcu pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa rnams kyi yul du byas pas na zhes pa ni sems rnam par dag pa'i rim pas sa bcu pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is the object of the irreversible ones, the stage of the pure mind is attained, the tenth stage.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As is said:

original: dang po las kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dang po las kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the first application of karma,

original: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: the eighth stage is attained.

original: snang ba gsum po thob pa yis //üîΩsa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: snang ba gsum po thob pa yis // sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: By attaining the three appearances,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one is well-established on the tenth stage.

original: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi lus so zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rang bzhin gyi lus so zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa tsam yin te /
translated: The body of the nature of wisdom is merely an illustration.

original: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sku yang ngo //
analyzed: rdo rje'i rang bzhin gyi sku yang ngo //
translated: The vajra-nature body is also [included].

original: de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gnyis kyi sku bzung nas so //
analyzed: de thob nas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa gnyis kyi sku bzung nas so //
translated: Having attained that, etc. means having taken up the body of two kinds.

original: 'od zer bcu ste zhes pa ni rlung bcu nye bar bsdu ba'i bdag nyid ma ning gi bzlas ba la rab tu gnas pa ni gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'od zer bcu ste zhes pa ni rlung bcu nye bar bsdu ba'i bdag nyid ma ning gi bzlas ba la rab tu gnas pa ni gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ten light rays are the ten winds. Abiding in the practice of the neutral repetition that is the nature of their complete gathering, one abides.

original: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pas bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i sku dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba la sogs pas bden pa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can gyi phyag rgya chen po'i sku dang ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: The passage beginning enlightenment teaches the possession of the body of the great seal, which has the nature of the two truths.

original: bden pa gnyis kyi yongs su gzung ba'i gzugs ni zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis kyi yongs su gzung ba'i gzugs ni zhes pa ni bden pa gnyis dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The phrase the form that is the object of the two truths refers to the inseparability of the two truths.

original: de nyid ni khams gsum pa tshim par byed pas na zhes pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid ni khams gsum pa tshim par byed pas na zhes pa ni bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pas so //
translated: That very [form] is the satisfier of the three realms, which means that it fulfills all wishes.

original: bsam gtan gyi zas kyis bskal pa'i mtha'i bar du gnas pas na 'khor ba ji srid par gnas nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas na'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi zas kyis bskal pa'i mtha'i bar du gnas pas na 'khor ba ji srid par gnas nas sems can gyi don mdzad pas na'o //
translated: It remains as long as cyclic existence lasts because it remains until the end of time by the food of meditative stabilization, and it performs the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i sgra'i sgo nas rim pa lnga'i bdag nyid rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase explained by the intention means that it is taught by the reality of the completion stage, which has the nature of the five stages, by means of contradictory words.

original: bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi sku'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas sngar bshad pa'i sngags kyi sku'o //
translated: The phrase just explained refers to the mantra body that was explained previously.

original: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu shin tu rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyi 'og tu shin tu rnal 'byor bstan par bya ste /
translated: After the yoga and subsequent yoga, the very yoga should be taught.

original: gzung ba'i sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su @38b rnal 'byor gyi bskyed pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: gzung ba'i sprul pa'i sku zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su @38b rnal 'byor gyi bskyed pa'i sku'o //
translated: The ‚Äúapprehended emanation body‚Äù is the body generated by the yoga and subsequent yoga.

original: gang gi phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya ba mi rigs te don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rdzogs pa'i rim pas thob par bya ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku'i mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya ba mi rigs te don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not proper to bless the eye, etc., with the gnosis body and vajra body to be attained by the completion stage, because it is meaningless.

original: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi sgo nas des dngos po thams cad rnam par dpyod pas mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyi sgo nas des dngos po thams cad rnam par dpyod pas mngon par shes pa thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By analyzing all things with the twelve examples of illusion, one will attain the superknowledges.

original: 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni mngon par shes pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The result is defined by the superknowledges.

original: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga stong par byas nas /
analyzed: dang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig la sogs pa'i dbang po lnga stong par byas nas /
translated: With ‚Äúfirst,‚Äù etc., having made the five sense organs such as the eye empty,

original: yang sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thlhim la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnam par bkod nas de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i sku bsams la yang de yongs su gyur pa las mig gi dbang po la sogs
analyzed: yang sa'i snying po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thlhim la sogs pa'i yig 'bru rnam par bkod nas de yongs su gyur pa las sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i sku bsams la yang de yongs su gyur pa las mig gi dbang po la sogs
translated: Also, having arranged the syllables such as h≈´·πÉ of the bodhisattvas such as K·π£itigarbha, and having imagined the forms of K·π£itigarbha and so on from their complete transformation, one should imagine those such as the eye sense-faculty

original: pa de rnams bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: pa de rnams bsam par bya'o //
translated: from their complete transformation.

original: de ltar rtsol ba byas pa'i rnam 'byor pas ring ba dang bsgribs pa dang bskal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba dang thos pa dang / snom pa dang myong ba dang reg pas lha'i mig la sogs pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rtsol ba byas pa'i rnam 'byor pas ring ba dang bsgribs pa dang bskal pa'i gzugs la sogs pa mthong ba dang thos pa dang / snom pa dang myong ba dang reg pas lha'i mig la sogs pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the yogi/nƒ´ who has practiced in this way sees, hears, smells, tastes, and touches forms and so on that are distant, obscured, and in other world systems, and attains the divine eye and so on.

original: stong par byas pas ni rang bzhin med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: stong par byas pas ni rang bzhin med par byas pa'o //
translated: By making it empty, one makes it essenceless.

original: khong stong ni stong pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: khong stong ni stong pa'i sa'o //
translated: Hollow is the empty earth.

original: tha ni sa'i khams kyi yig 'bru yin pa dang la'ang de'i rang bzhin pa'o //
analyzed: tha ni sa'i khams kyi yig 'bru yin pa dang la'ang de'i rang bzhin pa'o //
translated: Tha is the syllable of the earth element, and la is its nature.

original: a'i ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang ha ni thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: a'i ni shes rab kyi rang bzhin dang ha ni thabs kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The letter A is the nature of wisdom, and the letter Ha is the nature of means.

original: des na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las byung ba sa'i snying po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na thabs dang shes rab kyi bdag nyid sa'i khams kyi rang bzhin rnam par snang mdzad kyi rigs las byung ba sa'i snying po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the earth element, which is the essence of means and wisdom, is called K·π£itigarbha, because it arises from the family of Vairocana.

original: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer gyis 'bar bar gyur pa zhes pa ni mig g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge de'i kha dog dang ldan par dgod pas so //
analyzed: nyi ma dang zla ba'i 'od zer gyis 'bar bar gyur pa zhes pa ni mig g-yon pa dang g-yas pa dag la zla ba dang nyi ma'i rang bzhin gyi yi ge de'i kha dog dang ldan par dgod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBlazing with the light of the sun and moon‚Äù means that the letters of the nature of the moon and sun are placed in the left and right eyes, with their respective colors.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i mig gnyis kyis lta bas phyogs skyong ba dang bgegs kyi tshogs la sogs pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las skyes pa'i mig gnyis kyis lta bas phyogs skyong ba dang bgegs kyi tshogs la sogs pa rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúBy whom‚Äù and so forth teaches that by looking with the two eyes born from the transformation of the letters, the hosts of direction protectors, obstructors, and so forth will be pacified.

original: sa'i snying po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni sa'i snying po yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i mig gi dbang po yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sa'i snying po'i ngo bo nyid kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni sa'i snying po yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i mig gi dbang po yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: One should meditate on the nature of K·π£itigarbha. This teaches that one should meditate on the eye faculty arisen from the transformation of K·π£itigarbha, marked by that very syllable.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i mig thob pa nyid bstan to //üîΩdngos po @39a * //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba la sogs pas lha'i mig thob pa nyid bstan to // dngos po @39a * //
translated: Being like MahƒÅvajradhara and so on teaches the attainment of the divine eye.

original: thams cad ces pa ni rang pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces pa ni rang pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All things means the self and so on.

original: lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du zhes pa ni shin tu gang na gnas pa'i yul bzhin gsal bar mthong bar bstan to //
analyzed: lag mthil gyi skyu ru ra bzhin du zhes pa ni shin tu gang na gnas pa'i yul bzhin gsal bar mthong bar bstan to //
translated: Like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand teaches that one sees very clearly, as if the object were right in front of one.

original: bshad pa'i don bstan pa'i sa bon no zhes pa la sogs pas yig 'bru'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i don bstan pa'i sa bon no zhes pa la sogs pas yig 'bru'i dpe bstan to //
translated: The seed of the explanation is the syllable and so on teaches the example of the syllable.

original: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus par bstan to //
translated: Space vajra and so on teaches the summary of the samƒÅdhi.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i lha'i mig dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i phan yon ston to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i lha'i mig dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rna ba la sogs pa'i phan yon ston to //
translated: Thus, etc. shows the benefits of the divine eye explained above and of the divine ear, etc. to be explained.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas so zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa bsgom pas so zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: One becomes like Great Vajradhara, the remainder of the sentence is: by cultivating the perfection stage in stages.

original: dus gsum du 'byung ba'i rgyal ba rnams so zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i lha'i mig la sogs pa bsgom par 'gyur bas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus gsum du 'byung ba'i rgyal ba rnams so zhes pa ni khams gsum gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'brel ba dang ldan pa'i lha'i mig la sogs pa bsgom par 'gyur bas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The victors of the three times are the divine eye, etc. related to the tathagatas of the three realms, by cultivating them one becomes like Great Vajradhara, is what is meant.

original: lha'i mig la sogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig byin gyis brlabs pas rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i dngos grub gtso bor thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lha'i mig la sogs pa ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas mig byin gyis brlabs pas rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa'i dngos grub gtso bor thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The divine eye, etc. shows that by blessing the eye, one attains the chief accomplishments of one's own and others' schools.

original: dngos grub thams cad kyi zhes pa ni gter dbyung ba dang sa 'og tu 'jug pa dang lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad kyi zhes pa ni gter dbyung ba dang sa 'og tu 'jug pa dang lha ma yin gyi bu mo dgug pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba'i mchog ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: All powers means the supreme application of extracting treasure, entering the underworld, summoning the daughters of the demigods, and so forth.

original: lha'i mig gis sa 'og la gnas pa'i gter la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis sa 'og la gnas pa'i gter la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one sees with the divine eye the treasure and so forth that are located under the earth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku bskyed la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor dag gis rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku bskyed la //
translated: By the ma·πá·∏çala of the Buddha and so forth, [the BhagavƒÅn] teaches that, having generated the body of Vajradhara and so forth by means of yoga and subsequent yoga,

original: de'i rna ba'i dbang po stong par byas nas de la yig 'bru dgod cing yongs su gyur pa las lag na rdo rje bsgoms la /
analyzed: de'i rna ba'i dbang po stong par byas nas de la yig 'bru dgod cing yongs su gyur pa las lag na rdo rje bsgoms la /
translated: one should visualize VajrapƒÅ·πái by placing the syllable [of VajrapƒÅ·πái] on the empty organ of hearing and transforming it.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las yang rna ba'i dbang po de'i yig 'brus mtshan pa byas pas /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las yang rna ba'i dbang po de'i yig 'brus mtshan pa byas pas /
translated: Having marked that organ of hearing with the syllable again, by transforming it,

original: bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pas lha'i rna ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i sgra thos pas lha'i rna ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: one will possess the divine ear, hearing sounds such as those that are obstructed.

original: rna ba'i gnas zhes pa ni rna ba'i nang na'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i gnas zhes pa ni rna ba'i nang na'o //
translated: The ‚Äúplace of the ear‚Äù is inside the ear.

original: 'od gsal ba bsgom pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba bsgom pa zhes pa ni stong pa nyid bsgom par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúMeditation on light‚Äù means meditation on emptiness.

original: de'i dbus su gnas par ro zhes pa ni khong stong gi dbus su gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dbus su gnas par ro zhes pa ni khong stong gi dbus su gnas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúResiding in its middle‚Äù means residing in the middle of the hollow.

original: aom zhes pa ni dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa ni dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOm‚Äù is the teaching of the example.

original: de'i rang bzhin du byas pas so zhes pa ni lag na rdo rje dang de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'o//
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin du byas pas so zhes pa ni lag na rdo rje dang de'i bdag nyid du byas pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúBy making it one‚Äôs nature‚Äù means by making it one‚Äôs nature as VajrapƒÅ·πái.

original: @39b rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang na gnas pa'i sgra thos pa bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @39b rdo rje 'chang chen po ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang na gnas pa'i sgra thos pa bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i sgra yang thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne hears the sounds of MahƒÅvajradhara‚Äù and so forth means that one will hear the sounds of obscured and so forth, as if one were hearing the sounds of the place where one resides.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs pa'i sku'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa khong du chud cing rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang mtshungs pa'i sku'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas tha mal pa'i lus la sogs pa'i rang bzhin spangs nas rim gyis rdzogs pa'i rim pa khong du chud cing rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The body that is similar to Great Vajradhara and so forth teaches that, having abandoned the nature of the ordinary body and so forth, one gradually enters into the completion stage and becomes similar to Great Vajradhara.

original: rna ba la gnas pa'i phyag na rdo rjes zhes pa ni yig 'bru dang sku dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: rna ba la gnas pa'i phyag na rdo rjes zhes pa ni yig 'bru dang sku dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The VajrapƒÅ·πái who resides in the ear is the inseparability of the syllable and the form.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rna ba'i dbang po gnyis byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rna ba'i dbang po gnyis byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The two ears and so forth are the concise blessing of the two ear sense organs.

original: nam mkha'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor gnyis bsgoms la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i snying po'i ting nge 'dzin gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor gnyis bsgoms la /
translated: The space-like concentration of ƒÄkƒÅshagarbha and so forth, as before, one should meditate on the two yogas.

original: sna'i dbang po stong par byas nas der dgod pa'i yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las nam mkha'i snying po yongs su gyur nas sna'i dbang po yi ge de nyid kyis mtshan par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sna'i dbang po stong par byas nas der dgod pa'i yig 'bru yongs su gyur pa las nam mkha'i snying po yongs su gyur nas sna'i dbang po yi ge de nyid kyis mtshan par bsam par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having made the nose sense-faculty empty, one should imagine that Akashagarbha is generated there, and that the nose sense-faculty is marked with that very syllable.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yang bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku'i dkyil 'khor zhes pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin pas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yang bsam par bya'o //
translated: The body mandala of Great Vajradhara is an illustration, so one should imagine the bodies of Vairochana and so forth.

original: 'od gsal ba bsgoms pas zhes pa ni stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas so //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba bsgoms pas zhes pa ni stong pa nyid du bsgoms pas so //
translated: By meditating on clear light is meant meditating on emptiness.

original: yi ge aom zhes pa ni yig 'bru'i dpe bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge aom zhes pa ni yig 'bru'i dpe bstan to //
translated: The syllable om teaches the example of the syllable.

original: dri rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po yongs su gyur pa'i sna'i dbang po yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshon pa bstan to //
analyzed: dri rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po yongs su gyur pa'i sna'i dbang po yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshon pa bstan to //
translated: The three kinds of smell and so forth teach the nose sense-faculty which is the transformation of Akashagarbha, marked with that very syllable.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gam na gnas pa'i dri gzung ba bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dri gzung ba yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gam na gnas pa'i dri gzung ba bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i dri gzung ba yang bstan to //
translated: The phrase the world systems and so on indicates that the fragrance of the obscurations and so on is apprehended just like the fragrance of something nearby.

original: nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase through the sky treasury meditative concentration and so on indicates that one becomes like Akashagarbha.

original: blang bar bya bas na byang chub kyang yin la rang bzhin thams cad spong bar byed pas bdag med pa yin te /
analyzed: blang bar bya bas na byang chub kyang yin la rang bzhin thams cad spong bar byed pas bdag med pa yin te /
translated: Enlightenment is that which is to be taken up, and it is selflessness because it eliminates all intrinsic natures.

original: bdag med byang chub ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad stong pa'o //
analyzed: bdag med byang chub ni 'od gsal ba ste thams cad stong pa'o //
translated: Selfless enlightenment is luminous, that is, empty of everything.

original: de nyid kyis stong pa bzhi khyab par byed pas stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis stong pa bzhi khyab par byed pas stong pa bzhi'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Since that very [enlightenment] pervades the four emptinesses, it is called the nature of the four emptinesses.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cause and effect are inseparable.

original: ji skad du //
analyzed: ji skad du //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe emptiness, the emptiness of emptiness,üîΩThe third is the great emptiness,

original: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ste //
analyzed: stong pa shin tu stong pa dang // gsum pa stong pa chen po dang // bzhi pa thams cad stong pa ste //
translated: And the fourth is the emptiness of all.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas so //
translated: By the division of cause and effect.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //üîΩnyan thos pa la @40a * //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo // nyan thos pa la @40a * //
translated: Thus it is stated.üîΩNot the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: sogs pa'i yul ma yin pas na zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de dang 'dra ba'i de kho na nyid nyan thos pa la sogs pas rtogs par ma gyur te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i yul ma yin pas na zhes pa ni gang gi phyir de dang 'dra ba'i de kho na nyid nyan thos pa la sogs pas rtogs par ma gyur te /
translated: means that because of that, suchness is not realized by the ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.,

original: de rnams kyis gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa tsam goms pas so //
analyzed: de rnams kyis gang zag la bdag med pa la sogs pa tsam goms pas so //
translated: since they are accustomed to the mere selflessness of the person, and so on.üîΩThat which is the abode of the equal

original: de dang mnyam pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang yin pa zhes pa ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: means that which has the nature of non-abiding nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyis sna'i dbang po byin gyis brlabs pa'i nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rin po che'i dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas nam mkha'i snying po'i rang bzhin gyis sna'i dbang po byin gyis brlabs pa'i nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The summary of the consecration of the nose sense faculty by the nature of ƒÄkƒÅshagarbha is taught by the words ‚Äújewel commitment,‚Äù etc.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pas 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes pa la sogs pas 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation is as follows.

original: phyag rgya chen po'i bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar lce'i dbang po stong par bsgoms nas de la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi yig 'bru bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgoms te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po'i bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bar lce'i dbang po stong par bsgoms nas de la 'jig rten dbang phyug gi yig 'bru bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las 'jig rten dbang phyug bsgoms te /
translated: Having first cultivated the meditation of the great seal, one should meditate on the tongue faculty as empty, and on it arrange the seed syllable of Loke≈õvara, and from its complete transformation meditate on Loke≈õvara.

original: de yang yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin gyi lce'i yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yang yongs su gyur pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin gyi lce'i yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: And one should meditate on that very seed syllable of the nature of Loke≈õvara, which arises from its complete transformation, as marked by that.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba rnam grangs so /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes pa ni de bzhin nyid dang stong pa nyid ces bya ba rnam grangs so /
translated: The ‚Äúlimit of reality‚Äù is a synonym for suchness and emptiness.

original: de skyed par byed pa'i zhes pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug rdzogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de skyed par byed pa'i zhes pa ni 'jig rten dbang phyug rdzogs par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhich produces‚Äù means which perfects Loke≈õvara.

original: aom zhes bya bas ni dpe bstan to ;
analyzed: aom zhes bya bas ni dpe bstan to ;
translated: ‚ÄúOm‚Äù teaches the example.

original: / ro rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba 'dis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: / ro rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba 'dis 'jig rten dbang phyug gi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThe three flavors‚Äù teaches the nature of Loke≈õvara.

original: de bsgoms nas zhes pa la sogs pas gam na gnas pa'i ro myang ba bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i ro myang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bsgoms nas zhes pa la sogs pas gam na gnas pa'i ro myang ba bzhin du bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i ro myang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase having meditated on that and so forth teaches that one will experience the taste of the obscurations, etc., as if they were present right in front of one.

original: dbang po dman pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams ni dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams so //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa la sogs pa'i sems can rnams ni dman pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba dang ldan pa'i gdul bya rnams so //
translated: Beings with inferior faculties and so forth are those to be trained who possess the distinctions of inferiority and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i lam //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur ba'i lam //
translated: The path to becoming a buddha

original: zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i lam ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sngags kyi theg pa chen po'i lam ste /
translated: is the path of the Great Vehicle of Mantra.

original: gzhan rnams ni 'khrul pa dang ldan pas so /
analyzed: gzhan rnams ni 'khrul pa dang ldan pas so /
translated: The others are mistaken,

original: 'khrul pa med na yang yun ring bas thob pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i don gyi thabs zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi chos kyi 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med na yang yun ring bas thob pa'i byang chub yin pa'i phyir ro // de'i don gyi thabs zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang gi chos kyi 'khor lo gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: and even if they are not mistaken, they take a long time to attain enlightenment.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug ni gsung gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa'i rigs dang ldan pa'i 'jig rten dbang phyug ni gsung gi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the means to that end refers to the wheel of Dharma of Vajradhara, which is so called because it possesses the family of AmitƒÅbha, since Avalokite≈õvara, who possesses the family of AmitƒÅbha, is the essence of speech.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin @40b lce'i dbang po byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'jig rten dbang phyug gi rang bzhin @40b lce'i dbang po byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase the great Vajradhara and so forth indicates the blessing of the tongue sense-faculty, which is the nature of Loke≈õvara.

original: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs rnal 'byor gnyis kyis bskyed la gsang ba'i rdo rje stong par bsgom zhing de la sgrib pa sel ba'i sa bon rnam par bkod de /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs rnal 'byor gnyis kyis bskyed la gsang ba'i rdo rje stong par bsgom zhing de la sgrib pa sel ba'i sa bon rnam par bkod de /
translated: The phrase as before and so forth indicates that one should generate the form of the great seal by means of the two yogas, meditate on the secret vajra as empty, and arrange the seed of the removal of obscurations within it.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las autpala dang 'dra ba'i yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa byas la gam na gnas pa'i phyag rgya'i mtsho skyes kyi nang gi reg pa dang 'dra bar khams gsum na gnas pa'i bud med thams cad kyi padma'i reg pa myong bar 'gyurüîΩro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las autpala dang 'dra ba'i yig 'bru de nyid kyis mtshan pa byas la gam na gnas pa'i phyag rgya'i mtsho skyes kyi nang gi reg pa dang 'dra bar khams gsum na gnas pa'i bud med thams cad kyi padma'i reg pa myong bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: One should imagine that the letter like a lotus is marked with that very letter, and that one experiences the touch of the lotus of all women dwelling in the three realms, like the touch within one's own lotus.

original: 'di'i phan yon zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus byin gyis brlabs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: 'di'i phan yon zhes bya ba la sogs pas lus byin gyis brlabs pa'i phan yon bstan to //
translated: The phrase the benefits of this and so forth indicates the benefits of the blessing of the body.

original: lus la sogs pa zhes bya bas don yod grub pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //üîΩmchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus la sogs pa zhes bya bas don yod grub pa dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to // mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase body and so forth indicates that he is like Amoghasiddhi.

original: 'dus ma byas pa'i sku'i dbang po dang ldan pas snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su rtag tu dga' ba bskyed pa'o//
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'i sku'i dbang po dang ldan pas snyoms par zhugs pa'i dus su rtag tu dga' ba bskyed pa'o//
translated: The phrase supremely blissful means that he always generates bliss by possessing the unconditioned body sense-faculty, when he enters into union.

original: ye shes ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: ye shes ni bya ba nan tan grub pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The phrase wisdom means the wisdom of successful activities.

original: de'i rang bzhin don yod grub pa'i rigs las byung bas na sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin don yod grub pa'i rigs las byung bas na sgrib pa thams cad rnam par sel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he is born from the Amoghasiddhi lineage, which has that as its nature, he is called the one who clears away all obscurations.

original: bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni lus kyi dbang po byin gyis brlabs nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams spro ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes pa ni lus kyi dbang po byin gyis brlabs nas dam tshig gi dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa' dang khro bo rnams spro ba'o //
translated: The phrase having the nature of generation means that, after he empowers the body sense-faculty, he emanates all the tathagatas, goddesses, bodhisattvas, and wrathful deities by the process of the commitment wheel.

original: gdon mi za bar te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsang ba'i rdo rje las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi theg le las byung ba'i khams gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gsang ba'i rdo rje las byung ba'i byang chub sems kyi theg le las byung ba'i khams gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus par bstan to //
translated: By without doubt and so on, it is taught that the concentration of the three worlds is gathered into the bindu arisen from the secret vajra, which is the bodhicitta.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ste /
translated: By thus and so on, it is taught that one who is devoted to the TathƒÅgata should bless the eyes and so on with the TathƒÅgata himself,

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku phan tshun dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku phan tshun dbyer med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the enjoyment body and the emanation body are mutually inseparable.

original: dbyer med pa de yang bya ba gcig yin pas so //
analyzed: dbyer med pa de yang bya ba gcig yin pas so //
translated: And that inseparability is because they have the same activity.

original: sgrub thabs brtsams pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod de /
analyzed: sgrub thabs brtsams pa rnams kyis kyang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab par 'dod de /
translated: Also, those who compose the sƒÅdhanas desire to bless the eyes and so on of the bodhisattvas.

original: rdo rje'i skye mched nyid dang ni //
analyzed: rdo rje'i skye mched nyid dang ni //
translated: The vajra sense bases

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces rgyud phyi ma las gsungs pa'i gsung tshad mas so //üîΩde @41a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dkyil 'khor mchog / ces rgyud phyi ma las gsungs pa'i gsung tshad mas so // de @41a * //
translated: as stated by the valid statements of the later tantra.üîΩThe valid statement of the consecration of the eyes, etc.

original: bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i tshad ma ni /
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis kyang mig la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i tshad ma ni /
translated: by the tathƒÅgatas is

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi sku //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi sku //
translated: The body of all the tathƒÅgatas

original: phyag rgya bzhi yis rgyas btab pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya bzhi yis rgyas btab pa'o //
translated: is sealed with the four seals.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is stated.

original: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bskyed pa'i rim pas rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sku bsgoms la /
translated: By ‚Äúsuchness‚Äù and so forth, having meditated on the body of Vajradhara, etc.

original: de'i mig stong par byas te de la aom bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
analyzed: de'i mig stong par byas te de la aom bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las rnam par snang mdzad bsams la /
translated: by the stage of generation, one should make the eyes empty and place O·πÇ there, and having completely transformed that, one should imagine Vairocana.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las mig gi dbang po yig 'bru des mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las mig gi dbang po yig 'bru des mtshan pa bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having completely transformed that, one should meditate on the eye sense-faculty marked with that syllable.

original: bskyed pa'i rim gyis rdzogs pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyis 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim gyis rdzogs pa zhes pa ni rnal 'byor dang rjes su rnal 'byor gyis 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the stage of generation‚Äù refers to the yoga and the subsequent yoga.

original: sku gsum aom ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po mig la aom bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: sku gsum aom ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas dang po mig la aom bkod cing de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: The three bodies are Om, etc.üîΩüîΩFirst, Om is placed in the eyes, and from that transformation,

original: rnam par snang mdzad las byung ba'i mig bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad las byung ba'i mig bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The three bodies Om and so forth indicate that one should first arrange the Om in the eye and meditate on the eye arisen from Vairochana by its complete transformation.

original: gzugs rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi dpal rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms pas rdo rje 'chang dang 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas yul dang dbang po'i rang bzhin gyi dpal rnam par snang mdzad bsgoms pas rdo rje 'chang dang 'du bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The three aspects of form and so forth indicate that by meditating on the glorious Vairochana, which is the nature of the object and sense organ, one will unite with Vajradhara.

original: 'di'i phan yon bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i sku la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di'i phan yon bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i sku la sogs pa rnam par snang mdzad dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
