translated: The teaching of its benefits and so forth indicate that one's body and so forth will become like Vairochana.

original: ye shes kyi lus kyis mngon par byang chub cing rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir na zhes pa ni rim par sgom par byed pas ye shes kyi sku yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi lus kyis mngon par byang chub cing rtogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir na zhes pa ni rim par sgom par byed pas ye shes kyi sku yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Because one will attain manifest enlightenment and realization through the wisdom body, it is said that by meditating in stages, one will also attain the wisdom body.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes bya ba 'dis mngon par byang chub pa mngon du byas pas zung 'jug gi go 'phang yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang zhes bya ba 'dis mngon par byang chub pa mngon du byas pas zung 'jug gi go 'phang yang thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is called the stage of Great Vajradhara, which shows that by actualizing manifest enlightenment, one will also attain the stage of union.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dmigs shing bzung bas na zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dmigs shing bzung bas na zhes pa ni lus la sogs pa nye bar sdud par byed pas so //
translated: Because it is perceived and apprehended by body, speech, and mind, means that it is the collector of body, etc.

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i mig gi dbang po la dgod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po'i mig gi dbang po la dgod pa rnam par snang mdzad kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: With that, etc., he summarizes the meditative absorption of the consecration of Vairocana, which is the placement of the eye faculty in the great seal.

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid shin tu gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa zhes pa ni shin tu rnal 'byor gyi de kho na nyid shin tu gsal bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement non-intentional explanation is because it clearly teaches the reality of the very yoga.

original: sgrub pa po'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas drang ba'i don gyi phyogs su yid dang mthun pa skye bos dben pa'i gnas bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa po'i gnas zhes bya ba la sogs pas drang ba'i don gyi phyogs su yid dang mthun pa skye bos dben pa'i gnas bstan to //
translated: With the abode of the practitioner, etc., he teaches a place that is pleasing to the mind and devoid of people, in the interpretable meaning sense.

original: ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni kun nas mtho ba dang mi @41b g-ye bas na ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: ri'i rtse mo zhes bya ba ni kun nas mtho ba dang mi @41b g-ye bas na ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The peak of a mountain is conducive to meditative concentration because it is high and open on all sides.

original: dben pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dben pa ni sems rtse gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is secluded because the mind is one-pointed.

original: skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i rgyur gyur pas mthun pa'o //
analyzed: skyed mos tshal la sogs pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs pa'i rgyur gyur pas mthun pa'o //
translated: A park and so on are conducive to meditative concentration because they are the cause for entering right concentration.

original: dur khrod la sogs pa zhes pa ni chos la bdag med pa ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: dur khrod la sogs pa zhes pa ni chos la bdag med pa ston pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mthun pa'o //
translated: A charnel ground and so on are conducive to meditative concentration that teaches the selflessness of phenomena.

original: shing gcig pa dang zhes pa ni gang shing gzhan gyi grib ma med pa'am yang na gcig pu ste /
analyzed: shing gcig pa dang zhes pa ni gang shing gzhan gyi grib ma med pa'am yang na gcig pu ste /
translated: A single tree is where there is no shade of another tree, or else it is solitary.

original: de'i drung du bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i drung du bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One attained enlightenment there.

original: khong stong dang zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: khong stong dang zhes pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: An empty place is the cause for one-pointedness of mind.

original: lha'i khang pa ni gal te mi nus na de'i tshe rang gi lha khang bris sku la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i khang pa ni gal te mi nus na de'i tshe rang gi lha khang bris sku la sogs pa dang ldan pa la ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to do that, then one should practice meditative concentration in one's own temple, which has images and so on.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sum mdo dang bzhi mdo dang bas mtha' dang ma mo'i khang pa la sogs pa yang yongs su gzung bas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sum mdo dang bzhi mdo dang bas mtha' dang ma mo'i khang pa la sogs pa yang yongs su gzung bas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: And so on refers to the crossroads, the outskirts, the house of the mother goddess, and so on.

original: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bya ba zhes pa ni skye mched rnams ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs bya ba zhes pa ni skye mched rnams ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya'o //
translated: The assembly of samadhis such as Kshitigarbha is the consecration of the sense bases.

original: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rnal 'byor gyis phyogs gcig gnas gzung ba so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang ba'i don to zhes pa ni dang po'i sbyor ba'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba rnal 'byor gyis phyogs gcig gnas gzung ba so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The provisional meaning is the teaching of the individual retention of the yogi's one-pointed focus as a branch of the initial practice.

original: nu ma dang sked pa rgyas pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa ni gzugs mdzes pa dang ldan pa rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: nu ma dang sked pa rgyas pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes pa ni gzugs mdzes pa dang ldan pa rab tu bstan to //
translated: Endowed with full breasts and hips and so on indicates the teaching of a beautiful form.

original: bud med kyi ri bo zhes pa ni lo nyi shu lon pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bud med kyi ri bo zhes pa ni lo nyi shu lon pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The mountain of women refers to those twenty years old and so on.

original: de ma rnyed na lus 'tshong ni smad 'tshong ba rnams so //
analyzed: de ma rnyed na lus 'tshong ni smad 'tshong ba rnams so //
translated: If one does not find her, the body sellers are prostitutes.

original: 'gro ba thams cad dang thun mong du gyur ba'i zhes pa ni gnod pa med pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad dang thun mong du gyur ba'i zhes pa ni gnod pa med pa rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase in common with all beings refers to those who are not harmed.

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis smad pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyis smad par bya ba ste rigs ngan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyis smad pa zhes pa ni 'jig rten gyis smad par bya ba ste rigs ngan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase disparaged by the world refers to those who are despised by the world, because they are of low caste.

original: de la sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya dang khrus mkhan gyi bu mo lo nyi shu pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya dang / gar mkhan gyi bu mo lo bcu drug pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: de la sme sha can gyi bu mo lo bcu gnyis pa mi bskyod pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya dang khrus mkhan gyi bu mo lo nyi shu pa rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya dang / gar mkhan gyi bu mo lo bcu drug pa 'od dpag tu med pa'i rnal 'byor pa'i phyag rgya'o //
translated: In this regard, the daughter of an outcaste is twelve years old and is the consort for the yoga of Akshobhya; the daughter of a washerman is twenty years old and is the consort for the yoga of Vairochana; and the daughter of a dancer is sixteen years old and is the consort for the yoga of Amitabha.

original: lhan cig spyod pa de rnams byas nas sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
analyzed: lhan cig spyod pa de rnams byas nas sngar bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin bya'o //
translated: Having made these consorts, one should perform the meditative stabilization explained previously.

original: nges pa'i don te zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i dbye ba bstan pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don te zhes pa ni phyag rgya'i dbye ba bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase in terms of the definitive meaning refers to the teaching of the divisions of the consorts.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas gzung ba dang rnam par snang mdzad kyis mig byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan @42a * //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas gnas gzung ba dang rnam par snang mdzad kyis mig byin gyis brlab pa nye bar bsdus pa bstan @42a * //
translated: Thus and so forth indicate the retention of the location and the consecration of the eye by Vairochana.

original: to ; / de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rang gi bdag po bkod nas rna pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: to ; / de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang rang gi bdag po bkod nas rna pa la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, and so forth indicates the consecration of the ear and so forth, having arranged one's own lord.

original: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rna ba la sogs pa'i gnas stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
analyzed: mi bskyod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje 'chang chen po la sogs pa gang yang rung ba'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas rna ba la sogs pa'i gnas stong pa nyid du bsgoms la /
translated: By Akshobhya and so forth, one who is endowed with the yoga of any of the Great Vajradharas and so forth should meditate on the location of the ear and so forth as emptiness.

original: thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sa bon dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas de rnams bsgoms la de yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: thugs rdo rje 'chang la sogs pa'i sa bon dgod pa sngon du 'gro bas de rnams bsgoms la de yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Having previously arranged the seed of Cittavajradhara and so forth, one should meditate on those, and from their complete transformation,

original: rna ba'i skye mched la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgo nas rna ba'i skye mched la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
analyzed: rna ba'i skye mched la sogs pa bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sgo nas rna ba'i skye mched la sogs pa byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas so //
translated: one should meditate on the ear sense base and so forth. This is the stage of consecrating the ear sense base and so forth by way of the Tathagatas.

original: rdo rje 'chang gis de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pas rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsung sdud pa pos nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang gis de skad ces bka' stsal to zhes pas rdo rje 'chang chen pos gsung sdud pa pos nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: Thus did Vajradhara declare indicates that the great Vajradhara taught the compiler to compile.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa shin tu rnal 'byor gsum po so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa'o zhes pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i yan lag tu gyur pa shin tu rnal 'byor gsum po so sor bstan pas so //
translated: As it is indicates that the three yogas that are the branches of the first yoga are taught individually.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha'i mig la sogs pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams la lha'i mig la sogs pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: By the stage of generation and so forth, the yoga of the stage of completion is taught for the yogis, and the divine eye and so forth are taught.

original: dbang po rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i rim pas yul dang dbang po bsdu ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa yin no zhes lhag par mos pas ji srid phyi ma'i yan lag lnga bsgoms pas
analyzed: dbang po rnam pa lnga ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas so sor sdud pa'i rim pas yul dang dbang po bsdu ba gang yin pa de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa yin no zhes lhag par mos pas ji srid phyi ma'i yan lag lnga bsgoms pas
translated: By the five sense organs and so forth, the withdrawal of the objects and sense organs by the stage of withdrawal is taught. Whatever that is, it is the offering to the tathagatas. By the imagination that I will remain for as long as it takes to cultivate the five outer branches,

original: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar gyur ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar gyur ba de srid du gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: until I become like the great Vajradhara, it is taught.

original: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum shes nas //
analyzed: gzugs ni rnam pa gsum shes nas //
translated: Having known the form in three aspects,

original: lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya //
analyzed: lha rnams la ni dbul bar bya //
translated: one should offer it to the gods.

original: zhes le'u bdun pa las 'byung ngo //üîΩrang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku gzung ba sngon du 'gro bar 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams par bzlas shing de nyid du dbang po lnga zhugs nas de las langs nas rdo rje 'chang chen
analyzed: zhes le'u bdun pa las 'byung ngo // rang sngags zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku gzung ba sngon du 'gro bar 'jug pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis yi ge gsum yan lag ma nyams par bzlas shing de nyid du dbang po lnga zhugs nas de las langs nas rdo rje 'chang chen
translated: This is stated in the seventh chapter.

original: po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of one's own mantra, etc. , having previously apprehended the Knowledge Body, one should repeat the three syllables without loss of limbs, by means of the process of entry, etc. , and having arisen from that, one should meditate on the Knowledge Body, by means of the five senses, having become like Great Vajradhara.

original: des ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the process of Vajra Repetition.

original: rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba yul dang dbang po'i longs spyod sgyu ma lta bur mthong bas ye shes kyi sku bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyag rgya chen po'i gzugs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba yul dang dbang po'i longs spyod sgyu ma lta bur mthong bas ye shes kyi sku bsgom par bya'o //
translated: By means of one's own Great Seal form, etc. , one should meditate on the Knowledge Body, by means of the perception of the enjoyments of objects and senses, like a magical creation, arising from Clear Light.

original: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the process of Self Consecration.

original: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i phyogs gcig @42b sta thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gzhan dag ces pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i phyogs gcig @42b sta thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The other meditative stabilizations are the yoga of the drop, which is one part of vajra repetition.

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor yang rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor yang rlung gi de kho na nyid ces bya ba ste rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: The yoga of the drop is called the reality of the wind, and is the cause of the stage of vajra repetition.

original: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
analyzed: rlung gi de nyid rim gyis ni //
translated: The reality of the wind is gradual,üîΩand the reality of the mantra is entered correctly.

original: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags rdzogs pa ni kun rtogs na //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid yang dag 'jug / sngags rdzogs pa ni kun rtogs na //
translated: When the mantra is perfected, the conceptualization,

original: rdo rje bzlas pa slob par 'gyur //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa slob par 'gyur //
translated: one learns vajra repetition.

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: This is stated.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, he says,

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: the stage of perfection, etc.üîΩBy the one who realizes, etc.üîΩ, the yogis of Body-vajra, etc.

original: rtogs bar byed pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po gsum bsgom la /
analyzed: rtogs bar byed pas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sku rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i phyag rgya chen po gsum bsgom la /
translated: , meditate on the three great seals of Vairocana, etc.

original: de'i snying gar aom la sogs pa rang dang thig le'i dbye bas ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dag bsgoms la khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa dang dbyer med par mos nas bdag nyid kyi lus la sogs pa aom la sogs pa la
analyzed: de'i snying gar aom la sogs pa rang dang thig le'i dbye bas ye shes sems dpa' dang ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' dag bsgoms la khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa dang dbyer med par mos nas bdag nyid kyi lus la sogs pa aom la sogs pa la
translated: Having meditated on the gnosis being and the concentration being by the division of the self and the drop at the heart, at the letter o·πÉ and so forth, one should imagine that they are inseparable from the body and so forth of the three realms, and one‚Äôs own body and so forth enter into the o·πÉ and so forth.

original: 'jug ste / aom la sogs pa rang yang thig le tsam la zhugs nas gang gi tshe thig le tsam la gnas pa'i sems su gyur nas de'i tshe sems dbang du gyur pas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug ste / aom la sogs pa rang yang thig le tsam la zhugs nas gang gi tshe thig le tsam la gnas pa'i sems su gyur nas de'i tshe sems dbang du gyur pas rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The o·πÉ and so forth also enter into the mere drop, and when the mind abides in the mere drop, at that time the mind is under control, and one becomes like Great Vajradhara.

original: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni thig la'i rnal 'byor gsum mo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gsum ni thig la'i rnal 'byor gsum mo //
translated: The three concentrations are the three yogas of the drop.

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams las mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsgom pa'o zhes pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i dam tshig rnams las mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditation of the creation stage is said to be supreme among the vows of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so forth.

original: de'i mchog yin pas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i mchog yin pas na rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis so //
translated: Since it is supreme, it is by the concentration of the completion stage.

original: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa dang bdag nyid kyi yang dbyer med par bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum gyi lus la sogs pa dang bdag nyid kyi yang dbyer med par bstan to //
translated: The three vajras and so forth teach the inseparability of the body and so forth of the three realms and one's own.

original: rang gi lus la sogs pa thig le la zhugs pas 'gog pa yang yin la 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis de tsam la gnas pas dam tshig kyang yin te /
analyzed: rang gi lus la sogs pa thig le la zhugs pas 'gog pa yang yin la 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis de tsam la gnas pas dam tshig kyang yin te /
translated: The cessation by the entry of one's own body and so forth into the drop is also a pledge by abiding in that much through the branch of retention.

original: 'gog pa'i dam tshig ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i dam tshig ni thig le'i rnal 'byor ro //
translated: The pledge of cessation is the yoga of the drop.

original: de nyid kyi khyad par ni 'dzin pa ste yan lag bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khyad par ni 'dzin pa ste yan lag bzhi pa'o //
translated: The difference of that is retention, the fourth branch.

original: de gang gis shes pa zhes pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de gang gis shes pa zhes pas ni ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: By who knows that the difference of meditative concentration is taught.

original: tha mal pa'i lus dang bral nas zhes pa ni thig le la zhugs pas mi snang bas so //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i lus dang bral nas zhes pa ni thig le la zhugs pas mi snang bas so //
translated: By free from the ordinary body and so forth, [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.üîΩBy free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.

original: zab cing ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid dam sgyu ma lta bu nyid de //
analyzed: zab cing ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa dbyer med pa'i mtshan nyid dam sgyu ma lta bu nyid de //
translated: By free from the ordinary body [the text] teaches the result of meditative concentration.

original: rgya che ba ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: By free from

original: bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyi lus @43a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid can gyi ye shes kyi lus @43a * //
translated: The body of intuition that is his very self.

original: zhes bya bas rdo rje sku yang gzung bar bya ste nye bar mtshon pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya bas rdo rje sku yang gzung bar bya ste nye bar mtshon pas so //
translated: The vajra body is also to be grasped by this, since it is illustrated by it.

original: de thob cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de thob cing zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary is by ‚Äúhaving attained that‚Äù and so forth.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi rnam grangs can gyi 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis sems brtan par byas la slar yang rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag dag gis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku thob pa gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: thig le'i rnal 'byor gyi rnam grangs can gyi 'dzin pa'i yan lag gis sems brtan par byas la slar yang rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag dag gis rdo rje 'chang chen po'i sku thob pa gnas par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Having stabilized the mind by the branch of retention that is a synonym of the drop yoga, one should again abide in the attainment of the body of Great Vajradhara by the branches of recollection and meditative concentration.

original: don 'di nyid ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This very meaning is the ‚Äúperfection stage.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes pa ni khams gsum dang bdag nyid dbyer med pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgom pas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis zhes pa ni khams gsum dang bdag nyid dbyer med pa'i rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku bsgom pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy another method‚Äù is by meditating on the body of Vairochana, etc., as inseparable from the three realms and oneself.

original: der 'dzin pa ni 'od gsal ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: der 'dzin pa ni 'od gsal ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúGrasping that‚Äù is abiding in clear light.

original: chos dbyings las ni ma ltos pa //
analyzed: chos dbyings las ni ma ltos pa //
translated: Not depending on the realm of reality,

original: chos ni yang dag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni yang dag med pa'o //
translated: Dharma is not real.

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: sku rdo rje zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o //
analyzed: sku rdo rje zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad kyi rang bzhin gyi sku'o //
translated: The body vajra is the body nature of Vairochana.

original: khams gsum gyi lus dang ngag dang sems ni des gcig tu byas pas so ;
analyzed: khams gsum gyi lus dang ngag dang sems ni des gcig tu byas pas so ;
translated: The body, speech, and mind of the three realms are made one by that.

original: / yi ge aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad nye bar gyur nas ye shes kyi sku bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / yi ge aom zhes bya ba la sogs pas thams cad nye bar gyur nas ye shes kyi sku bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the syllable O·πÄ, etc., it is taught that having become all, one should meditate on the wisdom body.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas phan yon bstan to //
translated: By thus, etc., the benefit is taught.

original: bsgom pa 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i rnal 'byor par 'gyur te rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pas so //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'dis sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i rnal 'byor par 'gyur te rdo rje 'chang chen po'i go 'phang thob par byed pas so //
translated: By this meditation, one becomes a yogi who fulfills all the wishes of all sentient beings, because one attains the state of Great Vajradhara.

original: 'khor ba ji srid par ni 'khor ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid par ni 'khor ba'i bar du'o //
translated: For as long as the world exists, for as long as the world exists.

original: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: sku gsum gyi bdag nyid can zhes bya ba la sogs pas nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: By the three bodies, etc., the summary is taught.

original: ting nge 'dzin gnyis po ni gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin dag go //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gnyis po ni gsung dang thugs rdo rje'i ting nge 'dzin dag go //
translated: The two samadhis are the samadhis of vajra speech and mind.

original: sku rdo rje la sogs pas zhes ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sku rdo rje la sogs pas zhes ba ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: With body vajra, etc., means with Vairochana, etc.

original: 'gro ba'i don ni sems can gyi don to //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i don ni sems can gyi don to //
translated: The purpose of beings is the purpose of sentient beings.

original: rtog cing zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pas 'di skad bka' stsal to //
analyzed: rtog cing zhes pa la sogs pas bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen po drug pas 'di skad bka' stsal to //
translated: With imagining, etc., the Bhagavat, the sixth Vajradhara, said this.

original: zhes nye bar bsdus pa 'dzin pa'i yan lag rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes nye bar bsdus pa 'dzin pa'i yan lag rdzogs pa'i rim pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, the branch of retention is summarized. The completion stage is taught.

original: rnal 'byor pa gnyis po zhes pa ni brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa gnyis po zhes pa ni brtag pa dang rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two yogis are those with the characteristics of the creation and completion stages.

original: gsang ba 'dus pa'i dbang bskur gyi cho gas dbang thob pa zhes pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur la sogs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: gsang ba 'dus pa'i dbang bskur gyi cho gas dbang thob pa zhes pa ni rig pa'i dbang bskur la sogs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Having obtained empowerment through the empowerment ritual of the Guhyasamaja means having obtained the knowledge empowerment, etc.

original: gnang ba thob pa ni bla ma dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: gnang ba thob pa ni bla ma dang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: Having obtained permission means having been permitted by the guru and the tathagatas.

original: phyin chad @43b nas brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig nyan pa'am 'chad pa 'am rang slob pa de dag thams cad rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sgom pa po la gang yang the tshom med do zhes bstan to
analyzed: phyin chad @43b nas brtsams zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang zhig nyan pa'am 'chad pa 'am rang slob pa de dag thams cad rdo rje 'chang chen po dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bas sgom pa po la gang yang the tshom med do zhes bstan to
translated: From now on, etc. , indicates that all those who listen, explain, or learn by themselves become like Great Vajradhara, and thus the meditator has no doubt whatsoever.

original: // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sa bon yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ni aom la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sa bon yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sngags ni aom la sogs pa'o //
translated: Since it is the seed of all Tathagatas, the mantra of all Tathagatas is om and so forth.

original: des bskyed pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i rim pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: des bskyed pa ni dang po sbyor ba'i rim pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: Generated by that, it is generated by the stage of the first union.

original: 'od gsal ba yin pas de kho na nyid kyang yin la ma rig pa bcom pas na rig pa yang yin no //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba yin pas de kho na nyid kyang yin la ma rig pa bcom pas na rig pa yang yin no //
translated: Since it is clear light, it is reality, and since it conquers ignorance, it is also knowledge.

original: de kho na nyid rig pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid rig pa ni 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of reality is clear light.

original: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: de nyid shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin ma ste stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: That itself is Prajnaparamita, since it is the essence of emptiness.

original: de las yang dag par byung ba zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa nyid las ldang ba'o //
analyzed: de las yang dag par byung ba zhes pa ni bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa nyid las ldang ba'o //
translated: The phrase arisen from that means that [the deity] arises from the stage of self-consecration.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, [the BhagavƒÅn] declares,

original: ye shes kyi dam tshig yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi dam tshig yin pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the pledge of pristine consciousness.

original: ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pas mchog ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sku'i rang bzhin yin pas mchog ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i ngo bo yin pas so //
translated: Since it is the nature of the pristine consciousness body, it is supreme, and since it is the essence of the completion stage, it is the supreme of all.

original: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba byas te /
analyzed: de nas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba byas te /
translated: Then, beginning with the phrase thereupon, all the tathƒÅgatas, [the BhagavƒÅn] summarizes the retention of the activities,

original: sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid can gyi le'u'i don bstan pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi sku dang ye shes kyi sku'i mtshan nyid can gyi le'u'i don bstan pa yin pas so //
translated: because he teaches the meaning of the chapter that has the characteristics of the mantra body and the pristine consciousness body.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas de kho na nyid so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The phrase intentional explanation means that the reality is taught individually through contradictory words.

original: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'ik'a las le'u bcu gcig pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
analyzed: sgron ma gsal bar byed pa'i 'grel pa'i t'ik'a las le'u bcu gcig pa'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the explanation of the eleventh chapter in the commentary called the Illuminating Lamp.

original: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gnyis kyi bshad pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas le'u bcu gnyis kyi bshad pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yis tha mal pa'i lus ldog pa dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i skus mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnam par dag pa zhes pa ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sku yis tha mal pa'i lus ldog pa dang / sa'i snying po la sogs pa'i skus mig la sogs pa rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the purification of the path of action is that the ordinary body is reversed by the body of Vairochana, etc. and that the eyes, etc. are purified by the body of Kshitigarbha, etc.

original: phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba smos pa la phyag rgya chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba smos pa la phyag rgya chen po ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The transformation of the great seal is mentioned. The great seal is of two kinds:

original: 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang sku'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid dang sku'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the nature of clear light and the nature of the body.

original: de la phyag rgya chen po 'od gsal ba las rim pa gsum pa dang rim pa lnga pa dag gis cig car du langs pa ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la phyag rgya chen po 'od gsal ba las rim pa gsum pa dang rim pa lnga pa dag gis cig car du langs pa ni yongs su 'gyur ba ste phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The simultaneous arising from the great seal of clear light by the three stages and the five stages is the transformation, and is called the transformation of the great seal.

original: yang na phyag rgya chen po ni 'od gsal ba las yongs su gyur pa ni rim pa dang po dang gsum pas @44a * //
analyzed: yang na phyag rgya chen po ni 'od gsal ba las yongs su gyur pa ni rim pa dang po dang gsum pas @44a * //
translated: Or else, the great seal is the transformation from clear light, which is the first and third stages.üîΩ

original: thob pa'i sku thim pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thob pa'i sku thim pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Or else, the Great Seal is the transformation from the clear light, and the body obtained by the first and third stages dissolves, which is called the ‚Äútransformation of the Great Seal.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir le'u bcu gnyis pa ste nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don bstan pa'i phyir le'u bcu gnyis pa ste nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the twelfth chapter is taught for the sake of such a meaning, and it is an illustration.

original: gzhan 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub so sor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i dngos grub so sor bstan pa'o //
translated: The individual teachings of the powers of the wheel-holder and so forth.

original: ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa'i sgo nas 'dul bar mdzad pas so //
analyzed: ston par mdzad pas na zhes pa ni dam tshig dang sdom pa'i sgo nas 'dul bar mdzad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause he is the teacher‚Äù means that he is the one who tames through the door of the vows and samayas.

original: 'byin pa bo yin pas na skyed pa po rin po che lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'byin pa bo yin pas na skyed pa po rin po che lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause he is the producer‚Äù means that he is the producer who is like a jewel.

original: gang zag gi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: gang zag gi zhes pa ni dbang po rno ba'i sems can rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe person‚Äù is the sentient beings of sharp faculties.

original: de rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i rdo rje'i sku la'o //
analyzed: de rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la zhes pa ni zung du 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i rdo rje'i sku la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the vajra-like samadhi‚Äù means in the body of the vajra, called ‚Äúunion.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes pa ni rdo rje 'chang chen po gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin yin pas so //
translated: The ultimate truth is the nature of the nondual intuition of Great Vajradhara.

original: de ni de'i rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: de ni de'i rgyu mtshan no //
translated: That is the reason for it.

original: rdo rje gsung zhes pa ni gsung nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i tshig gi tshogs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje gsung zhes pa ni gsung nyid rdo rje ste mi phyed pa'i tshig gi tshogs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Vajra Speech is speech itself, which is a vajra, because it is the nature of an indivisible collection of words.üîΩSpace is the explanation of the void, etc.

original: mkha' ni go 'byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa'i dngos po yin na yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkha' ni go 'byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas rang bzhin gyis ngo bo med pa'i dngos po yin na yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is a thing that is naturally devoid of essence, it performs the welfare of the various kinds of sentient beings.

original: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos sku'i rnam pa la sogs pa sprul pa mdzad do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'chang chen pos sku'i rnam pa la sogs pa sprul pa mdzad do //
translated: The Blessed One, Great Vajradhara, emanates the forms of body, etc.

original: zhes bstan te /üîΩji ltar chu klung dangs pa las //
analyzed: zhes bstan te / ji ltar chu klung dangs pa las //
translated: This is taught.üîΩJust as fish quickly leap

original: nya dag myur du ldang ba bzhin //
analyzed: nya dag myur du ldang ba bzhin //
translated: from a clear river,

original: de bzhin thams cad stong gsal las //
analyzed: de bzhin thams cad stong gsal las //
translated: so from the clear void of everything

original: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgyu 'phrul dra ba 'byung bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: the net of illusions arises.

original: des ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don gyi dbye ba gcig bshad do //
analyzed: des ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don gyi dbye ba gcig bshad do //
translated: This explains one division of the meaning of ‚Äúthe transformation of the great seal.‚Äù

original: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pa ma yin pas bshad pa'o zhes pa ni shin tu gsal ba'i de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Non-intentional‚Äù means that it teaches the reality that is very clear.

original: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni de bzhin 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams so //
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces pa ni de bzhin 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú All powers‚Äù means mundane and supramundane powers.

original: dgon pa chen po'i sa phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: dgon pa chen po'i sa phyogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: ‚Äú A place in a great forest‚Äù and so on are easy to understand.

original: drang pa'i don to zhes pa ni gnas tsam so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: drang pa'i don to zhes pa ni gnas tsam so sor bstan pas so //
translated: ‚Äú The provisional meaning‚Äù means that it teaches just the place individually.

original: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa 'dis sku gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lung gi bshad pa brjod par bya ste zhes pa 'dis sku gsum thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: ‚Äú The explanation of the scriptures should be stated‚Äù teaches that one should meditate in order to attain the three bodies.

original: nam mkhar rtag pa ni 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkhar rtag pa ni 'od gsal ba mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Always in the sky‚Äù means manifesting the clear light.

original: sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni de dang 'brel bas so //
analyzed: sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni de dang 'brel bas so //
translated: ‚Äú By means of union‚Äù means by means of the union with that.

original: phung po ni tha mal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams stong pa nyid la rjes su zhugs pas dgon pa chen po'i sgra @44b bstan to //
analyzed: phung po ni tha mal ba'i gzugs la sogs pa gang yin pa de rnams stong pa nyid la rjes su zhugs pas dgon pa chen po'i sgra @44b bstan to //
translated: The aggregates are the ordinary forms and so forth. They are the great forest, because they are the domain of the emptiness of inherent existence.

original: gnas med pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i 'od gsal ba la'o //
analyzed: gnas med pa ni dmigs pa med pa'i 'od gsal ba la'o //
translated: The place is the clear light, which is the absence of the object of the grasping at inherent existence.

original: gnas pa'i sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni de la gnas pa'i sbyor bas gnas chen po ni sa phyogs yin zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa'i sbyor ba yis zhes pa ni de la gnas pa'i sbyor bas gnas chen po ni sa phyogs yin zhes bstan to //
translated: The application of abiding is the application of abiding in that place. The great place is the stage of a buddha.

original: des ni chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni chos kyi sku bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: Similarly, the Enjoyment Body is the Enjoyment Body.

original: de nyid shing ni dpag bsam gyi shing ngo //üîΩdngos grub sna tshogs me tog ldan pa ni des brgyan pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid shing ni dpag bsam gyi shing ngo // dngos grub sna tshogs me tog ldan pa ni des brgyan pa ste /
translated: That itself is the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa thams cad rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is adorned with the flowers of various accomplishments, because it fulfills the wishes of all sentient beings.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The perfect enlightenment is the Dharma Body.

original: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de nyid mi g-yo ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: That itself is immovable.

original: / de'i sprul pa gang yin pa de rnams 'gro ba la phan thogs pa'i phyir 'bras bu ste de rnams kyis yang dag par brgyan pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: / de'i sprul pa gang yin pa de rnams 'gro ba la phan thogs pa'i phyir 'bras bu ste de rnams kyis yang dag par brgyan pa ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'o //
translated: The enjoyment body is adorned with those.

original: des ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: des ni longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis bstan to //
translated: By that, the enjoyment body and the emanation body are taught.

original: dngos med ni de ltar gyur pa'i chos kyi sku sku gnyis po'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos med ni de ltar gyur pa'i chos kyi sku sku gnyis po'i gzhir gyur pa'o //
translated: The non-entity is the dharma body, which is the basis of those two bodies.

original: rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas dben pa dang nyams dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa thams cad dang bral bas dben pa dang nyams dga' ba'o //
translated: It is isolated and delightful, because it is free from all conceptualization.

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The vajra is reality, which has the characteristic of the transformation of the great seal.

original: der bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ni de bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: der bsgrub bya zhes bya ba ni de bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The object of attainment is that which is to be attained there.

original: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to zhes pa ni sku gsum gyi bdag nyid kyi rdo rje 'chang gi de kho na nyid bstan pas so //
translated: The definitive meaning is because of the teaching of the reality of Vajradhara, who has the nature of the three bodies.

original: mam yig mtshon pa'i bsnyen pa yin pas na dpe zhes pa ni dpe bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mam yig mtshon pa'i bsnyen pa yin pas na dpe zhes pa ni dpe bstan pa'o //
translated: The example is the teaching of the example, because it is the means of attaining the reality of Vajradhara, which is indicated by the syllable mam.

original: 'og nas bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'og nas bshad pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúconcentration‚Äù explained below is the nature of the transformation of the Great Seal.

original: ston pa'i sa bon no zhes pa ni de rjod par byed pa'i yi ge'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i sa bon no zhes pa ni de rjod par byed pa'i yi ge'o //
translated: The ‚Äúseed of the Teacher‚Äù is the syllable that expresses it.

original: yid kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid de stong pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yid kyi rang bzhin gyis zhes pa ni sems kyi chos nyid de stong pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the nature of mind‚Äù is the reality of the mind, i.e., emptiness.

original: bsten cing bsnyen pa yin pas na zhes pa la bsgom par bya bas so //
analyzed: bsten cing bsnyen pa yin pas na zhes pa la bsgom par bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the practice‚Äù is by means of the meditation.

original: mi phyed pa nyid pas ni zhes pa la gnyis pa med pa yin pas so //
analyzed: mi phyed pa nyid pas ni zhes pa la gnyis pa med pa yin pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the indivisibility‚Äù is by means of the non-duality.

original: rdo rje 'jam pa rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jam pa rab tu bsgom par bya'o zhes pa la sogs pas 'od gsal ba las 'byung ba'i ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should meditate on the vajra of the gentle splendor‚Äù and so forth teaches the vajra body that arises from the clear light gnosis body.

original: rang gi lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes kyi sku bstan to //
analyzed: rang gi lus la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum dang dbyer med pa'i ye shes kyi sku bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own body‚Äù and so forth teaches the gnosis body that is inseparable from the three realms.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku gzung bas 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhes @45a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi sku gzung bas 'jam pa'i rdo rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur zhes @45a * //
translated: Then, etc. means that by grasping the wisdom body, one becomes like Manjushri Vajra.

original: 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The result is taught.

original: dpag tshad brgya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku dag gis thams cad snang bar byed pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: dpag tshad brgya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku dang rdo rje'i sku dag gis thams cad snang bar byed pa nyid bstan te /
translated: By a hundred leagues, etc. it is taught that by the wisdom body and the vajra body, everything is illuminated,

original: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one acts for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: skyes bu chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: By great being, etc. it is taught that one has the perfection of all aspects.

original: sgyu ma lta bu'i sku mnga' bas na zhes pa la sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa yin pas so //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu'i sku mnga' bas na zhes pa la sgyu ma'i dpe bcu gnyis kyis nye bar mtshon pa yin pas so //
translated: Because one possesses an illusory body, it is said that it is illustrated by the twelve examples of illusion.

original: des 'di ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku tshangs pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des 'di ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ye shes kyi sku tshangs pa la sogs pa'i spyod yul ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: By thus, etc. it is taught that the wisdom body is not the domain of Brahma, etc.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sa bcu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes pa ni sa bcu thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it is the domain of the irreversible. This means that it is the domain of the bodhisattvas who have attained the ten stages.

original: gang gi phyir sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sa bcu la rab tu gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems rnam par dag pa dang bdag la byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pas sa bcu la rab tu gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the mind becomes well-established in the ten stages through the process of purifying the mind and self-consecration.

original: de bas na ye shes kyi sku ni phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ye shes kyi sku ni phyir mi ldog pa'i spyod yul yin no //
translated: Therefore, the body of wisdom is the domain of the irreversible.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: dang po las kyi sbyor ba yis //
analyzed: dang po las kyi sbyor ba yis //
translated: By the initial application of action,

original: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the eighth stage.

original: snang ba gsum po mthong ba yis //üîΩsa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
analyzed: snang ba gsum po mthong ba yis // sa bcu la ni rab tu gnas //
translated: By seeing the three appearances,

original: zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: one becomes well-established in the ten stages.

original: rdo rje 'jam pa mchog gi dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'jam pa mchog gi dam tshig ces bya ba la sogs pas ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The summary of the samadhi is taught by the supreme commitment of Vajra Amrta and so forth.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po 'od gsal ba la yongs su 'gyur ba ni ye shes kyi sku thim par bya'o zhes don gnyis pa'i dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyag rgya chen po 'od gsal ba la yongs su 'gyur ba ni ye shes kyi sku thim par bya'o zhes don gnyis pa'i dbye ba bshad par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: By the nature of illusion, etc., the transformation of the great seal into clearlight is explained as the entry of the exalted-knowledge-being into clearlight.

original: yul dang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag gis ye shes kyi sku yang 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: yul dang dbang po zhes bya ba la sogs pas ril por 'dzin pa dang rjes su gzhig pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag gis ye shes kyi sku yang 'od gsal ba la 'jug par bstan to //
translated: By the object and the sense-faculty, etc., the entry of the exalted-knowledge-being into clearlight is explained by the meditative stabilizations of totality and disintegration.

original: de ldang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de las gcig spros pa'i rdo rje'i sku gzung bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ldang bar gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas de las gcig spros pa'i rdo rje'i sku gzung bar bstan to //
translated: By arising from that, etc., the retention of the vajra-body of emanation is explained.

original: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas bshad pa zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i tshig gi sgo nas ting nge 'dzin so sor bstan pas so //
translated: The intentional explanation is by means of contradictory words, each of which teaches a meditative stabilization.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur ba'i sgo nas bstan nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bsgrubüîΩpar bya @45b pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin phyag rgya chen po yongs su gyur ba'i sgo nas bstan nas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya @45b pa'i phyir bshad par bya ste zhes bstan to //
translated: Having taught the vajra-like samadhi by way of the transformation of the great seal, in order to accomplish the wheel knowledge-mantra bearer, etc., which are the nature of the five Tathagatas, Vairochana, etc., he teaches, I will explain.üîΩFirst, having actualized the samadhi of Vairochana, etc.

original: dang por rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba'i rim pas so zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dang por rnam par snang mdzad kyi ting nge 'dzin mngon du byas la zhes pa ni phyag rgya chen po yongs su 'gyur ba'i rim pas so zhes tshig lhag ma'o //
translated: means by the process of the transformation of the great seal, is the remainder of the sentence.üîΩWheel, etc.

original: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdun du yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pas 'od zer 'bar ba spro bar bsgoms te /
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdun du yi ge aom yongs su gyur pa las bskyed pa 'khor lo rtsibs brgyad bsgom pa sngon du 'gro ba de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad zhugs pas 'od zer 'bar ba spro bar bsgoms te /
translated: means that having meditated on the wheel with eight spokes generated from the transformation of the syllable Om in front, one meditates on the emanation of blazing light rays by the entry of all Tathagatas.

original: dro ba dang du ba dang 'bar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtags gsum mthong bas rang gi lag bas blangs te 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dro ba dang du ba dang 'bar ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rtags gsum mthong bas rang gi lag bas blangs te 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: By seeing the three signs of warmth, smoke, and flame, one should take it with one's hand and become a wheel-holder vidyadhara who moves through space.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid kyi che ba bstan to //
translated: Thus, and so forth, teaches the greatness of the nature of the wheel-holder vidyadhara.

original: mthu ni kun gyi dbang phyug nyid do //
analyzed: mthu ni kun gyi dbang phyug nyid do //
translated: Power is the lordship of all.

original: rdul phra rab ji snyed pa zhes pa la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i dpes de'i de dang 'dra ba 'khor gyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdul phra rab ji snyed pa zhes pa la sogs pa mtha' yas pa'i dpes de'i de dang 'dra ba 'khor gyi phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: As many atoms, and so forth, with infinite examples, teaches the perfection of the retinue that is like that.

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kyi nus pa mi 'jigs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pas de rnams kyi nus pa mi 'jigs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: All, and so forth, teaches the power of those to be fearless.

original: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa li ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'khor lo'i rig pa 'dzin pa li ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: Samadhi, and so forth, teaches the gathering of the samadhi of the wheel-holder vidyadhara.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste zhes pa ni de'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi rnal 'byor dang 'dra bar blta bar bya ste zhes pa ni de'i bskyed pa'i rim pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: One should view it as similar to the yoga of Vairocana. This is the cultivation of its creation stage.

original: yi ge h'um ni mi bskyod pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: yi ge h'um ni mi bskyod pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The syllable h≈´·πÉ is the seed of Ak·π£obhya.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la /
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las rtse lnga pa'i rdo rje bsgoms la /
translated: From that, one should cultivate the five-tined vajra.

original: dro ba la sogs pa'i rtags gsum mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba de blangs nas rdo rje'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dro ba la sogs pa'i rtags gsum mthong ba sngon du 'gro ba de blangs nas rdo rje'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: Having taken that, preceded by the three signs of warmth, etc., one becomes a vajra awareness holder who moves through space.

original: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug tu zhes pa ni bud med thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i dbang phyug tu zhes pa ni bud med thams cad kyis yongs su bskor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As for ‚Äúlord of desire,‚Äù it is because one is surrounded by all women.

original: drag po zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum pas mchod par bya ba rnams kyis kyang mchod byar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: drag po zhes bya ba la sogs pas khams gsum pas mchod par bya ba rnams kyis kyang mchod byar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: With ‚ÄúRudra,‚Äù etc., it is taught that one becomes an object of worship even by those who are worshipped by the three worlds.

original: rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' yas pa'i lhan cig spyod ma dang ldan pa'i rdo rje'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'chang chen por 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas mtha' yas pa'i lhan cig spyod ma dang ldan pa'i rdo rje'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase one becomes a great Vajradhara and so forth indicates the meditative absorption of a vajra awareness-holder who is endowed with limitless attendant goddesses.

original: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bsgom pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: 'od dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bsgom pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The phrase one becomes AmitƒÅbha and so forth indicates the cultivation of a lotus awareness-holder.

original: yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i rtags gsum gyis mtshon pa sngon du 'gro ba blangs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yi ge aa yongs su gyur pa las padma'i rtags gsum gyis mtshon pa sngon du 'gro ba blangs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase one becomes a lotus awareness-holder who soars in space indicates that by taking up the lotus awareness-holder who is preceded by the three signs of the lotus that arise from the transformation of the letter A, one becomes a lotus awareness-holder who soars in space.

original: thabs kyi ngo bo nyid dang zhes pa ni @46a * //
analyzed: thabs kyi ngo bo nyid dang zhes pa ni @46a * //
translated: The phrase the essence of method indicates

original: skyes pa'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rnam pa can no //
translated: the form of a man.

original: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid dang zhes pa ni bud med kyi gzugs can no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid dang zhes pa ni bud med kyi gzugs can no //
translated: The phrase the essence of wisdom indicates the form of a woman.

original: de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bran pho dang bran mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa'i padma'i rigs las byung ba thams cad kyis te rang gi rgyal srid la dbang bskur bar bya ba dang
analyzed: de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas pho nya dang pho nya mo dang bran pho dang bran mo dang bka' nyan dang bka' nyan mo la sogs pa'i padma'i rigs las byung ba thams cad kyis te rang gi rgyal srid la dbang bskur bar bya ba dang
translated: The them and so forth indicates that all those born in the lotus family, such as messengers, messenger women, male servants, female servants, male attendants, female attendants, and so forth, will be consecrated in one's kingdom

original: / 'khor gyi tshul du gnas pa de rnams kyis kyang yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: / 'khor gyi tshul du gnas pa de rnams kyis kyang yongs su bskor bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: and will also be surrounded by those who abide in the retinue.

original: padma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: padma'i rigs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas padma'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i ting nge 'dzin nye bar bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The endowed with the lotus family and so forth indicates the summary of the lotus knowledge-holder concentration.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi sku gsung thugs kyi rang bzhin du rnal 'byor par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The all tathƒÅgatas and so forth indicates that the practitioner will become the nature of the body, speech, and mind of all tathƒÅgatas.

original: 'od zer lnga dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du don yod grub pa sngon du 'gro bar mdun du yi ge kham las byung ba'i ral gri dro ba la sogs pa rtags gsum sngon du 'gro ba mthong nas blangs te /
analyzed: 'od zer lnga dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas snga ma bzhin du don yod grub pa sngon du 'gro bar mdun du yi ge kham las byung ba'i ral gri dro ba la sogs pa rtags gsum sngon du 'gro ba mthong nas blangs te /
translated: The five light rays and so forth, as before, indicates that one should take up the sword, having seen the three signs, such as the heat, and so forth, arisen from the syllable kham in front, preceded by Amoghasiddhi.

original: lha dang lha ma yin gyi bdag po'i gtso bo ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa nam mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: lha dang lha ma yin gyi bdag po'i gtso bo ral gri'i rig pa 'dzin pa nam mkha' la spyod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: One becomes a master of the gods and demigods, a knowledge-woman of the sword, who moves in space, it is taught.

original: lhag pa dang chad ba med par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas so ;
analyzed: lhag pa dang chad ba med par zhes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rang bzhin yin pas so ;
translated: Without remainder or deficiency means that it is the nature of the five transcendent ones.

original: ; rang gi sngags las zhes pa ni dam tshig rdo rje'i sa bon yi ge kham las so //
analyzed: ; rang gi sngags las zhes pa ni dam tshig rdo rje'i sa bon yi ge kham las so //
translated: From one's mantra means from the seed syllable of the pledge-vajra, the syllable kham.

original: sgrub pa po yis ni dngos grub mthong bas mig rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po yis ni dngos grub mthong bas mig rgyas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The practitioner means that the eyes are expanded by seeing the spiritual powers.

original: lag gis blangs pa'o zhes pa ni rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas so //
analyzed: lag gis blangs pa'o zhes pa ni rtags mthong ba sngon du 'gro bas so //
translated: One takes it up with the hand means that one does so preceded by seeing the signs.

original: phyag rgya chen po ste zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku rnams de'i sgo nas de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ste zhes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa'i sku rnams de'i sgo nas de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The ‚Äúgreat seal‚Äù is the forms of the TathƒÅgata and so on, as desired.

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba'i zhes pa ni //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba'i zhes pa ni //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat wonder-workers‚Äù

original: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba bzhi ste /
translated: are the four world-emperors,

original: gser dang dngul dang zangs dang lcags //üîΩ'khor lo ldan pa 'khor los sgyur //
analyzed: gser dang dngul dang zangs dang lcags // 'khor lo ldan pa 'khor los sgyur //

original: zhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas so //

analyzed: tshangs pa'i gtso bo dang zhes pa ni drag po dang khyab 'jug dang dbyig gi snying po la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúChief of BrahmƒÅ‚Äù refers to Rudra, Vi·π£·πáu, Vasudatta, and so on.

analyzed: lha ma yin gyi gtso bo zhes pa ni rnam par 'jig la sogs pa'o //

original: de dag gis kyang phyag byas par 'gyur ba dang zhes pa ni lha dang lha ma yin gyi dam pa @46b rnams kyis phyag btsal bar bya ba dam pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis kyang phyag byas par 'gyur ba dang zhes pa ni lha dang lha ma yin gyi dam pa @46b rnams kyis phyag btsal bar bya ba dam pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúThey will also pay homage‚Äù means that they will pay homage to the supreme among gods and demigods.

original: der bdag por gyur pas so zhes pa ni de la dbang byed pas so //
analyzed: der bdag por gyur pas so zhes pa ni de la dbang byed pas so //
translated: The phrase because it is the master of that means that it is the master of that [body].

analyzed: tha mal pa'i sgrub pa la gnas pa'o zhes pa ni bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnal 'byor pa rnams so //

original: de rnams kyi nang du cho 'phrul gyi khyad par bstan pas na gtso bo'o /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nang du cho 'phrul gyi khyad par bstan pas na gtso bo'o /
